author: {'steamid': '76561197968578135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 52, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1710003747}
review:
I'm having an hard time putting the game into a category but if I had to chose, the closest match would be "Visual Novel" (a pretty basic one).
This is a game where you assume the role of a monster, get into situations and chose what you do for each of them.
Your choices influence the outcome and the story.
Although you can make "evil" choices, I perceive the game as being kind of ... wholesome? It's hard to describe.

It is said that finishing the game 100% takes about 6 hours. I guess I'm not very good at it because I have very few achievements after 5.7 hours.

Still, it was a nice experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027102438', 'num_games_owned': 1328, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1706969361}
review:
Not to say that this is a bad game, but this really leans heavily towards visual novel of some sorts.
I'm not necessarily against the genre, but personally the story didn't click much for me, when  I found myself skipping through lines more and more I just figured this is not for me.
The general style is really cute, so you may still want to give it a chance if you're into a 'virtual life' and 'choose your own adventure' kind of thing, but I just didn't feel like I was getting towards caring for the story or characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998543056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1565701050}
review:
[b] Title: A Heartwarming Adventure with Real Consequences! [/b]

Review:

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Monster Loves You! is a delightful journey where your choices truly matter. From guiding your adorable monster's development to shaping the entire narrative, every decision has real consequences, leading to multiple branching storylines and endings. The charming art style, coupled with a catchy soundtrack, creates an immersive experience that appeals to all ages.

The game's strength lies in its ability to teach important life lessons through the interactive choices players make. It encourages empathy, kindness, and understanding, making it an ideal choice for families. The whimsical world and colorful characters are brought to life with adorable illustrations, adding to the overall charm.

What sets Monster Loves You! apart is its replayability factor. The multitude of choices ensures that each playthrough offers a fresh and engaging experience. Whether you're cultivating a compassionate monster or embracing a mischievous one, the game adapts to your decisions, providing a sense of agency and impact on the storyline.

The soundtrack enhances the game's tone, creating a delightful atmosphere that complements the whimsical visuals. The combination of these elements makes every moment in the monster world memorable and enjoyable.

In conclusion, Monster Loves You! is a heartwarming adventure where your choices matter. With its adorable visuals, catchy soundtrack, and valuable life lessons, it's a must-play for those seeking a positive and replayable gaming experience. Dive into the monster world and discover the magic of friendship and consequence!

[b] [i] TL;DR: Monster Loves You! offers a heartwarming adventure where your choices matter, impacting the narrative and leading to multiple endings. With its adorable visuals, catchy soundtrack, and valuable life lessons, it's a must-play for those seeking a positive and replayable gaming experience. [/i] [/b]


[b]In the dim-lit recesses of the Steam sprawl, I chanced upon a game that spoke in hushed tones of the supernatural underworld – "Monster Loves You!" A digital realm where monstrous decisions bore the weight of a leaden conscience in the stillness of night.

The visuals struck me with the precision of a well-oiled revolver – sharp and unyielding. The grotesque choreography of creatures and the raw, unfiltered art formed a world where monsters transcended mere denizens of the night; they became damned souls clawing for survival in the asphalt jungle.

Choices, in this digital noir, were not mere options; they were wagers in a high-stakes poker game. Each decision sent ripples through the narrative, akin to the echoes of gunshots reverberating through an abandoned warehouse. Would one embrace the darkness as a ruthless fiend, or tread the path of a misunderstood creature yearning for redemption? The dichotomy ensnared me, pulling me into a realm where morality was an elusive, shifting beast.

The soundtrack, a haunting melody that permeated the essence of the game, formed a symphony of despair echoing through the twisted alleyways of this virtual city. It set the stage for a narrative that delved into the recesses of the monstrous psyche.

This wasn't a mere tale; it was a descent into the abyss, a journey through the fog-choked streets of moral ambiguity. The plot unfolded as a mosaic of gritty choices, cutting through the digital haze like a switchblade in the hands of a desperate soul. Consequences were relentless, stalking like shadows in the dimly lit corners of the narrative.

"Monster Loves You!" transcends the realm of a mere game; it is a dark odyssey. A plunge into the unknown, where the line between monstrous and human blurs like the dissipating smoke from a snub-nosed revolver. A story that seizes one by the throat, refusing release until every bitter drop of its narrative is savored.

To fellow gamers and inhabitants of the digital underworld, if an appetite exists for a game that orchestrates a heartbeat in rhythm with a city's nocturnal pulse, consider "Monster Loves You!" It is a journey through the twisted landscapes of morality, where monsters love, monsters hate, and destiny is shaped by the razor edge of gritty decisions. A digital noir opus that will linger in memory long after the echoes of the narrative have dissipated into the abyss.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198108261028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1704746986}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198007620218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1487, 'last_played': 1699072298}
review:
I really love this game. It always makes me feel happy. Where else can you get that in life for such a reasonable price? 

The graphics look cute, like something you might see on Sesame Street. Now, imagine Grover decides to murder and eat a baby. You get to do that in the game! You can also be a kindly monster (like the less evil Grover you normally see). You get to shape your destiny by your actions. 

Replay value depends on how you decide to play things, though you do get a choice in the missions you execute. But, certain "badges" are earned in the game, and I don't think playing it exactly the same way every time will mean a different ending. 

But, there's still so much to love about the game. It's realistic and far out, silly and serious, all at the same time. Be the monster you were meant to be!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2104, 'num_reviews': 1248, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1563493035}

author: {'steamid': '76561198415792618', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1686171562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090301474', 'num_games_owned': 1729, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1685758119}
review:
中评中评中评！重要的事请说三遍。

与其说是游戏不如说是可以选择故事走向的纯文字故事书，但是因为重复度较高，虽然有很多结局但是重复可玩性其实不强。

第一遍认真玩通了之后就没有太多兴趣了，但是作为成就党还是跟着攻略把结局都打了一遍拿了全成就走人。

顺便一提，这游戏的存档比较特殊不是以文件形式保存而是保存在注册表里，在注册表编辑器里面找到以下路径然后右键导出就可以备份，然后双击导出的注册表文件执行就可以用备份的存档覆盖现存档了。

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Radial Games Corp.\Monster Loves You!\

review:
I really liked this game, it's cute and entertaining. The monsters' society is both funny and weird from a human perspective but that's what's good about it. There are a lot of different endings and possible dialogues and even if I played more than 20 times, I don't think I'm done with reading them all.
Drawback is the inability to save.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975607244', 'num_games_owned': 2352, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1455968023}
review:
In Monster Loves You!, players take on the role of a monster and make choices that shape the story and the monster's personality. The game features a branching narrative structure, with players making decisions that affect the story and the monster's relationships with other characters.

One of the standout features of Monster Loves You! is its cute and charming art style, which is reminiscent of children's picture books. The game's characters are adorable and well-designed, and the story is heartwarming and fun. The branching narrative structure allows for replayability and ensures that no two playthroughs are the same.

Overall, Monster Loves You! is a delightful and fun narrative-based game that is suitable for all ages. Its charming art style and heartwarming story make it a joy to play, and the branching narrative structure adds replay value. If you're a fan of narrative-based games or are looking for a cute and fun experience, you'll definitely want to give Monster Loves You! a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160612189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1662282823}
review:
This game is very cute and charming and I enjoy playing through it every few months, but the text can be a little repetitive and the text parts are only indicated by symbols, so it's difficult to discern what you have already read. 

I still like the game for it's interesting premise and charming story, though it may not be for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005439390', 'num_games_owned': 987, 'num_reviews': 1264, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1661874477}
review: This is actually a really nice idea. It's basically a VERY choice heavy VN. Most VN's will give you a choice about once every hour, if they have choices at all. This one fires them at you non-stop like a machine gun. It's basically one choice every sentence. There appear to be a huge number of endings, and a huge number of possible routs through the game. It's a shame that there isn't more like this. This game definitely deserves more attention, if only as an interesting concept that seems to have fallen by the wayside.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963583718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1660973517}
review:
Going to give this is a very marginal positive review because of the excellent aesthetic, interface and fast-paced play. But I can honestly recommend this only if:
1) you get this for $1-2 on sale. The list price of $10 is not worth it.
2) you are studying or teaching English.
3) you're buying this for a child who likes reading.
4) you are really interested in Choose-Your-Own-Adventure style text games with many multiple endings.
5) You don't expect more than a few hours of play.

review:
Back in 2014, when I still was a child, I remembered playing this game and enjoying it a lot. 

Every now and then I look into my steam library old games, and this game always spark some good old memories of a long gone past. For some reason, the art and the writing really stuck in my head, even though I just finished it once as a child.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144427989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1526996740}
review: An adorable little game that I'll admit I only found due to an old Steam Train episode, MLY is a great choice game with many interesting paths to take that can lead to vastly different outcomes for your little guy. Will you be kind or scary? You will go through the monsters whole life and guide them to the life you see fit. Lots of replayability here and many hours to spend exploring those options. A good little recommend for this quaint game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045648963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1634573287}
review: Pretty much a story-driven game. You play as a monster, grow up and make choices. Those choices effect the ultimate direction of the game. There is like three major variations or so in the story, at least from what I have run into playing it. There isn't any actual interaction beyond choosing the lines. It's basically a virtual novel. If you're into that thing, awesome. if you want actual gameplay..ehh.. Also! It plays out like a kids game so if you have kids it might be good for them, for me it's lacking in all that much of anything even closely worth $10. I would say if you can get this for a $1 or less(like me as I snagged it in a bundle a while back.) it might be worthwhile. It has SOME replayability but the stories just were not that engaging and the game doesn't have enough unique stuff going for it to make me want to play it anymore than I already have. Gave it a chance but have to say I really just didn't like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057885745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1629681340}
review: Revisited this game in 2021 after not playing since 2016.  Happy to report the game still works and still holds its charms!  Took me about nine hours to get all of the achievements.  For ten bucks the game might seem a little expensive, but there are lots of story bits to enjoy and different ways to play.  I'd definitely pick this up when it's on sale since it's an older game but is still loads of cute, relaxing fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983208950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1628936645}
review: It is a simple but fun little game, definitely something you can just sit and play for a while to relax and pass time. The art is charming, and the little music in the background is basic but nice. Just enough achievements that you will go back time and again to try and get them. I would recommend this game if anybody asked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321641882', 'num_games_owned': 1742, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1589697412}
review:
Even my 7-yr old niece found it boring.
She was like "Yay monsters!" at first and after 10 mins, she's like "it goes like this forever?"
So many meaningless texts which aren't exactly for neither the kids nor the adults.
I get that it's creative but i can't go on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3506, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1492619639}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a text based adventure where you create your own monster. 

Story:

As soon as the game begins the story explains that you're a monster that is about to be born and you're going to witness every aspect of it's life, to being born, it growing up and beyond.

The game is mostly a choose your own adventure type visual novel, where every choice leads to a different path and a you basically create a different type of monster as you go along your journey. I will say I was quite impressed with how the story is written. It seem seems expansive and the writing itself is really charming and in moments actually quite funny. I will say that I could not bring myself to play through it multiple times, because the story is fine, but not worth playing through multiple times, however I will say that there's quite a bit of play value if you really want to see all the possible outcomes. 

Graphics:

Visually Monster Loves You! is pleasing to look at, but it's very minimal in the graphics department. The monster and environment designs are really decent and the bright colors and quirky designs are really pleasing to look at and I quite enjoyed seeing my monster grow over time. However 90% of the time you will be looking at a wall of text which will not allow you to truly appreciate the art style. 

Audio:

Apart from the music there's not much audio design. It's overall decent, but nothing incredibly impressive. The music is cheerful and fits the tone of the game well and acts as nice background noise while you're reading text and picking out your choices.

Gameplay:

As I said before, Monster Love You! is to an extent a visual novel, choose your own adventure game. You're basically picking a choice, reading a bunch of text and then picking another choice to progress further, but this game has a few other mechanics to make your journey interesting. 

You're basically trying to pass time while you grow up and you have days in the corner and every so often time will move forward and you grow up slightly by the end of the set. Your choices also can give you stat boosts like cleverness, ferocity bravery, etc and these will allow you to go for different paths to increase play value. 

Verdict:

For what it is, Monster Loves You! is a great little adventure game if you want something sweet and funny to play, however I find that while decent, the writing is nothing special to warrant multiple playthroughs and the one was enough for me. I will say on a sale this one is well worth it, if you like the genre.

Final Rating:
6.5/10

Pros:
+ Great art style
+ Tons of play value
+ Charming writing

Cons:
- Overly simplistic story
- Music is quite bland
- Can get too wordy at times 

If you liked this review please consider following our groups and curator pages at https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

review: A peculiar mix of poignant and side-splitting hilarious, from having your monster bring back the toes of the human children that they just ate to give to the little monsterlings to play with, to comforting a childhood bully as she dies in your arms. While none of the choices have any effects on the story outside of the stat changes, this dear little game about a monster growing up and potentially figuring out a way to broker peace between humans and monsters (or eating humans, which is also an option) doesn't hold more than a few hours of entertainment - but what a couple of hours those will be!

author: {'steamid': '76561199067319346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1592378380}

author: {'steamid': '76561198103953421', 'num_games_owned': 3703, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1596535173}
review:
A cute little port of a mobile game, Monster Loves You is a monster raising sim where you take your little monster from primordial formation to old age and potential immortality. You have a few key stats that you modify through selecting from and playing through a number of scripted adventures. Throughout all of the life stages there's a general sense of lightheartedness as many of the interactions are played thoroughly tongue-in-cheek, with a cute art style a bit reminiscent of Aaahh!!! Real Monsters. Each stage of life comes with slightly different challenges, from interpersonal disputes to wilderness dangers, though you never have any actual risk of long-term harm. The final stage as an Elder is much different from the others, relating to the relationship between human and monster-kind.

Each run only takes about 45-60 minutes, but different possibilities invite the potential for several play-throughs. While the events you can choose are scripted with multiple options, the challenges available are not the same in every run, and it is possible to play significantly different runs by going through different events and playing them differently.

All in all it's a simple, rather easy game that has a cute story and doesn't require a ton of skill or brainpower, which I would recommend to someone who wants a to have a relatively relaxing playing experience nice over an afternoon. Due to the level of content however I would suggest waiting for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088718271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1592044688}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1590873383}
review:
Eh. This feels like a choose your own adventure story with no plot. As your monster grows, you're presented with scenarios to pick from, and how you choose to handle them will add or subtract from their stats. Then at the end of the game, you use your skills to shape the relationship between humans and monsters.

The problem is that outside of changing your stats, none of the choices matter. You get different endings based on your final choices at the last 10 minutes of the game, but that's it. It's a shame because the game feels fairly well polished, it's the core gameplay itself that's the problem. There seem to be 14 different endings, but the game didn't feel interesting enough to play more than once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049979496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1494290551}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107288427', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1660050129}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170396935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1679018342}
review:
Fun little game, not too small, not big, you get many situations in which you are able to decide what to do/say/answer/give/take.
This game is an excellent premise! You should really play it.  Don't be fooled by its comic look and the fact that you are playing as a tiny monster: this is just the camouflage for a great social-critique/personality-critique game that asks the question: who are we, what do we do, what effects does it have and how much time do we have and what do we do with our time?

This game is a great premise. It is far from being complete. For my taste, it could take 100x the time it does take to play through. You really get the chance to ask yourself questions about yourself, what should you do to be a specific type of person and to enact a specific effect on your world.

Sadly, just one bad thing that comes to my mind now is this: your options are somewhat misleading so you may end up with different consequences than you intended and you are not allowed to go back.
That is bad in a game which is 100% about your actions and their consequences..I  hope the devs are going to fix this.

Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049985091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1585071800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076602219', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1584022304}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041856540', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1583682536}
review:
A raising simulator/visual novel - it has tons of little stories, and decision points at every few lines.

[h1]The good:[/h1]
+ Pleasant visuals and audio
+ Funny writing, sometimes even tense or touching
+ Alright gameplay, though the huge font and buttons make it feel like a mobile game.
+ Many endings

[h1]The bad:[/h1]
- Often hard to guess the outcome of your actions (although sometimes it's a nice surprise - less so when you're trying to get the last few achievements and accidentally end up with eg. too much respect).
- Only one save slot, and even that is automatic
- The game is quite grindy - you are supposed to replay the entire hour-long monster life 14 times to get all endings. Fortunately there are some guides that help to reduce this to 4-5 times.
- The stories are randomly selected each time you reach a new stage or load a save file. This helps with the grindiness, but it also makes it unreliable when you're trying to improve certain stats.

[h1]Final thoughts:[/h1]
It's an interesting casual narrative game. Mostly lighthearted and silly, though a bit grindy if you care about unlocking all endings/achievements. Recommended, though wait for sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039066879', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1453942520}
review:
Monster Loves You is sort of like a choose-your-own-adventure book where every playthrough you shape your monster over the course of their life by making decisions, interacting with your fellow monsters, resolving conflicts however you see fit, and eventually helping the monster society react to a watershed moment for their species when they reach a pivotal point in their community. I won't spoil what that moment is, but how you've lived your monster life will change what you're able to do when that moment comes and decide the fate of the monsters and the future of their world. The art and music are very cute and catchy; No animation here whatsoever, just still art and background music with sound effects. It can be fun to play through multiple times and see what decisions you didn't make previously and what different ways you can affect the outcome of the game. There are achievements to earn for certain endings and outcomes so there is some extra incentive to do this. A normal playthrough takes maybe 30-45 minutes so if you know you're not the type to play a game more than once then it's definitely not worth the money, but if you are then I think you'll get a lot out of this game. 

It's a cute little adventure game that let's you explore themes of community, solidarity with those around you, accepting people for who they are, resolving conflicts in ways beneficial to everyone, and what it means to be part of a group. Definitely some good lessons in there for everyone. Check out out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094981501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1582955294}
review: Text based roleplay is delightful, if somewhat repetitive through multiple playthroughs

author: {'steamid': '76561198106641748', 'num_games_owned': 3482, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1583057105}
review:
Great text adventure about a monster life. The game is split into different stages of growing which aim you to different goals to keep it interesting. Each stage has its own unique batch of text quests which can't be seen in one playthrough, so the game has some replayability.
Nice writing, nice ambient music. Totally worth your time if you like text-based games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1582771982}
review: vas criando un mounstruo haciendo click en las opciones que te manda, pero el juego es realmente aburrido, muy lindo graficamente, pero es lo unico que resalta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1496965336}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a non-game clicker/interactive novel where you develop a "monster" based on choices that the game continually throws up at you. 

The choices aren't very interesting and the outcomes are even less interesting.  Nothing really happens and clicking on the same boring choices is like watching paint dry.   MS-paint tier hand drawn art accompanies the boring gameplay.   On the technical side, this feels like a tablet port.  No graphics options, fixed resolution and other technical deficiencies make this fall far under the minimum standard for any PC game.   $14.50 for this shovelware is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1578538994}
review:
This is a cute little dialog-option-driven RPG. You go through a monster life cycle, accumulating or losing stats based on the decisions you make, and at a few key points you face things that will test your stats in ways that are critical to overall game progress. It's almost entirely dialog - there are a few background screens and some monster portraits, but there's very little animated art. Each playthrough is over quite quickly, and the story and worldbuilding are simple but nice. You see recurring characters if you read carefully, the monster world described is cute (and slightly dark in a comedic and approachable way), and there's a generally hopeful undercurrent to some of it, including the relations between monsters and humans that you can affect.

I enjoyed it, but honestly the thing I'm really left thinking is that this would actually be a great game to give to kids who are at an early reading age, if you want to introduce them to branching narratives in games. It's short, cute, replayable, and overall is just a nice game that gently (and without being haughty) prods the player towards being kind and working to make things better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334170849', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1578436451}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a relaxing story game where you make choices that have consequences later on. What you decide to do as a monster is up to you. You can be the murderer of all humans. Or you can help them get along with other monsters and build a prosperous society for all. Hell, you can even be a mysterious doctor! The choices are up to you. As for the systems requirements, they're not that heavy. Most modern systems should be able to run this.
TL; DR: A monstrously engaging game that is good to play if you're not feeling ferocious. Your standard business laptop will enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074279143', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1577542478}
review:
Note: This review was updated after 4 playthoughs.

Pros:
-Different appearance per playthrough
-Different options per life stage 


Cons:
-No variation in main story. Makes multiple playthroughs a bit arduous
-Story is pretty weak.
-Ends abruptly. Should've had more elaboration near the end 
-Sort of related to the above, but there is no option to become an ancient, even though that's something that's in the game.
-Very generous when it comes to earning stats - pretty easy to get all stats reasonably high in one playthrough.
-Earning more of a stat does nothing. Wouldn't be a huge problem, but related to the above point. You end up with monsters which are sort of same-ish in terms of stats at the end because of this. 
-No save points. 


Wasn't very impressed. Sure, this game apparently has 900 choices...but they're not very interesting. Humans come into the picture...but not to a large extent. The whole human-monster war thing seems to be the only significant part. I guess you could also count the elder part of the life cycle, but that's just isolated interactions with you. There's not much in the way of "changing the world." Really, it's about the ending. 

 Another thing is the game has less replay value than you think because you cannot save the game(it does so automatically), meaning if you want to see all the endings, you need to do a full playthrough. This would ordinarily not be a problem, but again, it's pretty easy to get high stats and the endings are only affected by everything after adulthood. All this means each playthrough is pretty similar to each other. If this game had a save system, you could just change your choices at the elder stage and probably see multiple endings without needing to redo the entire game. I have nothing against having to do the game again, but the tedium is what makes it a dealbreaker. 

Is "Monster Loves You!" a bad game? No, I actually enjoyed it somewhat. However, is the game worth the price? No, I don't think so. Maybe I'm not cut out for these type of games, but even at various discount prices, I think there are better games out there. It's the type of game you play when you don't have anything better to do, but really, doing playthroughs is pretty tedious after the first 2 or 3 times. Monster Loves You feels like the result of when you focus too much on the "choice" aspect of choice based games. The story/adventure component is equally (or perhaps even more) important.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026873074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1577313007}

review: The choose option game, where as a Monster you are put into lot of different situations where you are building your personality by five statitics: Bravery, Cleverness, Ferocity, Honesty and Kindness. You are seeing your Monster as it's growing up to become an adult and later when it came become an Elder of the society - everything depends how other monsters are respecting you. Depending on your childhood and statistics that you'll have the whole game will be affected (you should not pick e.g. ferocity test in dialogue option when your Kindness is high as ...). Later on when become an Elder (or just die - you never know) you are taken to made decisions that are affecting whole humanity and monsterkind. Will you make a peace? Or maybe endless war?

author: {'steamid': '76561198255960253', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1569340574}
review:
What a cute game! I loved this one. Music is relaxing, arts are strange (it's a monster adventure) but something cute can be found in art... so strange, even the more bloody one.

Your mission, in this graphic tale, is to help a baby monster to grow up, your choices change the character of your monster and the fate of his people when you are old enough to meet humans. Your character evolve in a the fairytales wolrd, you can encounter Wolf, Red Riding Hood, Hansel and Gret, Frankenstein...

For the scenario, it's really easy, will you be a gentle monster or a bad one, will you be nice with your people or will you hurt them, and will your actions with human will cause a war? That's pretty much all of it, but it's well written and can be, even with the light and funny tone of the game, a good way to question human's value and virtues.

For this aspect I recommand it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049498441', 'num_games_owned': 5235, 'num_reviews': 434, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1413463191}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994005948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1642484385}
review:
Monster Loves You is, at its core, a Choose Your Own Adventure book made into a game.  Man I loved those books when I was a kid, read a whole bunch'f 'em.  CYOA books allowed me to tell the story as I saw fit.  Monster Loves You is the same, with a lot of tongue-in-cheek humor, which I absolutely love.  There have been many bouts of laughter in the short time I've played.

This is not a game for people who prefer action to reading.  There are no mechanics to this game other than reading and clicking on a choice.  If you're an avid reader, like myself, then you will absolutely enjoy this game.  I'd even recommend it to families with school-aged children, probably up to middle-school/junior-high.  High-schoolers may also enjoy it, if they happen to be enthusiastic readers.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 650, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1593009663}
review:
Got my monster into "adulthood," but never figured out what the designers were trying to do here. Endless series of binary-choices that result in predictable character statistic being changed by an unpredictable number. Get into a fight, then your ferocity goes up by 5 and your kindness goes down by 15... ouch! More importantly, the game never explains the purpose of changing the character statistics. They do not appear to be used for anything! So it is just a game about raising your numbers through dull, one-line moral choices? I hope that I am wrong about that. I really do.

There are many, many reviews that mention a story, but I found none. Each moral choice question is short and disconnected from any previous choices. Also, a lot of reviews say that this game is not good for adults, at least it is good for kids. Do kids like bad gameplay more than adults? Let's see some actual positive reviews from actual kids, rather than adults telling other adults what kids should be enjoying.

So this extremely basic gameplay uses the heavy-duty Unity Game Engine, for a large install size of 315MB, for a game that could have easily been programmed on a webpage. The game controls only use a mouse.  I played this on an ubuntu computer, and I think - I hope - that I got the game at a huge discount. This would be a big disappointment at the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056724005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1548996001}
review: While the game does contain potential in terms of story, good visual and the controls are a simple mouse-clicking novel, the game lacks the desire for replay-ability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177254747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1550518336}
review:
Bored? Trying to find an easygoing, low-pressure game to play while your code is compiling? Perhaps you're aspiring to wipe the human species off the face of the earth (hopefully only in-game); or you might be wishing to team up with them, instead.

If the answer is yes, you might enjoy monster loves you. It won't rock your world, nor will it wow you mechanically or artistically; and there's a fair chunk of repetitive content. But it can be good for some (mostly) mindless and undemanding fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010090927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1550332002}
review:
A wonderful little tale with a lot of humour and some pretty cool tiny story lines in it.  There's nothing complex here, but that's the whole point.  I played through two lives, and there's more to be discovered, but at that point I had my fun and was happy with the fun/cost ratio and then some!

Well worth a look if you like cutesy little games with a choose-your-own style and replacing complexity with simple-minded fun and frivolity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032457930', 'num_games_owned': 1840, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1625705550}
review:
General: 

Rating: T
Price: $9.99
Genre: Simulation
Time played: 23 hours

A choice based simulation of a Monster’s life.  Every decision changes who you are and your skills, and eventually will determine the fate of all Monsters. 

Gameplay - 6

There’s not much to this game, you make choices, then advance to the next stage of life and make more choices.  All these choices combined form the monster you become and affect the world around you in a myriad of ways. 

There’s a lot of choices, too many to get on 1 play through, per stage of life and each has a story of its own to tell.  There’s a lot of reading, but the game made me feel like I was playing a “Choose your own Adventure” game. The background changes depending on what stage of life you are on, but there’s not much going on graphically. 



Story -  10

You start as a small monster in the ‘spawning pit’, you make choices that helps develop your personality and characteristics. Eventually you leave there and move on to the next stage of life, more choices to be made more development.  Eventually you will reach adulthood where your personality won’t change as much per decision but your influence (respect) will grow with the other monsters.  Eventually you have a chance to become an elder, depending on your characteristics and choices you’ve made thus far you may become one, or you might dissolve back into the spawning vats to create the next generation of monsters. 

I’m skimming over a great deal but don’t want to give away too much. 

Graphics -  ??

There’s not much graphics in this game, mostly looking at a still image which changes depending on the life stage you are currently.  



Controls - 10 (mouse)

Point and click.  Click on where you want to go (usually there’s only 1 choice) then pick an adventure (10 - 20 depending on where you are in life) read the event, then use the mouse to decide a course of action. Pretty simple. 



Repeatability - 6

There’s plenty of things that can be accomplished. Not everything can be done on a single run so you’ll need to go through a few times to unlocked/see everything.  It can get repetitive and boring, since you just make the choices and things play out per a script.  But , still a cute charming little game. 

Music - ??

Atmospheric, I think it provides a nice ambient type feeling. Without it the game would be missing something, but not a lot I think. 

Multiplayer -  N/A

Initial Thoughts: 

A cute little word game.  Neat I can upgrade stats. What’s this I can interact with humans and decide how/what to do with them? Interesting… very interesting. 


Soma Says: 

A great game and I enjoyed it thoroughly.  I did about 5 playthroughs, in that time i managed to befriend the humans and we lived in peace and harmony.  I also managed to destroy the humans and now the monsters reign supreme over the earth.  I managed to get myself and all other monsters enslaved as pets.  And other things that you can figure out on your own. 

The game was good, but not very action oriented. You’re mostly reading and choosing the action you think would benefit you the most on this run (Several later runs I was trying for a specific trait and would max that out ignoring (as much as possible) other traits. 

If you’re not a fan of reading and making choices, I would steer clear of this game.  If those things don’t bother you then I would say go for it and enjoy the game. 


If you enjoyed the review check out my curator page : https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28849369/

review:
Pros

author: {'steamid': '76561198116249314', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1538159105}
review:
Monster Loves You! – короткий текстовый квест, завернутый в цветастую обертку с добавлением нескольких дополнительных механик.

Сюжет довольно простой, поэтому игра будет идеальна для детей: она учит делать моральные выборы и справляться с последствиями. Игрок управляет монстром и сопровождает его от момента рождения до старости. Основное, чем придется заниматься в игре – читать и делать выборы между предложенными реакциями на события. Выборы влияют на черты характера монстра.  

Всего есть 5 черт: храбрость, ум, кровожадность, честность и доброта. В зависимости от решений, которые игрок принимает в ходе мини-квестов, формируется характер монстра. Он, в свою очередь, влияет на то, будут ли доступны некоторые варианты действий в текстовых квестах и как монстра будут воспринимать в обществе.

Игра разбита на уровни, каждый из которых описывает определенный этап жизни монстра – детство, юность, зрелость и так далее до статуса старейшины. За каждый уровень можно исследовать ограниченное количество мини-квестов. Изначально цель игры – развить характер монстра, а также получить признание или ненависть сообщества (дополнительная характеристика, которая может расти или уменьшаться в зависимости от принятых решений). В статусе старейшины придется, помимо прочего, учиться мирить общество монстров и общество людей и стараться угодить и тем, и другим.

В игре поднимается много сложных тем – это и вопросы самостоятельности, взросления, взаимопомощи, поведения в обществе, агрессии, расизма и толерантности. Поэтому детям игра может быть вполне интересна, а вот взрослым ее можно рекомендовать, пожалуй, только как интересный способ изучения английского.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048868041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1533672621}
review:
This game is the breath of fresh air that I've needed lately. Monster Loves You is a choose your own adventure visual novel with a surprising number of paths to explore. The lively, colored-pencil-esque artwork and the plucky humor made it easy to slip into this world of monsters and quickly feel at home there. I really enjoyed the personality system from both a storytelling standpoint and a gameplay standpoint and I was amazed at how nuanced the world felt utilizing that system. 

By the time I finished all of the endings I felt like I had a connection with all of the recurring characters that your monster grows up around. The artwork is charming and the alternating monster sprites make for a fun extra surprise each playthrough. The humor and the at times dissonant optimism compliment the quirky style of the game extremely well. 

This world of monsters reminds players (or at least, myself) that the world is an exciting and absurd place and that we silly, often absurd creatures ought to remember to explore it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964125843', 'num_games_owned': 2726, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1533513358}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069330531', 'num_games_owned': 1508, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1532310987}
review:
Silly, squishy, crunchy, lovey dovey, paranoid, angry, deceptive, relentless, and heartwarming, Monster Loves You is a wonderful Choose Your Own Adventure game best played by children, or those young at heart.

I don't mean that as an insult, as I find the game genuinely charming, and I had a blast raising my first monster, carefully making decisions in my community to develop the way I wanted him to develop, and, ultimately, uniting the Romeo and Juliet societies at the end. What follows is where Monster Loves You is lacking. 

The game restarts, having forgotten all of what you've just done with your first monster, and having unlocked your first of (fourteen or so) endings. Your choices that meant so much for your first don't carry any weight into your subsequent playthroughs. Also, each stage of life is faced with the same scenarios you had before. You can pick different branches, but it's more or less a familiar tale. As one's fright wanes upon their second go on a spooky amusement park ride, so does one's youthful curiosity and excitement for each decision to be made. 

This is why I would suggest this game for children, or for people who don't mind revisiting familiar patterns over and over again. Children are the champions of repetition, just ask any worn out VHS copy of Shrek. Again, though, I must stress, this is [b]not[/b] a bad thing.

The music is positively whimsy gone sonar, and the backgrounds and drawings of all the other monsters are beyond adorable. Sadly, the monster you are raising doesn't seem to change with each generation; something I felt quite let down by. Though upon a replay the vignettes feel sort of stale, or unsurprising, I did honestly have a blast the first time through. The writing is great, and feels like a very well written children's or young adult book. Wonderful usage of quirky verbs and adjectives paint an image so clearly, that one forgets one is just clicking buttons on a computer screen. 

As one playthrough can take as little as 20 minutes, but hardly longer than an hour, it's quite short. If you intend to chase down each of the 10+ endings, though, that'll be a grind of a challenge. 

I really had to step away, and take my time to consider this game. Time and time again, I find myself wanting a neutral review option on Steam. We are all familiar with this problem, I imagine. Because of the lack of newness on the second go around, I hesitate to declare, "Positive Review, buy, buy, buy it!" 

So, consider my words as I've written them above. If you have an imaginative youngster who might be interested in playing a Choose Their Own Adventure game on their own (or as a family), I wholeheartedly recommend this game. If you are interested in a single playthrough, be sure to pick it up on deep discount. If neither of those things appeal to you, pass this one over.

6.5/10

Liked this review? Follow my curator page by clicking the following link:

https://steamcommunity.com/groups/diggingdeep#curation

review: This game was just cute.. It does get repetitive but the artwork is cute, the monsters are adorable (mostly) and the adventure can change at any given time based off your choices.. It's an easy game based on choices to get to different places in your monsters life - the achievements aren't easy - it takes bout half an hour to get through one story..

author: {'steamid': '76561198001612303', 'num_games_owned': 2743, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1695692935}
review:
Cute, very short choose-your-own-adventure game. It does seem to be made for children, and I'd have adored this game if I'd played it when I was in elementary school. It is well-written; the flavor is spot-on, full of humor and whimsy. Some of the prompts are mildly scary, and there is some tension near the end of the game.

However, it's also very easy. You have to go out of your way to make "bad" moral choices in order to get anything other than the golden ending. Probably a good thing for a children's game, but it does limit the replay value somewhat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123286310', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1528187356}
review:
Эта игра нереально скучная. Она линейная, в ней абсолютно ничего не происходит, нет никакого разнообразия.

Всего в игре есть 14 концовок, которые особо друг от друга не отличаются и на каждую концовку уходит примерно по 20-25 минут, если не читать абсолютно все. Повторюсь, геймплей и получение концовок нереально скучное. К тому же, игра стоит дорого (250 деревянных за текстовую игру, это же жесть!), так что смысла покупать ее нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201613371', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1527463457}
review:
This was a pretty fun game, I gotta admit. The choices and scenarios were different for each playthrough I did and that made it interesting, as well as the multiple endings, so it does have a lot of replay value.
However, one might not want to replay the game 14 times to get all 14 endings. I didn't really want to but this game does have a saving grace. Once you get the achievement, immediately press escape and go back to the title screen, and it will reset your last choice. This way, I was able to dissolve myself (it's an in-game thing.) all 6 times, experiencing all 6 endings without starting over. You will need to at least replay the game a total of two times. One ending with multiple paths with high respect, and the other endings with low respect. It's pretty fun though. It's pretty easy to get all the achievements, and I do recommend it for anyone looking to kill 1-3 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025129201', 'num_games_owned': 2316, 'num_reviews': 343, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1526681264}
review: Monster Loves You is a simple and cute choose your own adventure story.  The thumbs down is not to say this is a bad game, it definitely isn't.  But for $10, I wish it were a little bit more compelling.  As is, the game is something I enjoy more in theory than in practice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045070428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1415242378}
review: It's a cute game.  I got it because I had a coupon for a free copy of it so I gave it a shot.  The art style is cute but it doesn't have that much to it.  I would recommend it but I don't think I'll be playing it more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044716235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1487389471}
review:
I got this game as part of HumbleBundle. I wish there was  "neutral" for recommending this game, because that's what I would give it.

There's not much story to it, nor variety of things to do. You basically send yourself into very short often single-screen scenarios and choose (via clicking) option A or B. Outcome affects your stats. Rinse and repeat about 30 times and that's the whole game, and if you made enough "right" decisions, you get a "better" ending. Then you start all over again with a different monster.

It's more like an interactive kid's book more than anything. Art style is cute, so seems like it could be a good game to buy for young kids, but otherwise don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981613589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1527367025}
review: Monster Loves you is a simple choose your own adventure game. It is family friendly and playable for most ages (a parent might need to read the text to littles, but there are expressive icons to help make choices).  Some of the negative reviews about the game seem to stem from a belief in what electronic gaming should, and should not, include. As a source of interactive play with the family this is a fun and accessible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978593149', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1524476330}
review:
A well drawn "choose your own adventure" style game. There are many endings, but it feels like it would be a bit boring to go through them all. 

Still fun though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969957382', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1507414414}
review: There should be a sequel, called "Monster Needs a Hug".

author: {'steamid': '76561198029343872', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1574052566}
review:
This game is fantastic. The music is charming and the grapics are cute. Through a series of choices you determine not only how you (as a monster) grow but potentially shape the future of humans and monsters. An initial playthrough is short (an hour, +/-) , it would take many playthroughs to fully explore story options and how fierce or clever you can make your monster. 

Absolutely loved playing it and I look forward to more playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043642717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1590279514}
review:
Achievements: All possible.  Will require 14 playthroughs with no text skip mechanic.  

Pros/Cons:
+ Great writing
+ Cute graphics/background images
+ Nice system of choices-- they all affect stories/stats in different ways.  
+ Appropriate music
+ Compelling storytelling-- feels very nostalgic, like a story book.  

- Can get repetitive-- unlike a visual novel, Monster Loves You! is played in events that one chooses.  These events are not guaranteed to change from playthrough to playthrough, and 14 playthroughs add up.  
- Some endings-- the 'dissolve into...' ones-- are all very similar and a bit tedious to obtain.  
- Not a super great value for the length-- I got ~6 hours from 100%ing it, but I was only at ~4 hours when I felt 'done'.  

Overall:
Monster Loves You! is an adorable choose-your-own-adventure game.  It plays much like a storybook where not everything is illustrated.  The characters are portrayed through language and their true likeness is up to the reader's imagination.  The storytelling is really good, the events are really cute and affected by choice.  I'd definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a good, whimsical story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274996495', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1522222563}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039938962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1518497757}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128383171', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1496672453}
review:
Charming little game. 
You are a growing monster which has to make many decisions deciding his way of life, his future and possibly the future of monsters and humans.
The game is very short (1 round is around 30 min if i remember right) but has a high replay value as it has various endings depending on your decisions and if you played 'good' or 'bad'.
It's fun, different and sometimes unpredictable but looking at the short playtime i would recommend getting it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006993419', 'num_games_owned': 3878, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1446495506}
review:
Monster Loves You! Is an enjoyable game with a delightfully cartoonish aesthetic. Almost like a brighter "Aaaah! Real Monsters!" in a fantasy setting. The game is short but the choices and endings make for a good deal of replayability. But for the same reasons I can't advocate for the game at it's present cost, but only barely. 

If you have the chance to grab the game on sale (even if it's only a 25% one) I say go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083407585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1475650217}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080719112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1520365646}
review:
I started clicking away at Monster Loves You! feeling quite amused and charmed by its instantaneous appeal.  Then there was a part where two monsters were fighting over a cat that they wanted to eat.  That is definitely not for me.  I tried to circumvent the cat-murder, and just made it worse.  Had to switch off the game, pat my real cat, and promise her I would never tear her in half.

So yeah, if you're sensitive like me and love cats - it might bother you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010210572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1367650800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003999386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1510320353}
review: A very simple but well executed game, perfect as an introduction for young children to games. The different events that happen are very creative, with lots of fun monster-flavoured twists on what life would be like a monster village.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053220959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1638161908}
review:
-------- Original review:

This is a short, fun game. (Less than 45 minutes for me, while taking my time.)

The graphics (which aren't really to my liking and only consist of a handful of repetitive, still images) turn out to be entirely irrelevant because this is all about the text. Much like a Choose You Own Adventure type of game you get multiple choices of how you want to react to something, which in turn determines your likelihood of succeeding.

The idea here clearly lies in making you replay the game often to explore how many different outcomes you can achieve. Not sure yet how the text will hold up to multiple revisits, but we shall see.
Luckily the story is funny, with very cute moments, so that could help with the replay value.

Being me, I only really explored the nice options during my first playthrough, though. It will be a challenge to turn brutal and ferocious and spread hate.


-------- Many years later:

A few days ago I returned to this game on a whim and now I can't seem to stop playing it. It's funny, sad, happy, and really cute. [i]Really[/i] cute. Even the graphics have grown on me, but the best thing by far has to be the music! So addictive. I would snap it up in a heartbeat, were it for sale.

When I first played this, I only did a single run. As it turns out the game improves further with replays - for me, anyway. There are so many fun scenarios and so many fun and often unexpected ways they can go.

It's true that I struggle with being mean (for certain outcomes I just have to not let the lines sink in about how I made someone cry etc), but even those branches tend to result in a giggle or a touching moment. Sometimes an option I was sure would end badly still has something wholesome to it - even if I just ate a toddler.

I am now chasing the final achievement/ending and it is not as easy as one would think. Still very relaxed and sweet to play, of course.

So, while this game might not be for everyone (which game [i]is[/i], anyway?) - if you don't mind a childlike approach mixed with more mature undertones, and if you don't mind some repetition as you explore options, if you appreciate text-based games, and if you just want to chill out with really uplifting music and zen-like musings? Then this might amuse you. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198099168315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1518796575}
review:
It could have been so much more! 

Ridicously short, I completed it in under 30minutes. I don't think i'll have the urge to play it again either. 

The overall lack of depth in this game is disappointing. 

The graphics or art style is lovely and I really wanted to love this game but I didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989846361', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1518490102}
review: This game is cute and fun with choices that actually matter. However, I would recommend it on discount. I received this in a humble bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994708210', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1517321684}
review:
For some reason I expected there to be more depth to this game, but no. It's honestly quite poor. You are presented some random situation and you can chose to respond with courage or something else. In general you just have options to act with altruism, strength, weakness, selfishness, etc. and it's literally just that, you don't get any clever dialogue and there is no payoff for "building" your character's personality either.

 I'd say it would just barely fit the bill for a 6 year old, but at that age I was already playing games with actual meat and bones, like Spyro the Dragon. I just don't know what the purpose or audience of this game is and why it costs money. They could just release it on iOS/Android for free and pump it full of ads. It's that type of quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050141583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1440705015}
review: This game is pretty dang fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044049204', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1517792476}
review:
Survive the spawning vat, develop a personality, and decide the future of your world.
I bought this game during a Halloween sale and have been pleasantly surprised by it. It's a relatively simple, mostly text-based game that’s reminiscent of the “Choose Your Own Adventure” stories from your youth. It doesn't take very long to live a full life as a monster and you will have to play through the game multiple times to get all the achievements, but it’s well worth a couple of play throughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052103686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1376257446}
review:
Looking through all the negative reviews, I can't say I know what people were really expecting.  On the tin, I expected a text choose your own adventure monster game with cutesy visuals, a low cost, and a short to the point narrative.  

This game isn't going to reinvent the gaming landscape or offer you a stupendous new perspective on life, but if you are looking for an easy to digest game with a story book quality, quirky humor, and that fits in a short form package that you can beat or even 100% in an evening, it should definitely check those boxes.

My biggest gripe is that on repeat playthroughs you will regularly encounter the same scenarios as before making it easier to cheat the system and min/max your characters personality/respect stats on subsequent playthroughs.  You will probably get through three maybe four times before the repetition becomes too pervasive.  Still, I don't anticipate the game was expecting people to play through all the different endings to begin with.   Play through it once or twice and you'll get the gist of the experience.  

It was a fun little game.  Nothing mind blowing, but if you go into it with the right expectations, you can certainly get fun and relaxation out of it. Plus, the music might be repetitive, but it fits the game well and is quite relaxing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097406584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1465590663}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041404696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1498451938}
review:
A simple game, but charming. Its hand drawn art style does help it in the charming department. During your first play through, it is fun to explore you decisions and actions and the impact you have on this interesting world. Though some of the choices can be confusing and its descriptions are not very clear all the time. So it may lead to some fustrating moments as you character does the most stupidest things and you having to restart the game. Some characters are interesting, but most are forgetable.

The story was too short for me. And after going through the first playthrough I felt no need to play it again. The story is partically repeat of the story and most of your decisions don't have an impact until the end. Majority of the game is you making sure your character gains all the right stats and marks all the right check boxes before coming to a major decision point to get your desired ending. Plus it can be pretty easy to map out all the endings once you go through a few play through.

Overall, its a fun and nice looking game, but once going through your first few playthrough the game quickly becomes a dull task of marking off check boxes to unlock a desired acheivement. In the end, I think its a nice game but I would recommend that you wait for a sale if you want to try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083961114', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1516373297}
review:
More of a game for young kids really, so not really my cup-o-tea.  That said if you have kids or are a kid I highly recommend it.  Works great on Linux too!

It works basically as a choose your own adventure game mixed with an RPG.  Pick a part of the story, read the story, choose an option and suffer the rewards/consequences of that option.  Those give you stats that you use later on.

This is one of two games the dev gave me because the other game wasn't working on my system.  So if it matters to you how good the developer is that's something to consider as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087050551', 'num_games_owned': 1002, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1516253496}
review:
I want to like this game, but I can't give it the thumbs up.  It was worth playing through once, but I really can't imagine playing through a second time which is a shame since the game is aimed at multiple replays.

It is definitely a charming, casual, and relaxing experience.  The concept is really cool, but I personally just don't see the "game" aspect enough to get me to keep playing it.  With it only taking me about an hour to get through to the end, that is a shame.

At a $10 price tag, pass on this.  If it's on sale or in a bundle, it's worth the play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1488075396}
review:
By visual novel stanards, it's very short and doesn't make up for it with replay value. It tasks you with trying to improve your various attributes through your responses to each situation, and later influence human-monster relations. But it's usually easy to see what choices will get you the stats you want, and trivially easy to get nudge human-monster relations the direction you want. So there's no challenge getting whatever ending you want to aim for, effectively robbing the game of its replay value. (Also making it a very easy game).

On the plus side, the story is pretty cute and fun. There's just not a lot to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060286345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1514877001}
review:
A cute and chill choose your own adventure game that is fun and worth a play or two. There's enough branching pieces of each story to keep the player invested for a bit and just to sit back and enjoy their monster life in Omen.

It's everybody friendly and I'd recommend giving it a go. So, go fang out with your ghoul friends and enjoy the show. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198162204936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1706731562}
review: a fun little game with lots of choices

author: {'steamid': '76561198082499922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1385746083}
review:
[b]Lack of extended consequence and limited budget leaves a terribly limited storybook[/b]
Monster Loves You! is a "choose your own adventure" styled game (wherein the player is thrust into a series of effectively random vignettes and responses are chosen), themed and styled as though it would be played by six-year-old boys, but with far too low a budget to manage the spectacle to appeal to that audience.

The game plays out as choosing a scene (represented by a non-specific icon), and then reading through that scene represented only in colorful text and adorable responses. There are unfortunately few scenes to play through and practically no connection between them, making replays repetitive. The lack of animation and voice-overs leaves the whole experience hollow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115451561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1507052646}
review:
ОЧЕНЬ скучно, сначала привлекла графика, а потом оказалось что это единственное, что более менее нормально тут.
Сюжет неинтересен, выборы неинтересные, монстры неинтересные, скука нереальная, не знаю как описать даже

author: {'steamid': '76561198441231747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1514912091}
review:
Un juego de narrativa y toma de decisiones que te llevarán por múltiples y diferentes caminos. Explorarlos todos llevará muchas buenas horas de juego. Puedes tener hasta [u]una hora de juego por final posible[/u], pero si lo pasas rápido tienes unas [u]7-8h[/u].
Forja tu carácter con las decisiones y podrás acabar con la humanidad, colaborar con ella hacia un mundo mejor, perder la batalla, convertirte en leyenda... ¡Hay 14 finales posibles!
Si te gusta este tipo de juegos y lo ves en oferta, ¡no lo pienses más y pillalo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992334290', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1547075022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198400953764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1530527489}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997192533', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1513024613}
review:
A curio, this, a choose you own adventure style game where you guide your monster through it's life, hoping to ascend to Elder status and then shape how humans and monsters will interact at the endgame.

It's designed to be replayed, partly because you might not make it to Elder status first time (based on your choices throughout your life) but also to get the dozen or so different endings. Each playthrough is probably about an hour and the store page says there are over 900 choices to make, so each playthrough will be different.

I'll take their word for that, because my single session was enough (I made it to Elder status first time and also made humans and monsters love each other - I guess that's the 'best' ending). It's all very simply presented - text and static background scenes are all you get - and whilst it is meant to be replayed I can't really imagine a subsequent playthrough yielding a different experience as the writing isn't that good or interesting, nor are the choices going to lead to anything you'd care about.

So whilst Monster may love me, the feeling is most definitely not reciprocated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004693413', 'num_games_owned': 2242, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1514240684}
review: Get it on sale, it is definitely worth at least one playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968370069', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1611722302}
review:
I bought this game during a sale and must say, I absolutely love it. It's cute, charming, and reminiscent of the old choose your own adventure books you played as a child (although without the option to keep the finger between the pages, because it totally doesn't count that way, really!).

That said, I do not know if I would recommend it at its full price. My playtime of 4 hours covers all 13 possible endings, which means I basically 'beat' the game 100%. A lot of the later attempts you will find yourself clicking through the same scenarios over and over again, barely reading them anymore, just going for the desired outcome.

I still recommend this game, but would also say: put it on your wishlist, wait for it to be in a sale, snatch it up and be entertained for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172119082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1500480093}
review: This game is cute, I guess, but it's pretty boring. There are multiple routes, but I had no desire to replay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999390073', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1513818700}
review:
Point and click text "adventure". Dull options, dull music, dull art. There's nothing about this game that makes it compelling over others in its genre, such as the living dead games by telltale. You could find an equally good game in a flash game for free somewhere, I'm sure.

It was painfully obvious what I was moving towards all the time, I had no investment in any of the characters or story. Was this made for 5 year old children? That's how it felt.

Unless you're literally a small child, don't buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280813313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1508013207}
