author: {'steamid': '76561198161065056', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1512911568}
review:
Although the idea [spoiler]of Monsters being born from slime and having their fate depended on amount of Respect they gain[/spoiler] is interesting, I would say the game itself is too static. No movement or plot twists, just narrative and several endings as a result. 

After unlocking all the achievements, I immediately uninstalled 'Monster Loves You!'. To be honest, only they made me keep replaying this game.

But the worst fact of all is that there is no 'save' button, and to get another ending [spoiler](I mean achievement)[/spoiler] you must go through the same dialogues, that you know like a poem now. Lame.

I won't recommend this game if you look for something unusual and gripping. Otherwise you may try it. Maybe you'll like it. Who knows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234756196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1512677782}
review: A fun little time waster with entertaining out comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186865498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1590085551}
review:
Once you get past the cutesy nature of the game you'll find that there is not really much of a game here at all. The RPG/text adventure style seems to trick you into thinking that it's non-linear but it ain't. After your second play-through you'll just be spamming the button to get to the end screen since the ending is the only bit where achievements unlock.

In the latter stages of the game, where your little monster evolves into an elder, there is a little bit of cause and effect as you make choices that determine what kind of ending (and this, achievement) you can get, but that's about it. I don't want to give this game a bad review but I was left kinda disappointed. A fine timewaster to a point, then just a real waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231656648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1527392489}
review:
A fun and cute little distraction from life which honestly doesn't take more than 40 minutes or so play all the way through. I've finished the game multiple times and still don't understand how my Monster ends up looking how it does though. 

The downside of the game is that it was basically meant to be played multiple times to see the various "endings" and achievements, but it very quickly becomes incredibly repetitive, with very few of the...I'll call them "quests"...so with very few of the "quest" options differing. A neat game, but....I wouldn't buy it anything but on sale. Very on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139327160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1511860127}
review:
coming into this game, i thought i knew what it was about.. i realized my expectations of its direction were wrong from the start as i eased into the tutorial, in which you start as a glob of slime and grow up.. you also learn by making choices that will form what kind of monster you'll be..
it's by no means the average choice-making game and i recommend Monster Loves You! for the style, variations of choices, and thought that went into it.. the replayablility is unquestionable and everyone can get in on the fun.. this is worth the buy

author: {'steamid': '76561198031259216', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1605119216}
review:
Un petit jeu en texte assez simple qui prend peu de temps pour le finir une première fois. Au final c'est un passe temps agréable qui permet de passer le temps. La plupart des solutions s'obtiennent assez vite avec une compréhension rapide du système, après il faut jouer de finesse pour certaines d'entre elles

Le jeu étant en anglais il demande un petit temps d'adaptation pour les francophones mais le niveau demandé n'est pas énorme on comprend vite la situation et les choix en présence, cela ne psoe donc pas de problème. Le plus 'irritant' étant le manque de choix dans le design de votre montre (un peu à la Spore) et le fait que les images disponibles soit répétitives et sans interactions possibles. Ce qui vous fera cliquer à la va vite sur les choix en fonction des icones pour débloquer les autres fins possibles.

Prenez le si vous avez un peu de temps à perdre entre deux temps de chargement  ou en période de soldes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316448216', 'num_games_owned': 1053, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1511735117}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a cute Choose Your Own Adventure game, but it wasn’t able to keep me entertained very long. I played a few times, but I always get bored after less than 30 minutes because, for a video game, it’s very static. All you do is clicking on text boxes and there’s no real goal behind it. There is no real adventure in that game. 

That’s why, even if the artwork is cute, I can’t recommend it. But if you still want to buy it, wait for it to be on sale. This game isn’t worth $10. Maybe $5, but definitely not $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021955596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1557003049}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2953, 'num_reviews': 896, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1510859105}
review:
This game is the video game equivalent of a choose your own adventure book from back in the 80s and 90s. Good concept, but there's a few issues with the game. 

Overall the game is played by telling you a story and then having you choose a response.  Everything in the game is with this system, you normally get a choice to "go on an adventure" and have to choose from 10 or so adventures.  You go on your adventure, get stats and start over.   If there's 10 adventures, and 8 "days" you will go on 80 percent of them. 

After your 8 choices, you'll evolve to the next form and continue.  This is the entire gameplay loop, while there's a few stat checks as you go on, if you play well your stats should be high enough that you seem to always succeed.  I got what I believe is the best ending (or at least the ending I wanted) on the first run.    That first run took less than an hour. 

And the second playthrough is where the problems really start. 

You see, on the second playthrough you get the option of 10 adventures again.  However it doesn't appear these 10 adventures are different, in fact the two I tried on my second playthrough (before putting the game aside for a while) was exactly the same.  This is disappointing, because it really does feel like a choose your own adventure book.  Now I realize that what I'd be asking for would be a ton of work, but for 10 bucks, you get a 30 minute adventure that an achievement hunter will have to play through 14 times if they don't make a mistake.  That's 7 hours of gameplay.  I just don't think it's 7 great hours of gameplay. 

But at the end of the day, I realize this is a choose your own adventure book in a video game form.  If that's what you're looking for, this does fit the bill, I just feel there could have been a much better more randomized game where I felt I was going on new adventures each time. 

Ultimately, I do recommend this game because the choose your own adventure is a fun take, the writing is excellent, the ability to explore the monster world is fun, and there's good characters in it.  But it is a choose your own adventure that doesn't have a wealth of gameplay or story, and for gamers, that might be a reasonable deal breaker.   But I did enjoy the time and I do look forward to a second play through trying to do something different.  I just wish I wouldn't have had to try so hard to find a new adventure.

I also would probably wait for a sale as 10 bucks is a bit pricy for this, but at the same time, it's what you want to make it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314927383', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1692143693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051301444', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1496973489}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020880828', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1509078516}
review:
The game is a Choose-Your-Adventure in its entirety.

Game goes like this: Posed a scenario, your pet responds in a manner associated to a trait, gain (or lose) stat bonuses. Trials in the story based on stat game determine success/loss.

Example: Monster comes across a wolf. Fight the wolf? +Ferocity. Stand up for your buddies? +Bravery. Run away? -Bravery. Etc.


The cute visuals and silly dialog choices made it possible to continue until the end. 

Mechanics were too easily readable and abused; easy to infer which choices and actions would result in postive stat games for Bravery/Ferocity/Honesty/Kindness etc.

Don't really see myself replaying with how shallow the gameplay was. But it's okay for a one-time playthrough if you're into Choose-Your-Adventure style games, and if you can get it on the cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116845500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1500135566}
review: The only thing that will love me :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198067818421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1508120809}
review: I got this game as a gift from a friend, and it was the BEST THING EVER.  Definitely not a game you binge as one story go takes about 30 minutes, but an absolute perfect pick me up.  It's precious.  It's cute.  You can be any kind of monster.  The art style is endearing and kooky and weird. One of the more engaging choose your own adventures I've played, and I consider myself an avid player of choose your own adventures.  I have noticed I tend towards ferocity based monsters as it's just SO MUCH FUN to beat up Nash-Gnash.  I love ruining Nash-Gnash's plans.  I've never felt so deliciously spiteful.  There are plenty of other memorable and lovable characters you'll meet in this game, though you might have to play the game a few times to remember their names.  Except Nash-Gnash.  I have a lot of strong feelins about Nash-Gnash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134924447', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1506748039}
review:
See my brief playthrough here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJ7TY-n4OKVSRD1h_aBNcVQQ3xUuE8clu

Monster Loves Me, and I Love Monster!  It's a short but sweet choice game, where your choices shape your monster, and, ultimately, the fate of monster and human kind.  Art is cute, music is fun, and writing is funny and charming.  There is extensive replay value here, with multiple endings to unlock and situations to see!

+ music

author: {'steamid': '76561198350072937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1508201069}
review: This is a cute, family-friendly game that plays like a choose your own adventure book. I loved the illustrations; they were the cute kind of creepy. Going through the story was fun a few times, though it repeats itself enough that it got repetitive. I do plan on seeing what other endings there are sometime in the future when I show this game to other people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030422449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1507485341}
review:
Petit jeu sympathique et agréable, dans le style "Aventures dont vous êtes le héros" qu'on avait en bouquin (pour ceux qui ont connus), où le gameplay consiste à une série de choix que vous devez faire, chacun avec ses conséquences, dans différents tableaux, jusqu'à arriver à l'issu final.

Le jeu est intégralement en anglais (sans autre choix de langue), ce qui est important de rappeler, puisqu'on est là sur un jeu qui n'est que narratif. (vous n'avez pas de visuel, ou très peu, de ce que l'on vous raconte)

Graphiquement c'est très mignon, avec des monstres au design burlesque et enfantin qui m'ont rappelé le film de Pixar "Monstre & Cie".
L'histoire en elle-même est intéressante et il y a beaucoup de situation amusante (l'esprit du jeu reste enfantin, quand bien même on parle souvent de bouffer des humains, voir d'autres monstres, ou de gentils animaux de la forêt).
Au premier essai, je dirais que l'histoire se fait en 1 à 2 heures, en y jouant sans se précipiter.

L'histoire offre un peu plus de 5 (je ne sais plus exactement) fins possibles, certaines plus dur que d'autres à débloquer.
Niveau difficulté, c'est très casual, il n'y a pas vraiment de challenge.
Mais ce n'est pas l'idée du jeu, qui cherche surtout à vous distraire en passant un amusant moment à vivre la vie d'un monstre qui se fait sa place dans son petit village.

Pour les achievements hunter, le jeu est facile à finir à 100%, je l'ai fait en 7heures.
Ca va vite une fois qu'on a compris la mécanique.

Finalement, le point négatif qui est surement souvent relevé est la durée de vie.
Une fois qu'on a croisé les 3/4 des petites histoires du jeu, c'est sûr que la rejouabilité est faible, mais bon, c'est toujours le cas des jeux narratifs.

Il ne coûte que 10€, ce que je trouve très honnête.
Certains diront que c'est trop cher, pour un jeu qui a une durée de vie de moins de 10heures,
mais faut mettre ça en perspective...
Je rappellerai juste qu'une place de cinéma pour aller voir le dernier film Marvel (bon ou mauvais), voir une chiasse comme "50 nuances de gay" c'est entre 8€ et 13€ (pour les malheureux qui paient plein tarif) pour tout juste 1h à 2h de divertissement...

Donc bon...

Bon petit jeu, agréable et divertissant pour ma part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149073212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1506379041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 749, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1504657933}
review:
I had a very pleasure time playing Monster Loves You!
It’s a well-polished adventure storybook game that's definitely worth a play.

The game is charming, funny and adorable, tells a great story of your own partial making and displays a great visual art style.  The choices you make (initially) feel unique and personal. The soundtrack fits the game just right and provides helpful atmosphere.

The only issue is that it's not really worth playing more than one time since in order to get unique endings you have to click through tons of sections you’ve already seen before. Endings are usually only a few clicks away from each other and sometimes require a few small difference in choices throughout a playthrough.

I would recommend it if you can find it for a bit cheaper or if there’s someone special you’d want to share the experience with. 
:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198120341530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1503829780}

review: I was expecting more game for the price.  As other reviews say, it's basically a Choose Your Own Adventure with cute artwork.  It's cute and entertaining for an hour or less, but I likely won't be playing it again (and I don't think that's worth the $9.99 price tag).

author: {'steamid': '76561198170019417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1502829621}
review:
Une histoire assez brève, à rejouer plusieurs fois pour obtenir toutes les fins.
Le jeu est divisé en chapitres, "les âges de la vie", et en épisodes "aventures", qui déterminent les compétences de votre monstre, en fonctions de vos choix.

Bien que lors d'un premier essai, j'aie essayé les choix qui me plaisaient le plus (grosso modo, être gentil, honnête et prudent), on se retrouve vite à faire les choix nécessaire à l'atteinte d'une certaine fin. 
Le jeu est devenu pour moi alors plutôt un jeu de gestion des compétences du personnage. 

C'est une conséquence récurrente des jeux à fins multiples que de vouloir absolument chercher toutes les fins, et de sacrifier l'impression d'importance des choix, à sa curiosité. Très souvent, la rejouabilité immédiate m'empêche un réel investissement dans le choix, qui m'apparaît alors banal. C'est aussi le cas pour ce jeu.

Ce n'est pas grave en soit, mais j'avais espéré un impact moral plus profond, à la manière d'un conte de fée, comme le jeu s'inspire explicitement de ce genre.
 En somme, il n'y avait pas de tension narrative, comme dans certains aventures à choix que j'ai pu expérimenté gratuitement comme "Who is Mike", "Rising Angels Reborn" et "The Bottom of the Well" (disponibles gratuitement sur Steam). 

Monsters Love You! en fait plutôt une histoire simple, mignonne et parfois rigolote certes, mais qui ne vaut pas à mon avis le prix demandé à la base.

Ayant obtenu ce jeu en solde pour un prix dérisoire, je ne regrette pas mon achat, mais je ne pense pas y rejouer encore longtemps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191390802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1503275700}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061402089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1495040083}
review:
Monster Loves You is a short game where you shape the story of a monster through your choices from birth to death. What I liked about the game is that the art style is cute and that there are so many endings that you can achieve, whether it's hunting down all of humanity to extinction or being the friendliest critter that connects monsters and humans together. My experience with this game feels like a D&D style board game where you have to make choices and roll dices to break through in critical moments. My only qualm is that the game's replayability sort of diminishes before you finish going through all the endings, mainly because you go through similar processes of "growing up" each time.

Nonetheless, I still liked the game for what it offered. If you like dynamic choice-making, multiple ending, D&D style game (and you love monsters or want to be one) then Monster Loves You is for you. Overall a solid 7/10 enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060302218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1501860223}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025326501', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1559014043}
review:
Monster Loves You! Was a very cute game to play, with many interesting stories to tell. The game gives you several options at the start about what kind of personality you want for your monster, and through every stage of his growth and life you will be able to earn experience (or points in different personality traits) depending on your decisions.

The more you play the more interesting it gets and you will be able to reach several different types of endings.

I think the price is worth the game and how many gameplay hours it provides. This is the kind of game that you can go back to from time to time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160324737', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1500915470}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122163777', 'num_games_owned': 1846, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1625552786}
review:
This is a pretty cute and very fun game all about choices.  

The writing is clever and the outcome of your choices can be surprising at times.  Each playthrough of the game you get a handful of scenerios to choose from to establish your monster's character and hopefully survive to the next stage.  Because the scenerios offered are randomized, and there are more scenerios offered at each stage than turns you take, every game will play out differently making each playthrough an unique story.  It's not the kind of game where you know how to get the next ending by simply altering one or two choices from one playthrough to the next.

I have played through this title over and over and I never get tired of just trying one more time.  There are 14 ending achievements to try and get, but because of the variety and randomization of each playthough it can be hard to figure out how to get all of them.  This makes for a game that satisfies on the casual level (seeing what kind of story you will have on this playthrough) and it also offers goals for the more driven player (just how DO you get that next ending).

For a game driven entirely on text, this one is quite entertaining!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1500444319}
review:
I was always a big fan of those old Choose Your Own Adventure books where pages would end with a choice that would send you off on different plotlines. The whole visual novel genre feels like the perfect place to revive stories like that, but it hasn't really happened in any conspicuous way. Monster Loves You! is like a lot of those little adventures and choices rolled into a big, gooey, adorable ball, which is probably why I found it so engrossing. It's not quite on the level of those literary odysseys of old, but its monstrous heart is in the right place.

The game cold-opens with you being formed in a spawning pool, as all monsters are. Through some initial choices you set the foundations for what kind of monster you'll become, and learn a little about the monster life cycle. From these sticky beginnings you guide your monster though childhood, adolescence, adulthood, and beyond by making decisions during key events in their life. These decisions affect a number of stats which define your monster, and later in life determine what they are capable of and what kind of ending they can achieve.

This might sound a bit heavy so let's dial it back to the part where you're eating garbage and scaring goats. All of these life-altering decisions come in the midst of monsters chewing on each others' heads, pranking each other, and screaming until their ears bleed. The quirky, friendly tone of the writing makes it clear this is a cartoony take on life (as if the vibrant art didn't give it away), and also takes the pressure off of making bad decisions. Nearly everything you do will raise at least one of your stats, though there are rare choices that do nothing or even lower stats a tiny bit.

Your monster is scored by percentage on their Cleverness, Honesty, Bravery, Ferocity, and Kindness. Presented with dilemmas like tricking, scaring, or helping a friend should lead to obvious increases in the corresponding stats. That's actually one thing I want to commend Monster Loves You! for, how clear the results of a choice will be from how it's presented. Other visual novel adventures like Vlad the Impaler don't really give any clues as to how a scene will affect you but all the choices here feel very well telegraphed, enough to easily max more than one stat without any prior knowledge. And once a stat is maxed, it opens up some new options depending on the situation.

Mechanically, there's very little else to the game besides making text choices. Each stage of your life has a number of days to while away, and on each of those you choose an activity. Activities are shown only as icons so you'll never be sure what's going to happen until you've been through them once before, a bit of a contrast from how clear the actual choices are. At the end of the third stage (adulthood) there's a check to see if you can proceed to the final stage, which offers some additional choices and a proper conclusion to the story of the monsters as a whole. It's all quite gratifying to work through, really, given how much thought and detail was put into constructing the monster world and society.

Running though one monster life should only take 30 to 40 minutes, and after that you'll pretty much be chasing endings and achievements. It won't take you long to recognize the same events coming up and start clicking through them madly so don't bank on a ton of replay value here. There is value to be had, though, in the charming writing and visuals that welcome you to the strange and wonderful world of family-friendly monsters. As long as you're not expecting anything sprawling or epic, Monster Loves You! is a fine little diversion that brings back the charm of choosing your own adventures.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198280108358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1679884472}
review: If you're a fan of multiple ending games that are more text-based (think along the lines of VN games) then I would definitely  try this one out, especially for the price. It's very visually appealing game, with well fleshed out scenarios that are fun to try and decipher. There are definitely a lot of choices to be made, but they are all important and impact your ending, and impact checkpoints in the game. 8/10, and a heck of a lot of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300955877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1526744030}
review: This game is absolutely adorable; and cracked me up more than once. It was a fun way to spend half an hour and I look forward to seeing other endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117898844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1585070835}
review: This is a sweet little game to pass the time, and gets you thinking about your monsters path and morals etc. There's not really a story, and each moster's life cycle is quite short, but there are multiple endings resulting in some replayability. I think this would be a fantastic game for kids helping them understand the consequences of their choices and actions, but not so much for adult audiences. That said, I've had some fun with it, but only really worth it's sale price of £1.74.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119779502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1500382470}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011129687', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1498587924}
review:
(This is from my blog - Kayas Arcade as a part of my 52 games in 52 weeks challenge)
https://www.facebook.com/Kayasarcade/

So my latest completed games has been some short ones. I've been pretty busy lately. 
But I'm playing for the adventure, story and experience - And I don't necessary need a lot of hours in-game to have that. 

Dejobaan Games' "Monster loves you!" is one of those games. 
I bought it on steam sale, the other day after having it on my wishlist for too long. 

It was not what I was expecting, but that doesn't need to be a bad thing. 

It's some kind of a text-based role-playing adventure, where you follow your monsterling to elderhood, through your decisions and choices. Every decision have an impact on your monsters personality, and how it will succeed in life. 

I've only had one ending so far, but it looks like you can get 14 different 'endings'.

At first it felt a lot like a child's game (... And maybe it is), BUT I had fun playing it, it was simple, fun and easy going. I think I'll try it a few more times, to explore the different possibilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021095629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1427576034}
review: Yeeehaw

author: {'steamid': '76561198056109781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 38, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1710440609}
review:
For a text-based RPG I found it engaging but at times very biased; most adventure choices are good or bad, no neutral or just a change of adventure. The additional music/sounds added don't really add to the atmosphere of the text. The fairy-tale cliche elements of the text are too cheesy, would be so much better if it was the author's own work which is good enough on its own; a strong point with the good artwork. Its a great start to a game, but not enough content: people will get one or maybe two adventures out of playing this before it gets too repetitive to play again - not really good value for the price expected. 

It's not a great game addition to the steam platform for people looking to give their video cards good use and get some decent interaction. It would be better suited to android/ios exclusive in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142072136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1486927932}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117184070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1513725308}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068975461', 'num_games_owned': 1824, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1575840612}
review:
Monster Loves You was fun the first playthrough but I was expecting a bigger variation of storyline the next playthrough/playthrough after that. There are scenarios you pick and choose within the game and they never differ from playthrough to playthrough. For a narrative game it'd be refreshing for it's sake to have different playthrough options depending on outstanding skills your monster gains, etc. 
I'm glad I bought it on Steam summer sale, definitely worth $1.62

author: {'steamid': '76561198108715659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1657641129}
review:
เล่นง่าย เหมาะกับคนที่มีพื้นฐานภาษาอังกฤษระดับนึง แนวเกมเป็นแนวเลือกตอบ ซึ่งตัวเกมจะมีช้อยส์ให้เลือกตอบเพื่อดำเนินเนื้อเรื่องถัดไปในเกม ทุกคำตอบมีผลต่ออนาคตของมอนส์เตอร์ว่าจะโตมาเป็นมอนส์เตอร์แบบไหน จะมีค่า cleverness , kiness, ferocity, braveress, honestly, respectful ให้ แต่ละช้อยส์ก็จะได้ค่านี้แตกต่างกัน

ข้อดี
- ภาพสวย สีสันสดใส มอนส์เตอร์น่ารัก
- เนื้อเรื่องสนุกและตลกดี
- เล่นง่าย เลือกตอบเฉยๆ ตอนจบไปหนึ่งช่วงจะมีแถบแสดงค่าว่าเราตอบได้อะไรมากสุด
- เสียงเพลงฟังสบายหู

ข้อเสีย
- คนไม่เก่งอังกฤษมีมึน แต่ศัพท์ไม่ได้ยากจนเกินไป พออ่านได้
- อาจจะเบื่อที่มีแต่ตัวเลือกตอนเล่น ไม่มีภาพประกอบตอนอ่านเรื่องและเลือกตอบ จะมีภาพให้ดูเป็นช่วงๆก็ตอนที่พักอ่านเรื่อง(มันมีนั่นแหละแต่มีกล่องข้อความเนื้อเรื่องพื้นหลังจางเห็นภาพด้านหลัง ที่หวังคือน่าจะมีภาพประกอบคู่กันเลย) ตรงนี้น่าเบื่อนิดนึง ทำเกือบหลับเหมือนกัน แต่พอเห็นภาพก็ให้อภัย เพราะชอบมาก

ถึงจะเขียนข้อเสียยาว แต่จริงๆข้อดีมันเยอะกว่ามากในความคิดเรา
คะแนน 7/10 สำหรับคนที่ภาษาอังกฤษกลางๆแบบเรา ตัดคะแนนไปตรงที่แอบน่าเบื่อตรงภาพประกอบถูกข้อความบังตอนเล่น

author: {'steamid': '76561198047727785', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1414866380}
review: It's a real game. If you consider that long conversation with your signifigant other about where to get food at for dinner a game also. Then yeah. It's just slightly more fun than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201220987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1621357936}
review:
Also ich habe mir das Spiel nur gekauft, weil es lustig aussah und im Sale angeboten wurde und muss sagen ich bin wirklich begeistert!
Dieses simple Hin und Her mit Entscheidungen die man treffen kann sind ziemlich abwechslungsreich und die Dialoge und Kommentare zwischen durch waren sehr unterhaltsam.
Zu dem hab ich gar nicht gemerkt wie schnell die Zeit vergeht. Den ersten Durchlauf hatte ich nach 70 MInuten durch auch wenn es mir wesentlich länger vor kam.
Ich würde es auf jedenfall weiter empfehlen. Vielleicht eher nicht zum vollen Preis, aber im Sale unbedingt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024884428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1499131238}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976205317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1504392851}
review:
Hallo Menschex,
das Spiel "Monster loves you!" ist ein wirklich süß gemachtes Choice Matters-Spiel, welches mit einem kindlichen Flair und kreativen Geschichten begeistern kann. Ich denke, dass das Zielpublikum durchaus etwas jünger ist, aber dann einen hohen "wieder-spielen-Wert" besitzt. Ich hätte mir an einigen Stellen gewünscht, dass auf die Charaktere die vorkommen, näher eingegangen wird, aber im minimalistischen Stil des Spiels, erfährt man schon einiges über die Monster-Mitstreiter, die einen teilweise über Strecken begleiten. 
Hier sollte noch erwähnt sein, dass der Spieler keine tiefgründige Story erwarten soll, die einen hineinreißt und bis zum Ende nichtmehr loslässt. Es ist eher ein netter Comic.
Dieses Spiel ist definitiv ganz witzig gemacht und für den Casual Gamer ein kleiner Zeitvertreib.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086616196', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1499048664}
review:
This game has a few "funny" parts but it is just really bland. $10 is way too much for a text based "adventure" game. I just felt like I was clicking text boxes for the entire hour that I played all just to get an achievement. Now if this game had more actual gameplay then it would be worth it. Like an actual simulator not a text adventure. Now since this game is on sale it is a dollar and some change but honestly I feel like I paid a dollar for boredom.

Now is there some differences in story? Yeah but it is just other situations that you have to click through. I wouldn't reccomend this game to anyone except maybe a little kid who just wants some goofy pick your own adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981109175', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1498865252}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078409807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1591597169}
review: It is a very good game, but it does take a lot of effort if you want to find all of the endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195441890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1501112099}
review: Sold some trading cards on Steam looking for cheap little time waster games and this perfectly fits that description. It's a simple, charming CYOA-esque story where you play as a cute little monster from birth to death. Choices make a definitive mark on the game & your stats which in turn determine which ending you recieve ( or if you can ascend to Elder status ). I wouldn't suggest picking it up for 9.99 as this game is rather short and can easily be finished in 40 minutes or so. It's good for those quick sales as I picked it up for 1.49 during the Steam Summer Sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355036865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1545667636}
review:
Monster Loves You is a cute little choose your own adventure novel kind of game.  You are a monster goig from birth to death and along the way presented with situations.  You pick the response of your monster.  How you pick will then determine either positively or negatively how it affects your stats.  The stats will determine how successful you are on certain decisions and play a more crucial role at the end.  In the end you will come up with one of 14 different endings.  Each ending has a different achievement both in game and on Steam.  The real goal is to real all 14 different endings.  So you must repeat the process over and over.

The game it cute and whimsical.  It's fairly obvious how to pick your actions to get the desired stat outcome, for the most part.  Some endings are slightly harder to get than others in the beginning.  After you've played it a few times you start to know how each situation will reveal itself and it becomes much easier to navigate the path you desire.  

You have to understand, there is a lot of repetition in this to get all the endings.  So if repetition isn't your thing, make this a pass.  If you're willing to keep at it then it's a fun game.  One play through doesn't take too long, but to do them all will eat up some time.  Because you're dealing with the same situations, some of it can become a bit boring after a while as you click through what once was funnny and cute but now is 9 clicks to get on with it.

Overall, I'm glad I got it and am enjoying getting my different endings.  It was on sale so I have no issue with the value.  If you're on a tight budget, then wait for a sale because it is a game that can get stale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090372817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1498804008}
review: Bought this during the summer sale and I have no regrets. It's funny, charming and it's fun trying to get all the different endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078723723', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1490483267}
review: Why would anybody play this? It's not a good visual novel, adventure game, make your own adventure, it is NOTHING. Only brain dead bufoons would consider picking this up for more than a cent, but even then I'd consider getting your money back. Stay away from this repulsive "game"

author: {'steamid': '76561198111063615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1519011527}
review: I had a hard time deciding whether or not to use recommend or not recommend. Overall this game is very cute with a great sense of humor. I purchased it for $1 on the steam summer sale and honestly I would of been annoyed if payed more than $5 on this game. While it is cute and has a nice asthetic to it, the game is beatable in 45 minutes to an hour. It's a good feeling to finish a game, but the click and choose which action best suits you scenario gets really boring after 2-3 play throughs. I feel like as an adult this game is more suited for young children. Overall, this game is great for the kiddies as it doesn't take long to finish and it can be played several times with multiple endings. Not a great game for someone used to massive games like witcher 3 or fallout 4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044303831', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1563818330}
review:
Bought for a buck and a half at the Summer Sale. It's a simple text based adventure with multiple endings based on your choices. It's fun, quick to complete a round and the achievements are fairly straightforward. Will be completing this game when I have the time. I love it. I wish there was a way to edit your own monster tho, even though you only play with one for an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002563224', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1498827451}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106816192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1590944774}
review:
Awesome game ! So many possibilities, and it changes everytime you create a new monster. The design is cute, the look of your monster changes depending on what qualities you chose to have. There is many possibilities and I find it fun to play with a friend, it is funny to see what kind of monster you can create together. 
So, my advice is to get it while it's cheap ! You'll enjoy it even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098195599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1541614780}
review:
This is a pretty short game, only about 40 minutes from start to finish. It's also pretty simple, not like Academagia or some other RPG simulations I've enjoyed, with complex skill sets and abilities. In Monster Loves You! all you do is choose one of two or three options for each scenario you un into, and each of these choices is pretty obvious in how it's going to affect your stats. You can become the type of monster you want to be easily, there's no real nuance to it. And the stats don't seem to alter gameplay a terrible amount except for the endings. Based on Steam achievements, there are 14 possible endings, so there's a decent amount of replay possibility here, but without my stats having more of an obvious impact, the emotional element that would make me want to replay the game that many times is just kind of lacking.

Defintely worth the price during summer sale, though! And probaly something kids who lke this sort of thing would enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025187751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1498283976}
review:
I love this game. I love the humor, the narrative choices, the fact that choices have definite consequences. I love the art and the simple game play. When I am tired and stressed, I power this game up and am comforted by knowing beyond a doubt that Monster really trully does love me.

Big thank you to the developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043583409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1498295416}
review: I achieved peace between humans and monsters and beat the game in the first try in 44 minutes. minimal world building is done, minimal character building, and their is nothing much here in general. worth 2 dollars tops, get on sale only if you like the novelty of being a monster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137598411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1498501275}
review: Cool

author: {'steamid': '76561198078492068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1631855010}
review:
"Monster Loves You" is a sort of choose your own adventure game where you play in a unique and creatively designed moster world.

The premise is cute and fun to play through, and makes you think about what kind of moster you want to be. Though it's not too difficult to get your ideal ending if you want (Bringing peace between humans and mosters), it's still a fun experience to go through.

I can't speak to it's replayability as I've only gone through once, but I feel I made a good choice in this purchase. If you're tight on money, I'd recommend buying it when it's on sale, as while it's fun, I can't guarantee it won't gather dust and be 10 dollars out of your pocket for what would be at most maybe a 5 dollar deal for you. However, I felt like it was fun enough that I might pick it up again, and I don't feel sour having spent 10 bucks on it.

Overall, I'd give this game a 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263438801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1495845001}
review:
Where do I start...This game was quite fun. I really enjoyed myself immensly. I do recommend the game. It isn't too time consuming if you stick with it. It is quite cute. If your into cute and point and click games, you will not go wrong with it. I plan on playing it again and again until I get bored with it. It isn't very graphic. It is mostly a storyline where you pick what happens. It sounds boring but it, actually, is quite fun as I stated previously. 

I love all type of games, especially RPGs and straight up Horror. This game is different, but I'm sure you will enjoy. I would try it when it goes on sale as I did. It is worth the little bit of money you will spend on it. Please enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286834887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1498882513}
review:
I played through the game completely blind and I stumbled my way into the 'Peace, Combined Prosperity' ending my first try, as well as maxing out my Honesty and Kindness (I refused to hurt anything (even that wolf that stole my food in my adult years, I WILL NEVER FORGET) and lie about anything (even that one time a giant monster attacked the town and after refusing to attack it, it got itself electrocuted on the power line, and the other monsters thought I did it. I told the truth, to the detriment of their respect, but I got the approval of the elder in return so I felt pretty good anyway~)). I turned into an Elder after hearing that I could instead of going in the Spawning Vat, helped Gnash-nash make peace with passing on after a life of Ferocity and I lucked out with my Bravery roll (I wimped out whenever fighting came along so I had 55%) and stuck next to the hot fire test, so I didn't fail any test. Once I was an elder I tried to bring humans and monsters to be friends and it worked out even when I failed the first human interaction by trying to help her marriage troubles since I forgot that humans and monsters didn't mix and I got chased out of the house when I broke into the house, lol. I got humans to 97% and monsters to 100%, so I lucked out there too.
Anyway, this is a game all about choice and choosing who you will be. 'Course, even after maxing out kindness and bringing relations between humans and monsters to 100%, when the humans come you can still eat them or declare war, which is a bit hilarious but weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038292472', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1495902390}
review: Несомненно милая текстовая (с картинками) игрушка. Но залпом такое проходить не будешь - разве что возвращаться к ней время от времени, чтобы потупить. Меня пока хватило на два часовых прохождения, может, со временем поиграю ещё, но Я не уверен, что игра стоит своих денег. Ну, зато со скидкой 75% досталось.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073982504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1435246299}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970430236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1496627780}
review: I read it to my kids and let them decide what to do. They loved it! Thanks for such a unique game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061167612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1496483279}
review:
Monster Loves You is not a terribly intellectual game in that it was not written to be complex. It was, however, written with wit and intellect, and its humour and simple, earnest beauty shine through. It is somewhat repetitive on replays, but it is evident that the creators have devoted great effort to mitigating this through the inclusion of multiple random quests. It is a calm, low-stakes game, that still grants a sense of achievement with each completion. As I play it I can't help but think that this would be an perfect storytelling game for young children, which is arguably the exact audience.

5 out of 5. Worthy, simple, good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264784049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1496464971}
review:
- INCREDIBLY FUN!!!!!!!!!!! 
- Aesthetically and narratively coherent (excellent music, sound design, and art style. Quite original, as well.)
- Multiple possibilities with creative choices and interactions
- You can play it alone and/or with other people of different age ranges (it'd be like sharing a cute and fun story book)

I laughed so hard so many times. It made me feel like a happy child and a satisfied adult, at the same time. Can I hug the developers?
Oh, man...I'd buy like 10000 copies for my friends and family. So, yeah, it's a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992132861', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1495764585}
review:
I guess its an OKAY learning game for young CHILDREN.  Very boring for adults. You dont actually DO anything, its effectively a long, drawn out personality quiz/ choose your own adventure book. (only more colorful).
This sort of thing would be better as a mobile app for tablet or smartphone. Its something you might use in a classroom for kids 7-12 to help them develop reading comprehension or interpersonal skills or decision making or something.
I got so BORED, so fast. You dont walk around or interact with anything. The game gives you a little story or scenario and you make a decision based on what you read and how you feel about it. 
Dont make the mistake I did going into this expecting an actual game or something. Dont trust game trailers. Watch 5 minutes of a "lets play"-type of review to get a better idea of what the game is about and what it plays like. 
Very lackluster, blah, meh, sort of feel. The music is surprisingly pleasant tho. 

I would only reccommend this game for small children. Its educational, but not very fun. (At least not for seasoned gamers.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198259834141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1495598075}
review:
You can buy it for your kids, but when on sale & watch one playthru before you buy to see if this is for you. This is a short game (demo sized actually) you can play a lot of times. Sadly 2/3rds of it is just growing up. If you don't want the game to autosave X out before the end of the single adventure. Also this game takes up more processing power than logical. Not a ton, just more than I expected.

5 Pros: 
1-Good kid game. A virtual novel in sheeps clothing.
2-Nice music; relaxing.
3-Interesting options & outcomes.
4-Choices matter.
5-Each playthrough has different (random) adventure options.

5 Cons:
1-You get one save file & I can't find it to copy it & skip all the kid adventure stuff to farm the endgame trophies. 
2-Bad odds: 50% my backside! I gave my heart away NINE times & died EIGHT of them with maxed out kindness.
3-I talked to some ants! Then gave a loser a snack! Then looked at frogs!  WHAT A GRAND ADVENTURE I'M HAVING!
4-/Yawn. Played this in a 2nd window between moves in a turn based game in a 1st window. (Hearthstone)
5-$10.00?!?!? Even the $2.50 sale price was pushing it, & I have kids to enjoy this with. I'm pretty sure I could have stolen a version of this somewhere & the file is smaller than some SWF game I have... My stupid honestly level is too high. /sigh

author: {'steamid': '76561198162703817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1495600567}
review:
A choose your own adventure type of game.

I've got to be honest and say it wasn't what I had imagined the game would be. Figured that you would control your monster with arrow keys or something, and start eating other monsters and people. Not at all a bad game if you like path branching, but what story there is, and the choices, aren't really something you would expect of a monster.

I kept trying to be an actual one, killing humans and fellow monsters, only to end up having monster kind annihilated by the end. Not really a fan, seeing as how I was looking for a product that was entirely different from what this offers. But my desires shouldn't really keep anyone who enjoys Choose Your Own Adventure choices, away from this.

It's simple, and kill a good half an hour or so, by the time you become an elder in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333351160', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1495675499}

author: {'steamid': '76561198209573016', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1495367095}
review:
Play it alone or grab your girlfriend, wife, siblings, sons or daughters and play the game with them! Plenty of choices to be made and the resulting outcomes are wonderfully executed. Only in English though, but this shouldn't be a problem.

All in All, I ate a puddle full of mosquitoe larvae 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314066753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1495265120}
review:
This is a very cute game, even the ferocious monsters have a sort of childlike playfulness to it.
Given that, it can be boring after few rounds.
This game is easy, perhaps too easy for some people.
Monster Loves You doesn't bombard you with paragraphs of pretentious words that makes you feel like "come on.. STFU!"

Although I don't think I want to invest much more time on this game trying to achieve different things, I think it is a well made game that is easy on the eye and the brain.
You'll probably want to wait for a 75% sale when it is $2.49 USD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089490722', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1494918885}
review:
Monster Loves You is a pretty sweet game for it's price tag. It's not common to see a text game with such love put into well...everything. It feels really sleek, and reminds me of some of the older 2000s games with how the UI and music work so well together. The game doesn't lie when it says you make a lot of choices, and the amount of endings give a pleasant amount of replayability. Additionally, the choices can be a 'lil tough if you happen to be a certain type of person. (For example, I tend to tilt more toward kind actions, so I'd have to forsake my sense of right to get some of these endings!) 

Finally, the game mixes dark themes perfectly with cleverly devised humor, something I don't see often in storytelling. It truly makes good use of it's genre. 

All in all, if you've got 10$ and don't know what to spend it on, I highly suggest this title. 

P.S. By the looks of the news bar, updates also seem to still creep around from time to time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998936597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1492989716}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044288193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1502503128}
review:
Monster Loves You!

And I love this game in return. It's a bit of a choose-your-own adventure game, a point-and-click title to be sure, and if that isn't your kind of game, you may not enjoy Monster Loves You!. It's short, too -- you can get through a game pretty quickly, and there's also a ton of reading to be done since the majority of the game is conveyed through text.

But-- that said, this game is still absolutely delightful for what it is, and if this IS your kind of game, you're going to have an amazing time. 

Visually, the game is delightful and eye-catching. The art style lends itself very well to the game and the stories that unfold, in my opinion! The music and sound effects are also perfectly on-point, as well, and honestly the main menu music is really good, it's something I listen to by itself because it's so peaceful. The design work that went into Monster Loves You! has not gone unappreciated as far as I'm concerned.

Mechanically, the game works by giving you different actions you can take at various stages of your Monster's life. There are MANY different choices you can make that infleunce your monster's growth, and each one has bearing on not just your stats, but on both your own life and the lives of your fellow monsters. Each time you play, it's a unique experience -- there are so many different events that can happen and choices to make that it keeps things fresh well into multiple playthroughs. Your choices really do have impact and shape how you grow up and how you can later impact the world, and the monster you grow into being will depend entirely on the choices you make. The number of things you can choose to influence the story, the different ways you can ultimately shape the world if you choose -- it's really special.

For those who are interested in them, there are Achievements for completing the game in numerous different ways, and that can incentivize a person to keep playing and to see what more the game has to offer.

At the end of the day, Monster Loves You! isn't a game for everyone. It's a mostly text-based adventure, it doesn't have multiplayer, and it gets repetetive over successive playthroughs.

But it's also a solid game, and it will hold your attention while you play it. It is polished and charming, and even in 2017, the devs are still maintaining and improving it. It is a robust experience for what it is, and even if it's not for everyone -- for those who did take an interest, well, I can at least personally say that I had a ton of fun with this game, and I still pick it up now and again because the world the developers have crafted is nothing if not endearing. It is FUN -- and sometimes that's all a game needs to be. Monster loves you is fun, and well-made, and it's funny and quirky and, at times, poignant, too. It is a well-made experience that puts a smile on your face when you play it, and I think that's a pretty great accomplishment.

And it's for those reasons that I can't recommend this game highly enough. Monster Loves You, and I love this game right back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960671971', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1492142908}

author: {'steamid': '76561198271159831', 'num_games_owned': 3081, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1492232211}
review:
This is an enjoyable game but not a great one. I've played it through twice in 40 minutes and I'm not sure that I care enough to play it through ever again (though I will probably let it run to pick up the last card).

You playthrough essentially depends on your reading speed. It is the perfect game to play with little children to help them with their reading and it's funny enough that an adult will get something out of it too. But it has no real longevity outside of that relationship I think.

It gets a thumbs up for me for being a great educational tool but I wouldn't recommend it to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011973384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1488147325}
review:
An absolutely adorable choose your own adventure book in game form. Each round takes like 10-20 minutes and it's nicely randomized so you'll get mostly different senarios. If you're not willing to play a game multiple times to get the full experience or don't like visual novels then I probably wouldn't recomend this. 

The price is a bit high for how much time you'll put into it but I think for the amount of work put into the game it's mostly worth it.

review:

3. ภาพสวยดี แม้ภาพจะไม่เยอะนัก ซาวด์น่ารักและติดหูมาก

ข้อเสียของเกมนี้...

author: {'steamid': '76561198035197045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 35, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1710740932}
review: You start off as a blob floating in a vat, and where your monster alter-ego goes from there is entirely up to you.  Each adventure you choose to take builds your character and determines whether you're to be feared, respected, reviled, or admired.  In the end, even the choices you make at the cusp of life and death can affect not just yourself, but the whole wide world at large.  So many different possible endings depending on how you play the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984712587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1489622876}
review:
First Impression Gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=usJ8hsoCyRM&list=PL0ChqurHdrD4GDyzfEWF1egV0jL1CVSbq&index=25

Ever wanted to experience life as a monster?
Wanted to make life decisions, interact with other monsters, and chose how you will be viewed by humanity?
The this game is for you!

A fun little game where ever decision you make will effect the outcome later in the game.
Will you be an evil monster who snacks on children?
Or perhaps a helpful monster who is a beacon to humanity?

[h1]PROS[/h1]
-Fun story line
-every decision you make effects how things will play out
-each play through takes around 45 minutes
-graphics are nice
-soundtrack is good
-did not experience and bugs or glitches
-had fun!

[h1]CONS[/h1]
-Maybe a bit pricey at $10
-This game would of been much better with some fun voice acting

author: {'steamid': '76561198047472296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1487213731}
review:
Monster Loves You! is an entirely unique, beautiful, and intriguing game. You start off as a larvae, a bit of monster formed in a spawning pool of goo, and you grow. Eventually, if you choose the right paths, you can even become and elder monster and not just shape the lives of monster kind, but the fate of humanity as well.

The art style is adorable, and alone reason enough to play. The charming story through the eyes of a monster is what brings a fun game into a category of being an instant classic. This game is also one with a lot of replayability. Each playthrough can be finished in a couple of hours, and there's over 10 endings, if I recall correctly. This game isn't that expensive, and it's well worth spending what little money it does cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023359027', 'num_games_owned': 1120, 'num_reviews': 735, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1489166232}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071677304', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1489725280}
review:
This is a cute, short, text-based, choose your own adventure story game. I feel people have been a bit harsh about it, so I'm going to give my honest thoughts. Note: I picked this up in the humble bundle, so I didn't pay full price for it (technically).

[h1] PROS [/h1]

-Cute art style! Very kid friendly and appealing. It's endearing. I wish there was MORE art to look at though, as most of the game is text based. I could see this being a book series for kids! :)

-Simple and easy to follow, again it's very kid friendly. I didn't have any confusion or difficulty understanding what to do, and the text is written in easy enough terms. However, it's not "too simple."

-More on the story text. It goes into just enough detail to weave together a nice story, without being overly complex. It's all about monsters so it can be a bit "gross" and "cartoonish violence" at times, but it's not disturbing or anything. It has a very whimsical charm to it. I know I've said this already, but it's probably aimed more for 8-12 yr old age range. But as a 25 yr old adult, I still enjoyed it. :)

-Multiple endings and many personal choices. I had fun seeing 2 different endings. It's short enough to run through 2-3 times in one night if you felt like it. So it wouldn't be too much for a kid to handle.

[h1] CONS [/h1]

-As I said.... it's for kids. So you might not enjoy it fully as an adult. The dialogue, story, art etc. is all aimed for a younger audience. 

-That said, the multiple choice endings are a bit shallow. There's no real point playing more than 2-3 times. I don't see myself grinding for achievements.

-It's more of a visual novel then a game. There's minimal animations, which is a shame because the art style is very charming. It's mostly just point n click, reading text, and using your imagination (which is not so much of a bad thing!)

[h1] OVERALL SCORE: 7/10 [/h1]

I'd pick this up on sale, if you have kids, or are new to the whole idea of choice based story games. It's a simple and cute way to get into the genre. I could definitely see myself digging this back when I was a kid too, and I still dig it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965743021', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1488582532}
review:
tl;dr: I had fun but it's nowhere near worth the price.

Nice art, fun story... not much game. You click through a series of events making minor decisions and then get an ending based on how smart, respected, strong, etc. you were. No problem, typical visual novel stuff, and a much more interesting premise than dating high schoolers. The problem is it took all of 75 minutes for me to play through TWICE, during which I saw several repeat events despite trying to pick a completely opposite style. I can't imagine a third playthrough.

For $1 this would get a hearty thumbs up. Anyone who pays $10 will be sorely disappointed. Some short games can justify a high price because they're that unique or amazing. This is not one of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065851303', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1488457713}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169827089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1586031827}
review:
Monster Loves You was a game I played because it looked interesting and odd. I was looking for some new ideas for games and was surprised to discover that it's a choose-your-own-adventure story. Not a lot of new elements were present as far as the game itself, yet I loved it. (The game itself was a lot like the old books which used character sheets)  I have no idea why it was so darn charming, but I played through to get the various endings and trying different approaches.

The writing, graphics, and music all mix well. While the gameplay itself is a pretty good interface to a very basic game, the story is unusual enough to be fun. It's an interesting take on what it means to be an alien creature. It's also a study in how simple games can be quite fun.

(I've played the game more on mobile than PC, since the mobile version was less buggy.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047288140', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1488156846}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009943170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1489172749}
review:
A great little game. I enjoyed two full playthroughs, one I made with Reputation at mere 35% or so, the other at over 50%. There was a difference in the main story.

Good thing is, there are so many side stories to choose from, that my playthroughs were quite different, even if I ended up as a Kind and Clever monster in both cases, but that was just because of my choices.

I guess I couldn't make myself to become a proper Ferocious monster even if my life depended on it. :-)

Kudos to the makers of this game. Thank you for something so different than the mainstream. I would wholeheartedly recommend the game to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982079483', 'num_games_owned': 1293, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1487540183}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a simple and short Choose Your Own Adventure game. I had the initial impression that it was a point-n-click adventure, but that was very wrong.

The game play revolves around making choices. There are no puzzles of any sort in the game. The gameplay consists of clicking on different icons that start an event that then present different choices for you to pick. The first two thirds of the game incentives building up all your stats as best as you can so that you can eventually become an elder. I failed the first time through and returned to the goo from whence I came to pass on memories to future generations. You can think of those failures as premature endings with little variation depending on your main stat.

My second playthrough was more successful though and I became elder. I decided that I wanted peace between humans and monsters which was easy enough to do since I knew what to do to build up my stats very high all around. The ending variations at this point are much more interesting than the goo type. Unfortunately, while there are some funny or interesting moments, the game’s overall writing wasn’t really compelling. There was hardly a resolution in place for the peaceful ending I acquired which made it feel abrupt.

Replaying the game isn't very attractive since the CYOA aspect is heavily dictated by the desire to max your stats versus making interesting choices. What I mean is, any choice you pick that might seem fun or logical can feel wasted if you could've gained much more by making the "correct" choice. There are plenty of endings to collect for those that don't mind going through the same events over and over. In comparison, I thought Choice of Robots had a more interesting way of making game altering choices from earlier on which kept my engaged for many more playthroughs. I felt satisfied after only two rounds with MLY!.

Monster Loves You! is merely an okay game and does seem geared toward a younger audience. It functioned and didn’t do anything that made it fall into “bad” territory, but didn’t do much to take it past an average, somewhat forgettable experience. If you're interested, I'd recommend waiting until sale season.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051083217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1487539833}
review: What a monstrosity!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024591446', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1487446966}
review:
I loved, loved, loved this game.  It took me about an hour to beat, but the humor and story were perfect (I was genuinely laughing at certain points) and I really cared about the little monster I created.  Although the game encourages you to replay to get all of the rest of the endings, I had little desire to revisit the same scenarios over and over again.  So if you're anything like me, you're really looking at about two hours of gameplay tops.  If you do decide to go completionist, I imagine you'll quickly get bored at the redundancy and the early charming humor of the game may end up actually becoming an annoying slog to get through.  Just a possible word of warning.

I'm recommending this game enthusiastically (again, I had a great time), but believe it's priced a bit too high for what you actually get (I think it should be a $4.00 game tops).  Definitely pick it up when it's on sale or included as part of a bundle.

I've deliberately not mentioned many details of the game because I feel like the experience is best going in as blind as possible.  Even if you do spend full price for this game, I doubt you'll regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073404675', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1487526314}
review: This was pretty much a half-hour long visual novel, but it wasn't anything particularly interesting.  It is a really interesting concept, as you follow a monster from birth to death and help them make decisions in life in a choose-your-own-adventure format, but overall, it fails to deliver much in terms of interesting choices.  If it were on sale for a really low price and you really like visual novel games, then it might not be bad, but for most people, I'd recommend passing on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049061232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1487027324}
review:
Other reviewers define this game as one of the rpg game books that existed (or still exist?) back up to the early 2000. It is in fact a sort of rpg short game which runs around the life of a monster, from childhood up to its elder age. It is designed so that you very progressively build up your monster's personality, through short "challenges" where you get to choose actions to perform, getting in return positive or negative attribute values and respect. 

As a whole, it clearly is more of a textual rpg rather than a 2D videogame. There aren't many backgrounds at all, and nearly all of the time you'll be busy getting through the challenges, which are all presented in a textual manner.

The "dialogues" or anyway, the screenplay is decently written (aside perhaps of a few mistakes here and there), it's not triple A material but it does the job with a bit of humor.

Tìhe game also has a background sountrack which is quite likeable to listen to actually, although it might get repetitive if you play the game twice or more.

Each playthrough probably requires between 50 to 60 minutes, depending on how fast you jump after the dialogues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090419312', 'num_games_owned': 1773, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1486945753}
review:
5.5/10

+ Pretty enjoyable if you've never played a text-only Choose Your Own Adventure game before. My one previous attempt, The Forest of Doom, felt much more tedious and ended prematurealy.
+ Eventful for such a short game. From birth to elderhood (and more) in 1 hour.
+ Music and sound effects (though minimal) are very fitting
+ No rolling dice 

- Very misleading screenshots in the store page. 99% of the game is choosing between textual options. Only 2 of the 10 screenshots are representative of this.
- Not my kind of game. Not the game's fault, just not my thing.

I only played enough to get one ending, but I believe it's sufficient to grasp the concept of how Choose Your Own Adventure game work. I probably won't try to get the other endings in the foreseeable future. My backlog is full of games that are much more appealing to me, and I don't care about achievements etc. Bottom line is that I wouldn't pay full price for this game, but I think it's worth getting in a bundle, if only to get a chance to familiarize yourself with this type of games (if you're not already familiar with it).

author: {'steamid': '76561198069206818', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1492763958}
review: This is a really great little game. It's family friendly, and it's short enough to be played in an hour or so, with a couple of different endings to make a replay or two worthwhile. I managed to pick it up on sale for next to nothing, and I'm pleased with my purchase. A+

review:
