author: {'steamid': '76561198217107077', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1543807781}
review:
*TLDR: Wish I could have turned into the slimy embodiment of pure cuteness.. but over all 7/10 would play again and again... and again..*

*TLDR 2, Electric boogaloo: How hard is it for me to make the right choices to be the happy*

A very sweet and heart warming game based on the paths you pick and venture down. I was surprised by the length of the game though. I beat the one route in 20 minutes, thankfully there is multiple and certain routes take longer than others. The music blends in well with all the other aspects of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997671213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1515727566}
review:
This game is cute and sweet like others have said, and it's one of the few games my girlfriend enjoys playing with me so that's a plus.

I first torrented this game to see if it was any good and after a few playthroughs I had to give these developers their due. 

I really love The Yawhg and this is a really similar play style. I wish there were more games that had presentation like MLY because it's much more immersive than other visual novel type games that I've played.

It's true there aren't a ton of different endings but honestly I've put about 5 hours total into this game and if you buy it on sale then $6~ is definitely a good exchange.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092552667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1436128629}
review:
A cute game, very plot-driven, with some nice choiches to make so to get all endings. Especially nice you can play on your phone, so lovely to do on a long train ride etc. Also nice for younger gamers. Nothing very intense or something, and some replay value if you just pick it up once in a while.

Worth ~5, wouldnt play the full 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030933682', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1476629829}

author: {'steamid': '76561198147684884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1448561941}
review:
Anyone remember the Choose Your Own Adventure book series? Well, this is the same thing... but with limited monster animation below the choice selection. I played it through multiple times in ~3.5 hours waiting for something interesting to happen, and can't say I was ever satisfied.


To be fair, I'm likely not the target demographic... but this game seems like it would struggle to keep even a child's interest after 2 playthroughs. If it were $5, I could say it might be worth the price... but I expect a lot more from a game in the $10 price range (e.g. Undertale).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008946406', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1484336872}
review:
"Monster Loves You" is a simple yet entertaining visual novel.
With each decision you gain (or loose) character trait points (honesty, bravery, ferocity, cleverness or kindness) which affect the ending of the game.
It's very charming and well written.
Pick it up on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002280895', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1373580716}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013260562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1483347329}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a super cute visual novel where you grow up as a monster. You make choices as a monsterling to determine the basis of your personality, then make choices as an adult to gain the respect of your fellow monsters. If you survive to become an elder, your choices can affect the relationship between humans and monsters to bring about peace or conflict. There are several different endings, so there's a  lot of replayability. There are a variety of adventures, though some do repeat in each playthrough. 

Overall, I enjoyed and recommend it. 

For some reason, however, this developer seems to hate cats. D=

author: {'steamid': '76561198104392527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1481950787}
review:
"Monster Loves You!" is literally a Choose Your Own Adventure text game, with some general background drawings. It's not the same as an exploration game where you punch in keywords or try to work your way around somewhere.

The time it takes to complete the actual game is 30 to 40 minutes, depending on how fast you're picking options and reading. Technically, you can fly through it in approximately 15 minutes or less if you know what events and choices you want. Each achievement for the game is completing it with a new ending, and when you replay, the events don't change unless you trigger something specific at the first endgame point.

If you care about getting the achievements, you can reuse saves as some guides explain. It really is not that worthwhile to replay it 14 full times because more than half of those times you'll be choosing the exact same actions.

I thought the game looked a bit interesting in drawing style, hence why I got it. But it turns out that there really aren't that many different graphical screens. And most of the time, they're just shadowed out because of the text boxes, sitting on top of the screen for you to read and decide upon.

Your monster has a set of stats that you can increase as you choose certain events, and the game's ending is determined essentially by those stats, as well as a few other endgame choices. No event until the "final" age event actually triggers the ending. Thus, the game fits an exact carbon-copy mold of the same general things happening over and over, which also adds to your boredom and the game's lack of fun replayability.

Going through the adventure of the game was just really disappointing, as not many of the events are that exciting. The developer's claim of the 900+ choices is quite an exaggeration, since most events don't differ by much at all with their choices. And the fact that it's an extremely short story means that it doesn't require any investment or make you even care about what is happening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083677407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1481470698}
review:
Groovy idea.
Yet boring execution. 
If I had realized it was only roughly a half hour of game play from start to finish I would have saved my money. 
I guess I was just expecting something...more. 
If this were an open world game that had continued evolution of your monster and its personality that lasted at least several hours, I would be more interested. 
As is, I regret wasting my money. 
That's not to say it isn't a pretty game to look at and a nifty idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007215043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1478182488}
review:
Милая игрушка про жизненный путь монстра. Игра сделана в стиле текстового квеста. Вы выбираете события и один из нескольких вариантов дальнейших действий. Каждый вариант имеет свои последствия и отражается на росте или падении основных скилов. В конце игры все суммируется и подводится итог всей вашей монструозной жизни :) Игрушка реиграбельная. Английский в ней не сложный. Школьного уровня хватит. Русификатора нет. 
В целом. 250 рублей. Да если еще на распродаже ухватить - то годно. Хороший таймкиллер на пару вечеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086917932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1476065770}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a choose-your-own-adventure-esque RPG from Radial Games and Dejobaan Games LLC. Let’s get rocking.

The Good

It’s hard to classify what genre this game should fall into (gameplay wise) as it is very similar to a visual novel, but it does have aspects of an RPG. Whatever it is, it does a good job of being what it is. MLY! has a lot of possible endings and a lot of ways to get to those endings. Naturally, this provides a lot of replay value, which is always a good thing.

The artwork in the game is consistently charming. It is kid friendly (some of the content may be a bit darker for younger audiences. just so you know) and vibrantly colored.

The game as a whole, I think, is very creative. You, as the player, experience the entire lifespan of a monster from spawning to death. What events fill the time in between those two are entirely up to you. Every choice you make in the game not only counts, but very significantly impacts your late and end game.

The Bad

Go ahead and scroll on past this one.

The Meh

If you’re not really a fan of reading, this may not be the game for you.

If you’re looking for a gory, violent game about being a monster, this may not be the game for you.

Verdict: Yea

All in all, Monster Loves You! is a fun, lighthearted game that, I think, anyone can enjoy playing. If you’re looking for something to do around Halloween time and you’ve got some extra cash, take a look at this game. If you have kids and you’re looking for a game for them to play around Halloween, this could just be your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125613545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1475634140}
review:
This game is very charming, with cute artwork and soothing, atmospheric music. It's mostly text-based, however, so if you aren't a fan of reading, you won't like it. But if you are a fan of choose-your-own-adventure books, you'll probably like it. 

Some of the outcomes of the choices you make can be a bit frustrating, though, as if the author was reaching for a way to dock points from certain categories, and the scenarios you select are only presented as icons that have no indication of what categories they'll affect. Also, it's not that apparent which choices will potentially earn/lose respect for your monster.

It took me about an hour to play through a monster life cycle, and although it will be a while before I come back and play again, I definitely will keep this game in mind when I need an hour's worth of calm gameplay to try for all of the endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 365, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1459916971}
review:
I got this game as a gift from a friend first off.

About this game:

A text game basicaly where you are a mosnter born and then get thrown into different situations. Problem is, this particular game is buggy. For example, the ending just freezes up the the game. As much as i want to upvote this...in good conscious i cannot due to it being buggy. If you still want to try it, it is somewhat fun if it was not for the bugs. I suggest if you want to try it, wait for a sale to buy it.

Also, there is a repition issue. The game store page states the game changes storyline every time you play, but it really does not. It just rehases it over and over again in different situations...sure it is fun for like 2 rounds of it, but it gets old very fast. It might be enjoyable to a very young child though..

author: {'steamid': '76561198045655704', 'num_games_owned': 3545, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1473862380}
review:
[i]Monster Loves You![/i] est un petit jeu agréable dans lequel on va créer l' "histoire" de notre monstre via de multiples petits choix à faire. Ces choix, en fonction de l'âge de notre monstre, vont modifier nos statistiques, notre niveau de respect, ou encore nos relations avec les monstres et les hommes.
Personnellement, je savais à quoi m'attendre en achetant le jeu, je n'ai donc pas été déçu. On ne fait que choisir quoi faire selon les événements, jusqu'à la conclusion de notre histoire. On ne fait que lire, et apprécier les dessins avec l'ambiance sonore qui les accompagne. Mais l'univers est extrêmement sympathique, les graphismes sont mignons, les sons et musiques sont bien adaptés à l'ambiance, et l'humour est au rendez-vous pour une aventure haute en couleurs.
Toutefois, le début étant sensiblement le même pour chaque partie, on peut s'en lasser après 2 ou 3 playthroughs, réduisant la réjouabilité du titre. Le prendre en solde peut être une bonne idée.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061519611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1472648327}
review:
I am on the fence for this one since the graphics are cute and there was obviously a lot of love put into making this game.

Ultimately I cannot recommend this game for the price given its limited gameplay and repetitiveness. The other reviews explain the mechanics well so I won't dwell on it, but there really should have been more choices available. Most 'levels' have you choose something like 12 or 14 actions out of 15 to 18 options. So even in a single playthrough, you are going through like 80%+ the options. Most actions are not complex enough to have more than 2 or 3 outcomes, so it really limits replayability. It makes completing the primary goal, which is getting all the endings, quite the chore.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085496853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1472001271}
review:
Received free via Steamified.

Overall score 7.5/10 

Let me start off by stating that this game plays much like a choose your own adventure book. A very very well done choose your adventure book. It has a ton of compelling visuals that tie a lot of the lore together. THere are a lot of positives about this game: the textual descriptions are detailed and tie the various approaches to the story together. THE main negative to this game, s many have stated, is the length. It is a rather short game for 10 bucks, especially if you're looking to play through it once. It's value lies in multiple playthroughs. Experimenting with different character builds is where this game shines. exploring the different options the game gives you  is a very fun experience. LAthough the gameplay stays very static with no huge mix ups, the varying options given to the player keeps the game from hetting too stale. Overall, it is a well done, if not generic choos your own adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263258179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1472485201}
review:
I thought i'd leave a review for this since i just completed it,[THIS REVIEW WILL CONTAIN GAME SPOILERS] Monster Loves You!{MLY! for short} is a cute but slightly short build your own story and adventure type of game, it's quite fun and the replayability is at least three to four since there are so many options!

The options vary and change for every new game, though i will admit getting achievements was more grinding through the game over and over and did get tiring after a while. A good thing about the game is its varied endings, there are the endings in which you choose to dissolve{though i'm afraid that once you've dissolved once the others are practically the same thing for the other traits} and endings where you ascend to elder status - these are actually a little different every time.

The other sneaky options and secret endings were quite fun to try and figure out though, the neurosurgeon one was pretty cool.

Tl;DR - MLY! Is a cute adventure story game and it has varied endings to go for, it has a repeatability factor too and the choices are randomly generated which changes things up a bit, overall a good game if you like that type of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138322835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1527289185}
review: I've spent a long time trying to decided how best to review this game, but it all comes down to this: it's cute, not fantastic, but cute. The cartoons are sweet, it's silly but not so much so that you roll your eyes through it, and the first run or two was pretty fun... but also pretty short. And not too re-playable. After my two run-throughs, I'll probably never open this game again. The music, art, and story are all charming, but not very substantial. If you see this game on sale, and you're already into this genre, then sure, buy it. Or if you're looking for a fun game for your kids it's a good choice. But if you're just casually looking for something, I don't know that I would recommend this game at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142425438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1514886839}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990542529', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1484841666}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054404896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1470065443}
review:
This game certainly wasn't what I was expecting it to be. I was under the impression that making decisions to develop how your monster grows meant exactly that. I was expecting more than an interactive story.

If anyone saw my library, they would see that I have no problem playing story-based games. I love story-based games. However, the story-based games I purchase allow me to watch the story unravel as I play them. This story-based game is little more than a "choose your own path" book with a few pictures. If I wanted a "choose your own path" story with a few pictures, I'd purchase a book. It'd be cheaper and I could take it back to the bookstore for credit when I was finished.

On the other hand, however, the story was different and the perspective was fascinating. If you don't mind a game that's almost entirely text-based, by all means, purchase it. If you are expecting to actually see your monster develop and grow, you will be horribly disappointed. Its only saving grace for me was that I purchased it on sale and I lost very little in doing so.

I do not recommend this game unless you A) know what you are getting yourself into and B) don't mind paying the price for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2456, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1470643275}
review:
선택지 게임.
게임을 진행을 하면서 여러가지 상황이 주어진다.
이때 선택에 따라서 성향이 증가, 감소한다.

성향은 인간과의 관계에 영향을 준다.
어떤 선택을 하느냐에 따라서 다양한 결말을 맞이할 수 있다.

어떤 선택을 해야할지 모르겠다면, 선택지 옆의 아이콘으로 선택해도 좋다.
어쨋든 몬스터는 당신을 사랑합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198310383472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1555784751}
review:
This looks like a child's game at first, and in some ways, it is. But the title doesn't have anything to do with the game, really. Other than that you play as a monster. It's a really creative storyline, actually.

You start off as a small little monsterling. Here you go in adventures, starting to build up your new personality. But even the youngest must grow up. You move on to adolesence and go on even more adventures, your choices building your personality further. One day, you get pulled out of bed by Elders. They decide your main personality trait, and test you on it. Here you can earn some respect. You move on to adulthood, where you must earn respect and form your personality even further. But you'll start to dissove soon.. If you've earned enough respect and pass the test, you'll ascend to Elderhood, where your choices will sway the likings of monster to man, and man to monster. You can either start a war, killing all humans, getting all monsters killed, or the beginning of an endless war. Or you can bring peace to both man and monster, and live in harmony together. But if you've failed to gain the respect you need, you'll dissolve into your main trait and leave behind your personality for other generations..

This is a game you can play anytime. It soothes stress and anxiety, making way to laughter and joy. The animation is good, the colors are easy on the eyes. Unfortunatly, you are not able to name or customize your character. But I highly recommend this game anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233800512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1467583285}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118014215', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1480980683}

Es ist wirklich ganz spassig. Man erlebt viele Dinge und muss viele Entscheidungen treffen und je wie du dich entscheidest entwickelst du deine eigene Persönlichkeit. Also ich fands ganz cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060280130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1388250890}
review:
This game isn't for me. I don't like it, I thought it was going to be something different. But it was recommended to me by a friend so I bought it (in 2013).

I don't recommend it because I just didn't find anything about it fun or entertaining, personally. The limited customization didn't make up for the various outcomes in the story-line, and the story itself was just too dull for me. The challenges weren't challenging in the right way.

You make a little monster and answer questions that make up a story and your decisions affect the outcome. That's all I can tell you, because I only played it once YEARS ago and didn't get very far before I closed the game and never played it again. Most of my time was actually AFK.

At the time Steam didn't offer returns/refunds, so I uninstalled it and forgot about it. Now, however, I'm stuck with the game since the purchase was made so long ago (even though I have the less than 2 hours played requirement and the last date played is the same as the purchase date...sigh). 

PLEASE UNDERSTAND I'm not saying this is a bad game; it has great reviews. But it's an ill fit for me, and one glance at my game library would tell you why.  So if you're not sure about this game, do some research before purchasing and don't screw yourself out of a refund should you change your mind afterwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040561364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1480296620}
review: It's a cute game, if rather simplistic in its representation of good and evil, but then I'm definitely a sucker for the choose your own adventure storyline. The graphics are adorable, and none of the text blocks are too unwieldy. I'm not sure I would pay full price for it, but it's still a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280037559', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1467041890}
review:
Played it for like 20 minutes, reached 3rd, or 4th stage of monster growing and went for refund. WTF did I spent my money on? I stopped reading text after 1st stage of life! And I am a person that enjoys narrative concepts of the games. This one here is doing everything wrong. 

If you plan to buy this game - don't! It is boring as hell, has meaningless choices, crappy interface, terrible soundtrack and ruined concept. 
If you bought this game less than 2 weeks ago and not played it for more than 2 hours - refund it and get your money back, as I did.
If you bought this game and left it on your shelf then I feel for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122384409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1470503550}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995036531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1467090195}
review: This game was $2.50.  I played it for about two hours. I had fun, I'm done with it. Definitely worth $2.50. It's cute and funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007182557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1492547679}
review:
It's humour; pure humour. If you don't enjoy games that are about making choices and seeing how those choices affect your character's development, as well as the world around you, then this game isn't for you. If you do, however, then this game will make you laugh.
After all, how often do you run into a game where you grow out of a vat like a amoeba, turn into something nature could only invent when it's drunk on whisky, and get Kindness-points when you feed your colleague an entire ant colony?

This games takes the old concept of allowing the reader (player) allowing to influence a story's outcome through interaction, and makes a computer-game out of it. Will you turn Kind, and work to increase understanding between monsters and humans? Or will you become Ferocious, and wage war until all the humans are dead?
...while discussing the philosophy of rocks, and feeding your fellow monsters entire ant colonies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274344925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1701330816}
review:
Monster loves you is a choose your own adventure game reminiscent of choice of games, however it has graphics.

The game is generally fun, and I am enjoying myself looking for the different endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146745156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1467614605}
review: Have heard many reviews saying that this game starts getting dull after the second play through. Wrong! Remains very cute and interactive, and certain adventures change each time you play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032989995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1466800592}
review:
I'm a lot into games that you just have to sit and enjoy the story without any stress or worry. This is a game you won't stress over, you will just sit and enjoy the story you're creating. And the sense of accomplishment after giving my monster a full life made me happy in a very innocent way.

Unfortunately, the customization is poor, you can't name your monster and the game is too rushed, so you don't have time to get attatched to your monster. 

But it was a nice experience for sure. I loved every second of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180284799', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1466720422}
review: Cute little story, with multiple endings, depending on what your actions are through out the story depends on what ending you will have. Throughout your life as a monster and the decisions u make depends on what your stats will be and u can use them  (if they're good enough) in the future to win conversations or fights.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2454, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1495819131}
review: Adorable little indie casual game about the birth, life and death of a monster which you control by multiple choice visual novel dialogues. A little fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206057693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1459712791}
review:
A really quick game to play but as it has multiple outcomes it will be a game I keep returning to, it requires very little concentration so it's a nice, easy game to chill out with. 

The visuals of the game are cute, good colours and a clean, simple design. 

It reminds me of "Long Live The Queen" in a way because the choices you make affect the outcome and give you trait points (kindness, bravery and ferocity for example) which will then further affect decisions you can make. 

Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097769529', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 320, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1409760968}
review: Bir oyun düşünün ; sizi saatlerce oyalayabilecek,hikayesi sizi saracak,grafikleri büyüleyecek ve konuşmaları çok etkileyecek. Sonra o düşündüklerinizi bir kenara koyun ve bu oyuna bakın. Bir oyun bu kadar mı boş olur lan seni bana öneren arkadaşın annesinin ellerinden öpeyim. Baban ölsün inşallah. 3 dolar bayılmıştım şu salak oyuna bide zamanında,o zamanlar iade olayı da yoktu tabi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123404356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1464624079}
review:
Style is cute and also the soundtrack is very nice.
Maybe the only one minus in the game is that there's so much text to read and you can't really interact with anything and it might get boring in a while. Otherwise I really enjoyed playing it.
Soon I'm going to play it again, let's see what kind of monster I'm going to turn out then!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080640831', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1463510025}
review:
If you think it was difficult growing up as a human, just consider how it would have been growing up as a monster. Your life starts in a tank of slime and while growing up you gain different amounts of personality traits (bravery, cleverness, ferocity, honesty, and kindness) and the respect from other monsters based on the desicions you make as monsterling, adolescent and fully grown monster. If you are sufficiently respected you may continue your monster career as an elder, or you get recycled in the tank. You may even go on to achieve great accomplishments in the diplomatic interactions between monsters and men. You can write monster history!

Monster Loves You! is a cute little game, or rather a cute little interactive story, where the choices you make matters. It is very nice in small doses, but after a couple of lifetimes the little adventures you experience starts getting a bit repetitive. The same can be said about the music. It is interesting that the way some choices influence the personality are not immediately obvious, but that they start to make sense after a while when more is learnt about monster life. The storyline is inventive and clever and the monsters are cute to look at. Monster Loves You! offers a relaxed escape from the human reality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053116592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1463358282}
review: Holy Wow!  Monster Loves You is an amazing game!  Way more deep than I first expected.  Decisions matter, so what kind of monster will you be?  Got it on a sale, but way worth the price of admission!

author: {'steamid': '76561198156639220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1461338388}
review:
Ok, the game isn't BAD.
But it's SO short!

The art is good and the writing is witty and fun...

But really... £6+???

If the game were to be like £2.99 or so, I'd have nothing to complain about!
So, overall, it's a well-designed and fun little game, that is WAY over-priced!
If you find it on discount grab it, otherwise I'd suggest you give it a skip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023927927', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1677955131}
review: What a surprising little game.  You're a monster making choices throughout stages in your life.  You can be brave, or not.  Honest, or clever.  Maybe you'll become and elder, or perhaps you'll fail miserably.  Will humans and mosnter co-exist peacefully?  Will you eat the human race?   I can't even begin to tell you how great it is to have such an entertaining, story-based, quick to play game like this that doesn't bore you to death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091480928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1519048427}
review: Cute little , funny, text based game. I recommend if you like these type of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055979291', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1546302920}
review:
A cute game. I've played (and fully completed) the mobile app, and loved it. There are some proof-reading errors that could be tended to, and the game is a little bit lengthy for those who've played it before. It would be a perfect little game to get on sale but, in my opinion, loses its replay value quickly and thus isn't worth the full $10.

Still, for a fan of visual novels or choose-your-own type games, Monster Loves You! is a decent find.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034814231', 'num_games_owned': 1930, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1552676240}
review:
There is something special about Monster Loves You!

Simple, but deceptively replayable. It's a choose-your-own-adventure type of game, starting you as a monsterling that was just born. With multiple stats (initially at zero), your actions will lead to the community respecting you (or not) and increasing statistical values about your personality (bravery, cleverness, etc.).

This is simple but, again, rather adictive. After 6 hours and about 8 (?) playthroughs I'm still getting newer and newer stories as I go along, which adds the replay value of the game (besides the fact that it possesses 14(!!) ending, to my knowledge).

Graphically it's just multiple backgrounds with no real animations (unless you click your monster avatar, which will make him jump and say weird shit xD), so to review graphics, I'd really review one thing:

[h1]UI (INTERFACE)[/h1]

Nothing short of great. Buttons are clear, with something indicating what the story behind each clickable button may consist of. A scared monster face may lead to a story about investigating a human house, for example. Nothing more to say, really, informative, simple and slick, the UI excells in this adventure game unlike for of its genre.

[h1]AUDIO[/h1]

With no voice acting, that leads the music which is kind of a few tracks that repeat themselves. They are pretty good and chilling, suiting the happy and cute atmosphere the game transmits.

[h1]STORY[/h1]

Barely got anything to say about it:

You start -> You're born.
Game ends -> You[spoiler] shifted the course of the world, creating an endless war between monsters and humans, or united them into one civilization filled with compassion and honor between eachother. OR you simply died, recognized for the trait you leveled up the most (braveness for example).[/spoiler]

This allows for alot of replayability considering you like the style and the atmosphere of the game. Since it's pretty much YOUR story, relatability to the main character resides in you and only you. It's well done and the cuteness of your activities, monster reactions, UI design and drawing [b] give the game a MASSIVE boom of charm and interest to the player. This is precisely where you'll find the best part of the game. The juxtaposition of the charming style and the story make the game worth, in my opinion a purchase at any price equal or below its base one (9,99€).[/b]

The emoticons are expensive as fuck, tho. Anyway, I digress. Game's fully worth it for it's uniqueness among the genre. A solid 8/10 for me!

[h1]P.S: Kinda weird steam updated it's review system and forgot the much asked "meh button", the score system introduction and all that...[/h1]

The game is amazing and has nothing to do with said "Meh" button, but still... this review system still feels rather barebones and Valve sure has the potential to make this a great environment for a complex but useful review system (since any idiot can hop on Metacritic for example and bash a game they don't like, like Call of Duty (and that does happens to CoD, we all know it!)).

[b]Anyway, just my 2 cents...[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006665723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1457987003}
review:
Глядя на скриншоты и описание, я думал, что передо мной некое подобие адевенчуры, тэг "приключенческая игра" на это тоже  намекает.
Я ошибался, фактически игрой это произведение можно назвать с натяжкой.
Monster Loves You представляет собой линейное повествование, в котором единственным геймплены элементом является выбор строчек в диалогах. Собственно, бэкграунды и диалоговые окна и составляют весь контент в игре, нет ни минигр, ни даже простеньких роликов, ничего.
Наверное, это неплохая развивающая игра для детей 5-7 лет ... англоговорящих детей, потому что язык простым не назовёшь.
Нельзя сказать, что игра мне не доставила совсем никаких положительных эмоций и заставила жалеть о потраченном времени. Но больше 30 рублей она на мой взгляд не стоит.

Плюсы:
- милота
- можно вырастить вырастить монстра на свой вкус

Минусы:
- "игра" очень короткая, всё "прохождение" займёт час
- геймплея нет
- контента нет
- истории нет

author: {'steamid': '76561198092002185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1461703647}
review: I've had this game in my game library for a while. As I like multiple endings games I thought I'd give it a shot. This game is clearly a children's game and will not appeal to gamers who are more than 10 years old.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987572242', 'num_games_owned': 1477, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1461006838}
review: Monster Loves You is a game about monsters growing up and living in a monstrous world. You could think of it as a visual novel or gamebook; in structure, it actually has a lot in common with Choice of Games games, although there are illustrations and music. The text and artwork quite charmingly evoke the world of the Monsters and their childlike view of things. The music is also quite catchy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177030789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1684013319}
review: I like its theme of you picking your side humans or monsters or both

author: {'steamid': '76561198052992316', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1458411920}
review: Looked great from the preview, but they forgot to mention that there are no actual gameplay elements.  You make decisions (usually between 2-3 options) and they rather predictably raise or lower one of five metrics (honesty, ferocity, bravery, kindness, respect).  Some decisions lead to chance outcomes, influenced by your metric in those categories.  I played through the entire game in about ten minutes.  It's boring.  Easy to "win" and not particularly engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259193065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1529757197}
review: Did you ever read one of those choose-your-own adventure books as a child? This is essentially that, but as a videogame, with a visible character for you to be. You evolve with your actions, leveling your personality and form depending on your choices. It is a highly fun game, with plenty of replay value--though I do warn you should always click on whatever new adventure you have possible to avoid repetition. It's definitely more akin to a book then a game, so don't hop in expecting a average 'point and click adventure'. Another slight warning; This game is very child-friendly from what I've played so far, but does depict death and the 'natural cycle of life'. I feel as if it covered the topic wonderfully (Especially if you choose to 'delay' near the end, and talk with the monsterling.), which may actually be a plus for parent's who aren't quite sure how to explain such complicated matters to children. An average playthrough is roughly one-hour long, but the game is definitely replayable for at least two more times (possibly not in the same day, however.) In the end, I highly reccomend it for both it's nostalgic feeling, and general entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013724699', 'num_games_owned': 1229, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1558750541}
review:
This game is too adorable for words, but I'll try.  

10/10, great value at 10 dollars.  Excellent soundtrack, and very well written.  Multiple endings, with a good deal of enjoyable replayability!  I highly recommend it to the visual novel crowd.

[b]IMAGINE.[/b]  You are a monsterling, fresh from the spawning vats.  You will explore a world of monsterly delights.  Will you live a life of kindness, sharing benevolence and healing with your fellow monsters?  Are you an honest creature, to be trusted by your friends and elders by always telling the truth?  Are you a nasty little monster, known by your fellows for intellect, for you tricks, your clever ideas, and wit?  Or will you perhaps be known for you bravery, or your rage and ferocity, trusting in luck and skill to survive the harsh world outside of your monster village?

Whichever you choose, if you earn the respect of your fellow monsters and ascend to venerable Elder status, your life could even influence Human/Monster relations!  

Be nasty, cruel, helpful or kind; it's your choice!  

The world - and your monster - are what you make of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047468162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1479073286}
review:
5/10

I have very mixed feelings about this game. I liked the idea, chilled and had fun while playing BUT the gameplay is only 40 minutes long with 0 replay value. I mean, you can replay the game for the sake of getting different ending (achievements), but basically you'll be facing exact same choices all over again and giving a different answer each time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168587417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1458869586}
review:
마우스 클릭형 게임으로, 각 이벤트마다의 선택지에 따라 5가지로 나뉘어있는 성격이 상승하거나 하락한다.
BGM이 좋다..ㅎ 맘에든다.
이상하게 나는 평화엔딩으로밖에 안가지는것같다..아예 작정하고 선택지를 다르게 클릭해야 여러 엔딩을 볼 수 있다.
플레이타임은 하나하나 다 읽으면 길고(한글이 지원되지는 않는 것 같다), 몇 번 해보면 이벤트가 계속 돌려나오므로 굳이 읽지 않고도 클릭할 수 있어서 점점 짧아진다.

딱 세일할때 살 만한 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095435153', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1458096114}
review: This is an odd one for me, it is not bad, but I don't know if I think its worth the price. I got it on sale, and it wasn't what I was expecting. The monsters look silly, but I guess that's kind of the thing with this. I do wish I could customize my creature, or move around more. It's one of those I wish it was different in certain ways but I don't dislike it for those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119658499', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1457814306}
review:
This is a very simple game.  It could be classified as "Choose Your Own Adventure" basically but it is cute.  You get to choose a bunch of storylines that are quite cute (or slightly frightening) and watch your monster grow up.  Each game your monster will grow up to be a little different as well so you have the visual change too.

This isn't a play for several hours game, you can beat it in about 10-15 minutes in fact and get all the achievements in much less time, but it is a cute, little thing to spend some time with.  This would be a good game for kids as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074751147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1457411844}
review:
A cute little CYOA that emphasizes replayability... despite holding absolutely no replay value. The choices you make affect the ending and your character's responses to situations. The situations themselves, however, are all short vignettes, and almost entirely static. Once you've seen one ending, there's little incentive to play through and see another. Additionally, the scenarios get repetitive and predictable very quickly, and even the most extreme of options have no lasting or meaningful effects.

I would recommend this on sale for about a dollar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030774017', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1461994081}
review: A very nice, relaxing and funny little game. I didn't expect to be this much entertained by it but i had a really good time playing it. I think i will play it again to discover all the endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044907878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1581165274}
review: Ah, so viele Möglichkeiten! Ein wirklich nettes Gelegenheitsspiel mit verschiedenen Möglichkeiten. Das Leben eines Monsters ist nicht so einfach, wie man denkt! Auf jeden Fall zu empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060955476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1457154290}
review:
I purchased this game as a result of a discount coupon from crafting badges. My initial thoughts for this game were boring, repetative, and tedious; however the more I got into the game the more I began to appreciate it for what it was, an education tool to promote reading. Yes, reading. This game is suited to teach children the idea of "action and consiquence." with a fun twist.

I would highly recommend this game to parents who would want to improve the literacy skills of their kids.

TLDR: The game is geared for a young audience to improve the proficiency of their reading; but can be enjoyed by anyone who seeks a light-hearted adventure.

Score:
(5/5) for an Educational Game
(3/5) for an Indie Casual Game
(2/5) for Achievement Hunters

author: {'steamid': '76561198110592825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1451604172}
review:
Cute, fun, wierd.

This game is basically a choose-your-own-adventure text based game in which you're a monster growing up. That's really all their is to it. It's cute and fun in it's own weird monstery way. Me and my girlfriend played it, and we had a really good time. If it looks like somethign you'd like, you'll probably like it. If not, you probably won't.

Also, the title kind of wierds me out. You play as a monster, so there's no interaction with the player directly, so who is "monster" and who is "you" in the context of the title? I don't get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092182539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1455384207}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126680868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1455132011}
review:
Monster Loves You is a casual choose-your-own-adventure type game with some mild RPG elements. The game consists of many small storylets which you can choose a respone to, and are then rewarded with stat points corresponding to that response. These stat points make up the “personality” of your monster, and later may determine how much other monsters respect you, and ultimately your ending.

I generally like things like raising sims and CYOA games, so I was kind of surprised by how little I enjoyed this game. Overall, I see two major issues with it: it lacks meaningful choices, and it’s too long for what it is. Most of the storylets described rather mundane events (i.e. should I save my friend from bullies, or join in on beating him up), so seeing alternative resolutions to those wasn’t especially interesting. And there doesn’t appear to be any real consequence to raising a ferocious monster versus a kind monster, aside from gathering achievements.

CYOA-type stat building games can be fun if they don’t overstay their welcome (for example, The YAWHG), but I found myself getting pretty bored by about the halfway point of each playthrough of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026026762', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1455797029}
review:
Bardzo przyjemna gra przygodowa tekstowa, skierowana raczej dla młodszego odbiorcy, choć wiele osób starszych, tak jak i ja odnajdzie w niej sporo przyjemności. Bardzo często gry tego typu określa się mianem point&click, co w tym przypadku oznacza iż całość rozgrywki polega na wskazywaniu i zatwierdzaniu wybranych przez nas odpowiedzi bezpośrednio wpływających na los naszego bohatera.

W grze wcielamy się w tytułowego potwora i od momentu jego urodzin kształtujemy jego osobowość. To bardzo wciągająca rola, możemy wybierać odpowiedzi, które będą zgodne z naszym własnych uznaniem lub starać się je dobierać tak aby nasza postać uzyskała pożądane cechy. Konsekwencją wyboru może być, choć nie musi, otrzymanie lub utrata punktów przydzielanych do danej cechy charakteru. W ten sposób na końcu gry możemy stworzyć potworniastego przytulaka, inteligentną bestię, silnego i nieustraszonego bohatera lub krwiożerczą bestię, oczywiście wariacji jest dużo, dużo więcej i uzyskanie ich wszystkich jest naprawdę trudne.

Grafika gry jest kreskówkowa, ładna ale mocno statyczna, można powiedzieć że przyjemna dla oka, udźwiękowienie niczym specjalnym się nie wyróżnia, jest poprawne, muzyka jest zapamiętywalna i wpada w ucho. Gra owocuje w wiele zabawnych sytuacji i komentarzy co czyni ją ciekawą i bardzo wciągającą. Nasze wybory mimo dużego skupienia na naszej postaci często nie dadzą zamierzonego rezultatu i by wykreować docelowego potworka trzeba zagrać wielokrotnie. Choć gra moim zdaniem jest zdecydowanie za krótka, gorąco polecam ją wszystkim miłośnikom tego typu produkcji. 

Wskazówka:
Aby uzyskać bardzo jednolitą postać należy ukierunkować swoje wszystkie wypowiedzi w ten sam sposób, tzn jeśli chcesz by Twój potwór był krwiożerczą bestią wybieraj tylko najbardziej kontrowersyjne i brutalne odpowiedzi. Chcesz być bohaterem, nie lękaj się niczego ale Twoje wybory nie mogą być bezlitosne, Najmądrzejsze stworki zawsze szukają najkorzystniejszych rozwiązań, bądź przewidujący i przebiegły !

[quote][b][i]* PORTUGUÊS *[/i][/b][/quote]

Ótimo para quem curte um RPG à moda antiga (como RPGs de mesa). Apesar de bem curtinho, tem boa rejogabilidade, pois oferece vários finais diferentes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004065976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1706332813}
review: This game is phenomenal! I didn't know what to expect when I received this as part of a Humble Bundle, but I was pleasantly surprised. The game tells the story of your monster, who is continually defined as an individual by the choices you make as a player. The game is simple and straight forward, but entertaining and a lot of fun. I enjoy this as a 34 year old and my three oldest kids love it (ages 6 to 10). I cannot recommend this enough if you're in the mood for a casual game that has a lot of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157629512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1451898770}
review:
This was ... okay. It's obviously a tablet game, the graphics are cute, the writing is decent.

My son - who is 9 - LOVES it. He's going through one playthrough a day to get all the endings, and he won't shut up about it. I got this in a sale, but it's worth full-price for the amount of time he's sunk into it reading. He gets up early in the morning just to play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076625349', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1451676109}
review:
I fell inlove with the music of this game! Before I knew I sat there and hummed melodies from the game and got happy when listening to it. Good job!
For the game itself: I like to play it two times and it was really fun. The first time I always choose the actions that I find most fitting and in the second round I tried to always pick the opposite. But in the third round it wasn't that fun anymore. Sure I played some rounds more to get some achievements but at some point it get's boring.
Except of that I really liked the style and graphics and how you see the result of the actions you take. Like how many points of kindness or ferocity you get. Even though the fun just lasts for a short time I still recommend the game since it's fun and for people whoreflect their actions it's fun to see what happens and try the exact opposite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119342164', 'num_games_owned': 1191, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1464784237}
review:
I have this on mobile as well as Steam, and I turn to it when I want a quick, complete game to fill in a waiting periof. It's largely narrative based, with short, charming/macabre episodes to play through, and shape your monster and  the world with it. Short playthroughs, lots of variation, adorable graphics.

One of the most enjoyable casual games out there, for my money, if narrative based games are your cup of tea. If you are text adverse, then it's Not For You, just as a friendly warning.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990455763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1440947608}
review:
+ Simple mechanics with multiple ending variations
+ Takes ~15 minutes to complete an "adventure path"
- The game mechanic is so simple, that it is a soddin' Excel sheet with multiple choice questions.
- I mean really, you're given choices like "Roar at cat" [+1 ferocity], "Pet cat" [+1 kindness], "Educate cat about neo-cubism" [+1 imagination].
- Yeah. That is really how the whole game works. Pick an option that adjusts some of your stats and redo from start.
- I mean, my old Choose Your Own Adventure-comic book for kids around 8 was more non-linear.
- And more complex, now that I think of it.
- Oh yeah, it also had a random element to it, not sure if this thing has one...

Conclusion: Do you like grinding menu options and making a list of every possible selection path? If you do, this is the perfect excuse for you to write some finer spreadsheet macros!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000797285', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1509403958}
review:
[h1]Recenzja[/h1] 
Monster Loves You! - prosta przygodowa gra typu click&point, obsadzona w kreskówkowej grafice, w której nasze decyzje wywierają ogromny wpływ na rozwój naszego potwora. Chcesz, aby Twoja postać była okropnym tyranem, który zabije wszystko co się rusza? Inteligentnym stworzeniem, którego inteligencja przewyższa nawet IQ najmądrzejszych ludzi? A może uczciwy i pomocny stwór, który nie znosi zła? Wszystkie te cechy i wiele innych możemy wykreować swoim potworzastym stworzeniem!

Zapraszam do obserwowania mojej strony [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33268259-Krasny-Feuilleton/]KURATORA[/url], aby być na bieżąco ze wszystkimi recenzjami!

[h1]Grywalność[/h1]
Jest to typowy click&point, w którym to my jesteśmy 'mózgiem' naszego stworzenia, którym kierujemy jeszcze od "narodzenia". Zasadniczo gra jest na jeden raz, ponieważ to wtedy najbardziej wczuwamy się w losy naszego potwora, często starając się utworzyć go na swoją podobiznę. Przyjemna w swojej prostocie, zaskakuje nas często swoimi nieprzewidywalnymi zwrotami wydarzeń i przedziwnymi sytuacjami, gdzie nie wiemy jak zareagować. Wciąga na krótko, aby zabić trochę wolnego czasu.

[h1]Dźwięki[/h1]
O dźwiękach w grze zasadniczo wiele nie można powiedzieć, ponieważ całość gry opiera się na jej czytaniu i reagowaniu w pewnych sytuacjach, wybierając odpowiednie wg naszego uznania przyciski. Muzyka jest prosta, przyjemna, lecz czasami może być monotonna. W zależności od sytuacji, bądź przygody jaką wybierzemy zmienia się w pożądany klimat rozgrywki.

[h1]Grafika[/h1]
Monster Loves You! oferuje nam rysunkową grafikę, która jest w dość ładny sposób przedstawiona. Bardzo fajnie narysowane potwory, które jak widać wykorzystują sporą część wyobraźni rysownika. Jest przyjemna i miła dla oka.

[h1]Fabuła[/h1]
Fabuły w grze oczywiście nie można określić mianem liniowej, ponieważ to my decydujemy jak toczą się losy rozgrywki. Jednak nie ma większego znaczenia to co uznamy na słuszne względem późniejszych możliwości do wyboru. W grze, na każdym etapie życia naszego potwora mamy określoną liczbę dni na jej rozwój, które są równoznaczne z ilością wydarzeń jakie możemy przeżyć/wybrać. Rozgrywkę możemy zakończyć już wcześniej, jeżeli zdecydujemy, że nasza postać nie nadaje się do dorosłego życia, topiąc ją i roztwarzając w głębokiej "misce" z zieloną substancją - prawdopodobnie kwasem. Brzmi brutalnie, jednak to my musimy się dostosować do kultury jaka panuje w Potwornej Rasie. Rozgrywka może nas również doprowadzić do różnych zakończeń fabuły. Od protokooperacji potworów z ludźmi, przez bycie "pluszowym" niewolnikiem człowieka, aż po dominację potworów nad całą planetą (bądź też nawet wyginięcia całej potworzastej rasy).

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
[list]
[*] mnogość decyzji i wyborów
[*] śmieszne rysunki
[*] ciekawe sytuacje
[*] pomysł na grę
[/list]

[h1]Minusy[/h1]
[list]
[*] czas gry
[*] czasami można nie zgadzać się z przyznawanymi punktami do atrybutów rozwoju naszej postaci, względem podjętych przez nas decyzji
[/list]

[h1]Ocena[/h1]

    [tr]
        [th]Parametr[/th]
        [th]Ocena[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Grywalność[/td]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012180752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1451378782}
review:
Gra w wybory. O społeczności potworów. Szczerze? Nie kupuję tego.

Grę można przejść bez czytania jakiegokolwiek tekstu. Po prostu klikasz i zawsze jest dobrze. W tej grze nie ma złych wyborów. Jedyne czym Twoje wybory są nagradzane to osiągnięcia Steam wymyślone przez twórców. Jeśli zależy Ci na 100% to polecam otworzyc sobie poradnik na internecie co i jak klikać. Gra nużyła mnie już od pierwszych sekund i aż do końca nie udało jej się obronić. Nie doszukuj się w niegj głębszego sensu - bo go nie ma. Walka z ludźmi? NUDAAA!!! Zdecydowanie nie polecam, chyba. że dla ludzi, którzy mają zdecydowanie za dużo czasu (lepiej odpalić jakiegoś H'n'S).

author: {'steamid': '76561198098432260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1440630468}
review:
Monster Loves You is alright.
I played it a few times and got some different endings. It was entertaining, but after a while it didn't hold my interest since a lot of it is the same or very similar. Because of that, subsequent playthroughs felt a lot slower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089178076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1453065671}
review:
This is a very cute text style game where your choices determine what sort of monster you'll grow into and what influence you'll have on your peers. I like the writing and the story; with cute and comedic dialogue as well as interesting options. It has definite replay value and a pleasant atmosphere. The adventures you take will not remain the same every time. Each time you leave the spawning vat will likely be a new experience. 

If you have kids I think it would be something enjoyable to play with them because it's a lot like an interactive story and seems very innocent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126940661', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1534771803}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115812513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1450919118}
review:
I was looking for something that would make me emotional or something and I found this. I downloaded it and ten minutes later, I'm not impressed. The game requires no skill or thought, you just choose. I'm not talking about it being easy, i mean no matter what you do you can't get hurt or lose. You just gain "Bravery" or some other stat. You can't actually see whats going on either, and as much as I like text-based adventures this is noooot a good one. You just choose the good option in your mind and you get points. Instead of buying this game, ask yourself "If i was a monster, would i be mean or nice?" and answer that. Thats. It. You've gotten the same results. 

(Also, ten minutes in and im on the 2nd stage, so it's not going to be a long game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042108108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1450988793}
review: A heartwarming, or sometimes, gut wrenching tale of the lifes and times of a monster. The kind of monster that monster is can vary entirely dependent on what you do and how you do it, it could be a great big baby eating ogre, a sly trickster, a slithering horror that subtly changes the world behind the scenes, a big though kind hearted beast or even a secretive doctor. It's a feel good game that feels good, and really I think is best served if you just dive into the whimsical tale without any expectations or achivement hunting or anything else, just letting the little fuzzy tale wash over you like a storybook from when you where a child.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123662092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1438490782}
review:
A rather enjoyable little romp in a monster filled world.

This game actually goes further than most and has a rather pretty UI. This is a great game for kids.

Though this game doesn't have much replability, most of the story will stay the same only the ending will really change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049350749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1450398272}
review:
While I've enjoyed story driven choose-your-own adventure games before, it's the lack of concequences or branching paths that turns "Monster loves You" into a shallow, stat driven experience. Being short and shallow is forgivable, but an added lack of replayability should put anyone off the 10 euro price tag.

In any other story game, what you do locks you into a distinct route through the story. Befriended a certain character, choose to pick up a sword and take the route through the creepy forest? You can be sure that character will remember, you're more likely to become a swordfighter and you might learn something in the forest that you can use later on. Sure, there might be some statistics involved, as you'll need strength to handle your sword and maybe at least 20+ survivalism to make it through the forest, but these are the things that bind you to the story. It sets you on a certain path that creates a mood, an understanding of the world, expectation of what happens next and gets you exclusive endings unavailable somewhere else that makes you feel like it was worth investing. It makes you feel the game/story recognizes you and entertains you with how it accomadates your unique choices and personality. 

Monster loves You has none of that. The game has three to four chapters, one for each stage of your life. In each stage, you have the choice out of some 20 adventures, with you having the time to go on some 12. All of them are already unlocked straight from the get go and they have no bearing on what kind of monster you are or on what what choices you've made before as a story. Being the goal of the game, they each raise your stats by a bit and by the third chapter certain adventures require your stats to be at a certain level before you can succeed to gain... more stats. By the fourth chapter, you can proceed to use your stats to crudely manipulate the outcome of the game and get the different endings by... raising or lowering new stats with the correct stats. 

You can randomly kill one day and spare the other. You can get nearly killed by humans at the start of your life and then get a happy ending with the humans at the end, without any explanation. It just is... because of stats. Other monsters don't actively recognize your past actions. As long as you pick the right buttons to make the correct gauges go up, and regardless of who you are, you can work yourself up towards any available outcome. Sure, sticking to a specific personality gets you furthest, but only because you can't possibly level all the stats and being consistent at least raises enough of them to succeed to pass checks. 

It deprives the game of personality and the feeling you're interacting with a living world, when the two of you simply don't react to each other in a way that is based on story. 


That said, the game looks okay if you like the artstyle and I can vouch that the writing is actually kind of great, but as a game or an interactive story, it fails abysmally with shallow mechanics.

review:
A game of simple fun, you get to choose what you do and how you do it. At first, you get confused but after a while, you get the hang of it. The 'Choose-Your-Own-Adventure' fits perfectly. I already love it and I only went through it twice now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263334530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1449137443}
review:
I have played this game once and I ended up being a kind monster. 
It's fun that you can affect what kind of monster you want to be. Your story starts as a little innocent monster and your actions will affect to your personality while your growing up.
There's 14 different types/endings that you can achieve, you just need to think carefully what to say or do in every situation.
So if you like choice based game which affects to the sory line this game is for you. The game is about 1h long (one play through).
Style is cute and also the soundtrack is very nice.
Maybe the only one minus in the game is that there's so much text to read and you can't really interact with anything and it might get boring in a while. Otherwise I really enjoyed playing it.
Soon I'm going to play it again, let's see what kind of monster I'm going to turn out then!

(Cried when my mosnter died at the end T.T).

8/10

review: This is an adorable game. I love the concept of the monsters born from and returning to slime as their life cycle. I havent seen much diversity in my own monster's appearance between play throughs, but it doesn't much matter. It has many different endings that boil down to what you want your legacy in this world to be. You can be a great figure that shapes the future lives of monster and human kind, or just contribute your essense to future generations as a unsung hero(or villian). The many choices and interactions give it alot of replay value, and the illustrations are simply splendid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 410, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1446402009}
review: This is a digital create your own adventure book with many many amusing monster adventures to be had. Each play through is fairly short so there is reasonable replayability. The decisions you make affect stats which affect what stories and endings are available so it is not as straight forward as choose X for ending Y. This is fun as it is your overall approach to the various adventures which determines what ending you get, this is great unless you are obsessively trying to get all the endings and keep getting up getting one you have previously gotten instead of the one you want. It is a single player game but it is also quite fun to play with a friend because you can share the decision making and enjoy the consequences and humour together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127900296', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1451678737}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063139564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1538670024}
review:
Monster really loves you or rather I love monsters and this game.

It makes me giggle when I play though and find a new story or story twist that I havent seen before and actually getting all the achievements will take some playthroughs just to get them right.

The base story is the same no matter what you do, but its HOW the story unfolds and WHAT happens to to monsters as they grow that you can change (or not, thats also possible, not giving a flying F about anything that happens).

Nice artwork and music.

I think it's well worth its money and is a great game to fill out a bit of time every now and then or to binge for several hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032447372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1446177579}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024307883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1458845685}
review:
This is a brief, and straight-forward (but very enjoyable) game of choice and consequence. While there are no fancy animations or 3D graphics, your journey as a monster is presented through charming illustrations akin to a children's picture book. 

The spawning vat you start out in as a "morsel" is a very original take on reincarnation - all monsters originate from the vat, but when their time to pass on is due and they do not reach elderhood, they return to the spawning vat and dissolve, their "essence" (defining personality traits) being recycled into the next generation of monsters, starting the cycle anew. 

The actions you take allow you to accumulate points which determine your most prominent personality traits: bravery, honesty, kindness, ferocity and cleverness. You must also gain respect from other monsters in order to ascend to Elder status - the final stage of the game in which you influence the fate of human and monster relations.

It may feel a little tedious at times however, as you will most certainly find yourself playing through the same adventure more than once to attain the traits you want to give your monster.

That being said, if you enjoy games with multiple choices and alternate endings, I would still recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1440764814}
review:
I bought this heavily discounted, so my review may be biased.

I thought growing up as a monster in my short 30 minute playthrough was a lot of fun. I went the way of honesty and courage, and unified monsterkind with humankind. Some of the consequences of the choices made in the situations are frustrating, but overall I thought they were balanced. 

I wish there were more reading adventures like this. If 30 minutes gives you the "good ending" I'd be interested to pursue again someday the other endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073816937', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1452966422}
review:
Sympatyczna gra. Nie ma co oczekiwać po niej skomplikowanej rozgrywki - cały schemat opiera się na kreowaniu swojej osobowości i dorastaniu poprzez przechodzenie kolejnych, krótkich przygód. Podejmujemy w nich wybory, które mogą (ale nie muszą) odbić się na pięciu wskaźnikach osobowości - odwadze, inteligencji, dzikości, szczerości, życzliwości oraz na szacunku jakim darzy nas społeczeństwo Potworów. 
W sumie taką przygodę można ukończyć w mniej niż godzinę, jeśli nie bawi was powtarzanie niektórych rzeczy po raz kolejny, ale moim zdaniem warto. Niektóre decyzje podejmowane w przełomowych momentach mogą skutkować bardzo różnymi zakończeniami (tak, można umrzeć po 20 minutach grania :D), satysfakcjonujące jest docieranie do samego końca po przejściu Monsterlinghood, Adulthood i Elderhood, tam też decyzje skutkują różnymi zakończeniami, na które wpływ ma nie tylko to, co zdecydujemy, ale też nasza ukształtowana we wcześniejszych etapach osobowość, szacunek oraz nastroje panujące w tym potworzym społeczeństwie.
Każde zakończenie nagradzane jest osiągnięciem, w sumie jest ich 14. 
Mini-przygody są losowane z większej puli, więc może zdarzyć się, że kilka z nich się powtórzy, ale na pewno nie będzie to ciągle ten sam scenariusz. 

Myślę, że gra sprawdzi się też jako gra dla dzieci (chociaż nie wiem czy wszystkim rodzicom spodobają się niektóre pomysły potworów ;), które znają już podstawowy język angielski (albo mają obok dorosłego, który przetłumaczy to, co dzieje się na ekranie). 

Grafika w tej grze podbija moje serce, szczególnie te obrazki, które pokazują się przy opisie przygody. Potworek ze łzami w (trzech) oczach topi serce :D Muzyka do czwartego przejścia nie nużyła, każde kolejny achievement zdobywałam już przy własnej ścieżce dźwiękowej. 

Być może regularna cena jest na polski rynek za wysoka, ale zdecydowanie polecam nabyć Monster Loves You! na wyprzedaży. Urocze toto, szybkie i budzące uśmiech :)
