author: {'steamid': '76561198015171654', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1637981832}
review:
This game is FANTASTIC! It's a point and click, choose your own adventure but as a monster! It's so cute I wish I could hug it! 

You are a monster that spawns from a vat of goo and from there you can choose what to do with your life. Will you be a kind and helpful monster? Will you be ferocious and tough? Will you flee from your destiny and try to be something else? The options they give and fun and engaging and I love playing new paths to see what kind've of monsters I can be. Your graphic is different everytime you start a new story. So far, I haven't run into any duplicates. 

It has great music, stellar story and is just too much fun. Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198163728473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1442024532}
review: Fun for the first playthrough, but since there's no real weight to your decisions it gets old fast. Not to mention how buggy it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991198865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1442032571}
review: A very entertaining spin on the Choose Your Own Adventure genre. Lighthearted, comedic, dozen or so different endings, playthrough takes about an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025704994', 'num_games_owned': 2343, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1442028509}
review: I'm 37 and loved it, and I think this game is great for people of all ages who enjoy stories and making choices. The only things that could be better are the background music (gets tiresome over time) and it would be great if more languages were available, so more people could play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014955980', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1387549335}
review: A really weird, fun little game. The setting is pretty unique and the game thirves on that. The graphics are simple but age very well. They will still look as cute ten years from now. The gameplay is simple enough that is a good gift even to younger kids. It's rather short, but since you are expected to play through a few times to try out different choices that's okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145503194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1477628209}
review:
I don't usually get games like this. But, Monster loves you caught my attention and I immediately have to get it.

This graphic of this game is well done with all the cute visuals. While the visuals are nice, they are mostly just backdrops, you can't interact with them. The music is simple yet soothing, but it tends to get a little boring after a while. 

Monster loves you is a visual novel where you click on the dialog boxes throughout the entire game. As the player, you will shape the monster's character and destiny based on the choices you made starting from Day 1. Points will be given for the choices you made. Eg: in Bravery, Cleverness, Ferocity, Honesty, Kindness and Respect.

The game is short but decent. If you are an expeditious reader, you would probably take about 20 to 30 minutes to finish the entire game. 

I got this on a 85% sale and I probably got more than what I signed up for. A sublime story that did not drag on to the point where finishing this game becomes a chore. I will ecstatically give this game 4 out of 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067369910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1573432981}
review:
A very cute game where you play out your life as a monster!
This game is a choose-your-own-path kind. You can gain multiple endings, either good or bad, try to see if you can earn them all! And the adventures you endure during helps the outcome. Certain choices can only give effect if you have the skill that's required for it also.
Its very simplistic and fairly short however, so if you'd preferred this type of genre to be heavy-in story, or with major choices that will effect the outcome of the characters, then this game might not be for you.
It has a very children's story vibe coming off it, so if you have young children you'd like to buy games for, or a game to play with them, this would be a worthy try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969636561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1440859890}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044784523', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1441415049}
review:
I set out to play Monster Loves You! with a little bit of disdain. I'd seen the screenshots, and the whole thing just looked very bland and childish. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that I was wrong. 

Monster Loves You! is a story-driven choice-based game where you play a newborn monster. You're tasked with answering a few questions and solving a few problems in order to determine a personality. Your personality is essentially your skills, and how you answer the problems and questions will determine your skill level. The skills are things like Honesty, Bravery, etc. and will be increased/decreased by how you respond to situations in the game. 

It's cute enough, with a decent story model, but it wears thin a little quick for my tastes. Definitely enjoyed my time playing it so far, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121160502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1485647799}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1441001743}
review:
I really wanted to down vote this game as it appears to be a blatant mobile app port, but after playing through three times I can’t. The game is strangely addictive and I find myself wanting to see all the endings. 

The UI looks and feels like a mobile app. It consists of large, easy to press, buttons on a simple background. The buttons come in two different types, pictures which are somehow related to an action, and dialogue for different choices and tests. 

The game play is simple, you click a button, read some text, and see how your choices modify your stats. You go through several development phases, starting as a baby slime and moving up through full fledged elder monster. If you make it to the end, you can decide the fate of monsters and humans.

The choices and options can get repetitive over multiple playthroughs. This is particularly frustrating since auto-saving means you you need to start from the beginning each time you attempt to get a new ending. As there are 14 different endings, I really wish there was some sort of save or rewind functionality so that you could skip the earlier phases. 

As long as you don’t mind eating children or kittens it's a good game to kill some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072494932', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1440711056}
review: J'en suis actuellement a ma troisième fois que je termine le jeu, et je songe fortement a débloquer toute les fins possibles. Ce jeu, est absolument GE-NIAL ! Basé principalement sur des lignes de textes et des CHOIX, (couplés évidemment a des graphismes avec un aspect légèrement cartoon, très agréables). Le jeu doit devenir probablement rapidement répétitif, mais l'influence et l'importance que les choix ont, rendent le jeu rejouable un TRES grand nombre de fois, les "quêtes" ou plutôt situations que vous pouvez y rencontrer sont nombreuses, et suffisamment variées pour devenir interessantes. Ce jeu, bien qu'il n'en ait pas la prétention, est comparable (a mon avis) a un stanley parable, mignon, cartoony et très fun a jouer :) !

review: It didn't even take me an hour to run through a full route of this game, and I was not rushing in any way.  There's very little plot or characters to speak of.  I am a big fan of visual novel/choose-your-own-adventure style gameplay, but there's so little content here that even trying to go for the other endings seems totally pointless.  I'm glad I didn't buy it at full price, because it's shallower game than some free to play mobile casual titles I've tried.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974194968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1440484470}
review:
В целом, игра мне понравилась, поэтому и рекомендую. Но я ожидал какого-то большего безумия от нее, его оказалось маловато, но на четверку хватит. 
Фактически, это текстовая игра. Есть несколько вариантов на выбор, надо выбрать наиболее понравившийся (если всё хорошо с характеристиками, то он проходит). В принципе, интересно. При переигровке встречаются новые варианты событий, что радует, но их не так много, что огорчает.
Игра состоит из трех этапов: рост (набор характеристик), вращение в обществе (выработка уважения) и внешняя политика (взаимотношения с другим сообществом, уже людей.
На пару честных прохождений игры хватает, а потом уже быстрый пробег и манипуляции с сейвами в погоне за достижениями.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057246223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1472965828}
review:
Cute monsters,  choose-your-own-dventure gameplay, and achievements to make the replay that much more fun.What's not to love? Well, if you do not like choose your own adventure games, you won't like this game.

That said; anyone who grew up reading the Choose your own adventure books will love this as a bit of interactive nostalgia.The cute gaphics and easy to understand choices will give it appeal to younger audiences. For the hardcore gamers...

well, even the hardcore gamers have their sweet tooth for some games they wouldn't normally admit to having heard of, much less playing; this is one of them. 

Okay: You probably won't get massive hours of replayabilty...but then hey, it isn't an mmorpg.  You will however find yourself downloadng this game back toy our library more than once just because it is so much fun. 

Well worth getting, and an especially good choice for parents who want a for the kids which isn't made by Leapfrog. Is it educational? Not in the academic sense; however it does help reinforce consequences for choices (hint hint parents).

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1440450700}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035324496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1640271040}
review: Adorable game with many different endings. That said, I'm not sure I'd want to play it through to all 14 different endings. I did enjoy my one playthrough however: it was a lot of fun! :) Great storytelling, adorable game, and quite engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983550854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1440352914}
review:
Had this on my wishlist for over a year and the present (Aug 2015) Humble Bundle was kind enough to offer it up.  It in many ways passed my expectations with its beautiful music (love the guitar picking) and great take on a choose your own adventure.  You can blow through the game itself in just under an hour but in truth that fits this game well.  You go through a number of monster life cycle stages and your actions will dictate your monsters personality and ultimate its fate and potentially the world.  As such it approaches things from a childish perspective often which from my perspective is not a complaint but might be for some.   Might be a bit overpriced as while you can replay it I don't believe the quests change.  So yeah there's lots of different endings but even in RPGs i usually stick true to form so having all those choices and endings is great but with no other gameplay to speak of I don't think it would have much value in this case.

A great game with wonderful production values and character just probably overpriced at anything over $5 or if you get it in a bundle.  If you like playing all the different outcomes of a Choose Your Own Adventure than it may be worth full price however as it nails that while offering it in a unique and charming perspective/setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158309410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1448544859}
review:
Let's start by saying this... "Monster Loves You!", despite graphic, is pretty much a text-based game. We are playing as newborn monster. Our decisions will shape his personality, that has five main categories - Bravery, Cleverness, Ferocity, Honesty, Kindness. This stats will then affect our later decisions. Depends on how high they are, we may either be successful or fail miserably choosing our fate. There are three main endings and each of them have few variants, that usually depends on which of our trait is the dominant one.

Game is pleasant, but a tad short. Main con is rather low number of situations when our traits are truly put to the test. Also, sometimes options are ambiguous, so when you choose one of them with clear intention in mind, you may find out that it lead to something entirely different - which may be consider good thing and bad thing at the same time.

It's a cute game that didn't reach it's full potential. Better buy it as a part of a bundle or during sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054813787', 'num_games_owned': 1794, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1447909822}
review:
Текстовый квест. Наш персонаж - новорожденный монстр, которому нужно принимать различные решения на протяжении своей жизни. Помочь соседу или напугать его, погнаться в лес за неуязвимым лосем или трусливо сбежать? Каждое дейтсвие изменяет один из пяти параметров персонажа: доброта, ум, агрессия и т.п.
Красивая мультяшная графика.
Игра достаточно короткая - минут за 40 можно пройти весь жизненный цикл монстра (и это при условии чтения текстов). Однако в ней 14 разных концовок, чтобы открыть их все - нужно принимать разные решения в разных прохождениях.
Проблема в том, что количество сюжетных веток ограничено и максимум к третьему прохождению всё становится уж прочитано и приходится тупо прокликивать диалоги не читая.
Детям, знающим английский, должна игра понравиться :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198173258719', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1440638166}

author: {'steamid': '76561198195449165', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1479162187}
review: Monster Loves You! is one of the most interesting games that I've ever played. The quality of the game feels like something similar to Telltale Games (and that's a good thing). The makers of this game put in many different paths into this game so that you can get a different end result for every different response that you give to a situation. For example, I chose the honest path and was rewarded with a nice ending. You can choose to be mean to other monsters or be loving, choose between being nice to humans or tricking your fellow monsters into thinking that they're evil. Overall, this is an incredible game and I would highly suggest buying it. I got this as a part of the Humble Bundle and I wasn't 100% sure what I was getting. When I played this game today for the 1st time, I was throughly impressed. I guarantee it that you'll be too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960797151', 'num_games_owned': 1845, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1440286773}

review: It is a cute game. Providing many possiblities, but in the end, there is not much choice to make, sadly. The game provides many situations where there is a definitively favourable option. Also your options aren't clearly stated, small pictograms that mostly won't give any information away what quest you're about to apply to, making the encouraged min-maxing a matter of making notes. Still, the monsters are adorable. Maybe not the right thing if you're in search of self-fulfilment, but most probably suitable for a younger audience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988279510', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1468068308}
review: This game is just short and boring. No matter how many endings you have if its just a matter of combining variants. It easy to see what happens and the whole process turns into clicking options you want to get. Go chek another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042220481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1439135996}
review:
A short, charming "choose your own adventure" game in which you determine the course of a monster's life (and potentially its society's direction) from birth to death. Numerous scenarios semi-randomly generate based on the monster's personality stats and previous actions; therefore, no two playthroughs are identical. I found the simplistic art and music to be relaxing and pleasant. 

Recommended if you're looking for an engaging interactive novel with multiple story paths and character builds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168924363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1440953680}
review: This is a text-based adventure set in an adorable community of monsters. I found the visuals to be pleasing to the eye and appropriate for the story. The first playthrough, if done at a careful pace, should take around an hour. Replayability is low, and the achievements require you to play it many times. I think the price should be more like $5 instead of $10, considering the amount of gameplay. I really enjoyed the game, but I don't see myself getting all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082515284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1409890133}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058616006', 'num_games_owned': 1610, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1564016208}
review:
(Note: my low playtime is only because the copy I played most wasn't from Steam, but since I picked up a copy for here in a bundle I thought I should review it.)

Monster Loves You is a charming little choose your own adventure game in which you develop a monster from birth to death, or even beyond when it's death should have come, if you play your cards right. The whole story is played through reading little vignettes about moments in your monster's life then deciding what it's going to do at that moment. When it's still a baby your choices will mostly just effect its own personality, but as it gets older the things you decide will also come to determine how much other monsters respect it and eventually how well their tribe gets along with their closest neighbors.

The game contains much more replay value than you might expect; you never get enough turns in a stage of life to pick every story to read through and it's also randomly (as far as I can tell) chosen what stories will be available for you in each new game, so if you start a new playthrough you'll find plenty of new scenarios to play through as well as being able to make different choices in ones you've drawn before.

I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants something light and fun to kill a couple hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003048459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1438470976}
review: Cant say I really liked it. All personality traits are desirable, so all you do is pick the choices that might give you more honesty, ferocity, bravery, cleverness o kindness. And the general story does not really change with your decisions, your choices just influence the outcome of the current "adventure" and the rewards you get. Certainly not the next step in storytelling games. I guess it is a fun read on the first two playthroughs, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038786877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1434916579}
review: I really enjoyed the concept, a choose your own adventure where not only do your choices determine your development, but your environment's too. However, the game is just way too short. I reached the "best" ending in under two hours with next to no effort. The $10 entry is much too expensive for this fairly shallow experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058493613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1403469764}
review: Really enjoyed this "choose your own adventure" play style, I think in the 2 1/2 hours I played of the game so far I played 4 complete games, all a bit similar but all a bit different. The fact that the game can end much later or earlier on certain playthroughs can really make the experience feel dramatically different. Very cool how you can really go for a good, bad, indifferent monster that is either brave, aggressive, thoughtful, friendly or a bunch of other combinations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977434623', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1431529505}
review:
Monster Loves You! is short and solid.

It's a choose-your-own-adventure style game with a very high density of choices to be made crammed into a small package. The result is that everything you do feels important, and with too much to do in a single play-thru the replayability factor is somewhat high. However, the game isn't long and multiple play-thrus--once you understand the format--can be accomplished in rapid succession and the game peters out.

Still, it has lovely graphics and makes for a few really fun rounds in a notably unique monster world and culture. While not being expansive it is highly detailed and definitely worth a look if you enjoy the pick-your-consequences genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003305211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1433748474}
review:
An adorable, easy to pick up game. Whimsical sound track, and a pretty dark sense of humor sometimes.  

There are not many games out there that will literally have "eat baby" as an option.

If you're a fan of Hatoful Boyfriend's silliness, you'll probably love this game, too. It's a choose your own adventure story, essentially.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139496768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1433588015}
review:
It's a fun little game. It has nice artwork, the text is often funny and it has an interesting storyline. 

It plays like a choose your own adventure book. You can guide your monster to become friendly, clever, ferocious, cruel and a few other options. You can decide how your tribe of monsters deals with the humans they share the land with. 

The downide is that the game is quite short and doesn't really have a lot of replay value. You can unlock different endings if you wish but after that you basically know everything the game has to offer. 

I would not get this at full price, if it is on sale for at least a 50% discount it might be a fun and entertaining way to spend an afternoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152345990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1561091425}
review:
Adorable and interesting. Charming art style.

It's a choice-based game, so it's got a good deal of replay value. There are several endings you can get; at least a dozen, give or take a few. And the endings are tied to the achievements - get an ending, and you get the corresponding achievement!

All in all, a great game, especially if you like games where your choices directly affect what happens next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038001710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1432039918}
review:
A neat little game. The writing isn't anything special, but it's entertaining. There are many short stories to find and go through. You probably won't have one play through right after another. I've played through only twice but there's still plenty I still haven't seen. There are many different endings to discover and there are loads of text choices to make. Every single encounter has at least 2 outcomes and most have 3 or 4. The game's strong point is definitely at the beginning of each play through. This is mainly because it tends to get pretty repetitive towards the end where you just want to get to the ending itself. Which is then also pretty disappointing. 

This game's strong point is in it's encounters detail. If for some reason or another you don't find it repetitive and stick with it, there's a surprisingly large amount of content. Which whilst I personally aren't getting a whole lot out of, others definitely will. 67/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198022131856', 'num_games_owned': 1050, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1413696353}

author: {'steamid': '76561198130228779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1415083052}
review:
"Monster Loves You!" is a fun, short game in the style of a "choose your own adventure" novel. You begin life in a bizzare monster birth from a vat of slime, and progress through senility (if you live that long). While fun and interesting at first, this game quickly becomes repetetive and is easily completed in less than half an hour if you read fast. I've played the game about an hour or so total, and I've beaten it at least three times. Once you've beaten the game once, you can play through it again rather quickly, as many of the options are the same throughout the game and once you've read them the first time, there's no real reason to read them again. All in all, it's a fun time waster, but with limited replay value. I recommend it if you can find it on sale and want a VERY light visual novel to play around with. It's a lot of fun and there are some good humorous bits, but overall it's a pretty ordinary game.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198119213255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1448723052}

author: {'steamid': '76561198203713744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1423625468}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a casual, text based, Create-Your-Own adventure game.

You are a monster, living in a monster town. You begin as a tiny monsterling, and grow as the game progresses. Through childhood, into adulthood, and possibly even as a monster elder, you must make choices. Each choice alters your monster in some way, and lead up to several different endings based on how you choose to play. The writing is humorous at times, with you having to decide between truth or lies, fight or flight, and occasionally whether to help someone out...or just eat them and be done with it. The art style is something out of a toddler's story book, which fits surprisingly well with the game's design; and the story itself isn't very long, which makes it a great time filler.

The game is simple, easy to pick up, and family friendly. However if you don't enjoy point and click games, or the Create-Your-Own adventure style, then this probably isn't the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091392379', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1666170768}
review:
Cute, simplistic, and casual. A good game to unwind with!

Monster Loves You! is a short choose-your-own-adventure game. Each achievement here are the different endings possible in the game. The story is easy to follow and guess since the choices and stat system are simple, at best. The story was written in good jest, so don't expect anything heavy or deep. Afterall, you're naught but a monster.

PS: This is great to play with with children. My nieces enjoyed it with my lively storybook-telling voice on top of the cute pictures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037583723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1513666797}
review: I absolutely adore the art design in this game. And, depending on what your "end game" is, it'll only take you around an hour or two to finish it. The best part is how many achievement endings you can get. Some of the choices along the way might feel repetative to some, but, each play through feels similar but different when you focus on trying to be a "good" Monster versus a "Bad" Monster. And which is which all depends on your point of view.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105156704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1561991633}
review:
This is a casual, interactive novel, not an actual game, you play as a newly spawned monster and through your actions decide what kind of monster you will become, which also affects your reputation and how much the other monsters will respect you.

The game play consists of choice and consequence but in a lighthearted way (except towards the end if you become an  elder). There are several "quests" or choices that come up which vary with each playthrough and are specific to the life stage of your monster, and the game has multiple endings.

On the whole this is a cute, fun and at times funny game, but if you are trying to get all the endings I'd recommend leaving the game awhile inbetween each playthrough. The reason is that even though you don't always get the same quests, after awhile they do start to repeat...so after the first couple of playthroughs it gets a bit, well, repetitive . 
Not only that but there is no save feature, meaning that to get every ending you have to play through the entire game each time. 

Otherwise this is a quirky and enjoyable choose your own adventure and definitely worth a look, especially if you can catch it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007746696', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1429059313}
review:
The Good:

Cute graphics
Decently priced
Decisions affect your stats that in turn gain access to new decisions
Children-friendly
Casual
Excellent if you liked Choose Your Own Adventure books

The Bad:

Most choices don't really matter
Sometimes you will not be offered an option you like
Not for those who like intricate stories that have several endings

I recommend this game for children who enjoy fantasy and adults who like a casual storybook game.  Monster Loves You is a "choose your own adventure" version of the entire life cycle of a monster, from spawn to death or glory.  The game poses many situations you must choose from a list of options to solve, each of which usually change one or more of your stats such as bravery, cleverness, or honesty.  You also have an ongoing respect stat that affects how your monsterkind treat you and how likely they are to follow under your leadership.  As a monster you undergo many phases of life all culminating with a large conflictual theme in the end that you must resolve. 

Choose your own adventure, monster-style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157728850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1429167476}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140295131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1427070373}
review:
well, i have just managed to get the last achievement (thanks to cthulhugirl00!), so that means i should probably do a review.   i had not noticed this title, but a friend gave it to me as a present (thanks soliloqui!).  i am pleased she did as it is a fun title with a fun story line.   you play the role of a little monster as you guide her through life.   starting small, you interract with the other monsters gaining attributes like kindness or ferocity or bravery.   you can also try to win respekt from other monsters and gain influence over them.

the game is a strage cross between a visual novel and a choose-your-own-adventure book.   it is not particularly deep, but is good fun nonetheless and you can come back to it and work through all the little episodes quite nicely.   i think it would be great to play with children.   if this style of game appeals generally, then i can give it a recommendation for you.

p.s.  one thing that you might find useful is that you can use the keys 1,2,3... on the main keyboard to select options.   i found that more useful than clicking with the mouse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110038955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1426686564}
review:
This game is quite charming!

It's a text based choose your adventure style of game, with the accumulation of various character traits (that affect what dialog will succeed).

It's a fun little game to play every once in a while, and overall I thought it was sweet. I would recommend grabbing it when it's on sale, though, as it's not the longest game in the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041969346', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1445164462}
review:
Direi che è un gioco assolutamente niente male. Le scelte che si fanno influenzano il modo di crescere del mostro.
Si inizia con un cucciolo, man mano in base alle scelte si sviluppano vari rami che andranno a determinare il tipo di mostro.
Anche la grafica è molto carina stilisticamente. L'unica pecca è che lo si può giocare solo in inglese, andando a pesare su chi non tanto lo capisce ma vorrebe giocare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114265481', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1424828243}
review: It's a pretty cute looking game,it has replay value in order to get the multiple endings/achievements. Also the soundtrack is pretty good too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133043492', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1426004170}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a cute [i]choose your own adventure game[/i]. You are a newborn monster and you have to develop a few skills that may help you later in the game. You can do that by choosing an adventure, and make the choices that you would like to do.
You grow older, and there are many more adventures to follow. Will the other monsters respect you? And how do humans view monsters and visa versa? You can decide that with your own behaviour in the stories. 

The game is not very long, I think you can complete one story in 45 minutes. Luckily, the game has a high replayability due to the multiple endings. The stories where you can choose from are amusing to read. 
The artstyle looks cartoony and I think it looks very cute as well. The slow paced music fits the game perfectly, because it is a cute but relaxing tune.

I would recommend to buy this game in a sale. It is a good game if you want to take a break from all the fastpaced games. 

My rating for this game: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998273415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1433938216}
review:
[b]⊕[/b] Unique story with a lot of safe, spoon-fed lore appropriate for most audiences. Cartoony feel that is not common with this text adventure style game, though a welcome addition to the genre. Lots of different paths and endings available to tour.

[b]⊖[/b] Virtually no challenge. Graphics feel a bit over-used and stock. Writing is a little childish at times.

[b]✎[/b] This game is cute, I enjoyed playing through it. I'm sure if this team took on more bigger themes in their next text-based adventure project, it would go wonderfully. I highly question the price tag of 10 USD or why you would ever want a three-pack, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014147831', 'num_games_owned': 1556, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1421208008}
review: Adorable game about life choices and growing up.  9 different endings give it some replay value and the fact every time you play it you get a little bit different set of events makes it a bit less repetetive, cause believe me, it WILL get repetetive at some point sooner or later. Cuteas it is, it is simple, so do not expect much depth to it. Even results of your choices are summed up to one or two lines of text near the end of the game. Overall, i would give it 7/10. Nothing much more to say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097151272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1420684062}
review: 'Monster Loves You' is a cute game that depending on what decisions you make changes the outcome. Some endings are shorter than others but it's still interesting to get them all. Personally, I love this game but I can see how it's not for everyone. If you like action based game, this is not that game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152970372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1472525740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120341610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1430966290}
review:
Choose-your-own-adventure game where you can be as sweet or ferocious a monster as you please. But be warned, your fellow monsters (and humans *gasp*) might not like you very much. 

It's a good way to waste time, and it honestly is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075108160', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1518327820}
review:
:MAY INCLUDE SPOILERS:






This game is very unique. The art and soundtrack are charming, the story is intriguing, and it's very replayable. There isn't really much for gameplay, being that the game is mostly decision making, which is by no means a bad thing. It'll take you at least a while to get all the endings, and even then there is just a bunch of different things that can happen. The writing is very humorous and clever, and the whole style of the game is charming. 

There are 5 different stages in this game: Morsel, Kid, Adolescent, Adult, and then Elder. Each of them have some differences. The 1st stage is very short, and will also determine a large part of what happens later in the game. The second stage doesn't have any major twists, although your traits (kindness, cleverness, honesty, etc.) will develop much more rapidly, which makes this a good chance to get a headstart on what traits you want more of. The third stage is much like the previous, but the story is more open, because you aren't in the brood cave the whole time like you were in the second stage. This stage takes a few more days and you become a little bit less impressionable, as well as it being much more likely to lose parts of your traits as well as gain them. There is a few chances of respect being earned in this stage, but it will not be majorly used until adulthood and elder. Similar to the other stages, the fourth stage takes the longer than any of the other ones. This stage is more free because you can decide whether to socialize with other monsters, or go out and adventure. During this stage you will be much less impressionable, and your traits will probably stay mostly the same. You will also rack up respect. Respect is very important as in most cases, it will determine your fate. Once adulthood is over, you will start to realize that your life is coming to an end and you have to make a few decisions, if you want to try to live, if you will dissolve, if you will ascend, etc. Once you go back to the spawning vat you will be confronted by elders. You can dissolve, or try to ascend into an elder. This part is kind of complicated, so I'll just sum it up. If you dissolve you will end your game right there, but if you try to become an elder you will have a chance to be tested. If you fail the test or dissolve, you will dissolve, but if you complete the test you will move onto being an elder. Once you become an elder, it's up to you to determine whether to fight the humans, make peace, etc. (Or become a neurosurgen.) This stage is probably the most unique for a few reasons. It adds two new factors, Humans opinion on monsters and vice versa. By the end of the stage the percentages and a few last decisions will determine how the game ends. Besides that, most decisions will require a trait. So you will have a better chance to complete something that requires more ferocity if you have 90% compared to 30%, adding a more rpgish aspect into the game, making the elder stage even more interesting.


Sorry if this was more a guide than it was a review, but I hope it helps. This game is great, and I really love a lot about it. Of course there are downsides to a few things, like not as much character establishment, and things like that. Another thing about the game is that the story is VERY open-ended, almost everything is determined through your choices, which might explain why there's not as much character development. Other then that, this is a very unique concept and was very well executed. The game is charming, funny, replayable, and even at some times heartwrenching. And I would love to see a sequel to this game, because it really deserves it. It's definitely worth the money, so buy it and give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092403404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1409697860}
review: I think we should just stay friends...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971411597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1441556940}
review:
The nice thing about Monster Loves You! is that it's not for you as a seasoned gamer, but for your children (with or without your help).

You start your journey in a pool of goo, and from that slimy craddle to your comfy grave, you're confronted to numerous adventurous situations, in which you'll have to decide how you will react. Depending on your choices (presented as text options) you'll progress into branched mini-stories, receiving or losing points in a serie of traits like Bravery, Cleverness, Cruelty, Kindness and so forth.

From an adult perspective, the game might seem unchallenging and you'll really enjoy the last part, dedicated to politics and community management. But from a child perspective, the game offers alot of behaviors to explore, and to learn that choices have consequences - both in short and long term. And it's possible to be really really mean too - you're a monster after all and nobody will punish you for that.

The art is cartoony and childish (of course), and the langage proper to the young audience. Even if the total play time for a character's life is short (about an hour), it's possible to come back once in a while to have fun guiding another creature in the path you've chosen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044081466', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1618748216}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027589352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1423639290}
review:
'Monster Loves You!' falls into a very unique category;  It's essentially a 'Choose Your Own Adventure' game--an interactive book.

It is entirely meditative:  you direct the flow of your monster through various events and stages of life and enjoy the colourful illustrations and caricatures.  The prompts and narratives have a sense of humour all their own and it makes for a delightful read.  My only complaint might be that there are so few pieces of music in the game and they feel droning after a few plays.

On the whole, though, it does well with a morning cup of coffee and a friend in chat.  Go on, give it a try.  At the very least, it's a refreshing new take on what games can be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979951602', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1604400158}

review: A sweet and lovely choose your own adventure game, in which you go through the life of a monster. It's a short and fun game, with a lot of replayability, if you wish to get all the endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031789432', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1420899892}
review:
This game is adorable. It's interactive fiction, kinda, but more often than not you have a large number of small choices available to you at any given time rather than a few big ones. The outcomes of your choices affect stats which in turn affect the later stages of the game. This makes the game's evolution feel more organic than branchy.

A single playthrough doesn't take long. When you play through multiple times, you start to recognize choices you've made before and you'll know how they play out. It has replay value, but unless you want to try to get all the achievements or really have a hungering to see everything, you'll probably only play it through 2-3 times.

So the game is short (which some people don't go for) but sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094613896', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1451190070}

Some light humor involved, but you can also come to care about your little monster life, and failures could leave you misty-eyed.  An enchanting little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028458050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1650210476}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043973348', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1422082971}
review: What an adorable little  game! Monster Loves You is a  "Build Your Adventure"  casual game.  I had fun trying to unlock the different endings and to grow my little monsterling to an Elder who may lead Monsters to peace or war with Humans (Or having him become a neurosurgeon). Or, to have my monster sacrifice himself to help create future monsters with his best attributes. The artwork is  colorful, lovely, and charming, reminding me of picture books that I read at a young age. The music is quirky and fits with the game quite well. Gameplay wise, it can be a bit tedious to unlock every ending, however, it's a great game to pick up casually. In addition, this would be a great game to play with your family, adults and children alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041870855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1434098942}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042956737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1419820800}
review:
Cute, but underwhelming, and lacking in both content and cohesion.  All things considered, mediocre at best.

This short, light hearted narritave driven game aims to tell a notably different story every playthrough based on your actions.  Unfortunately, the story is broken up into tens of small, fairly mundane story arcs, which are generally kept very separate.  One's actions have little effect on future story arcs, with only the occasional action which benefits from high stats in certain areas.  Additionally, the overarching plot is weak.  It lacks substance.  Very little that happens in the tiny sub-arcs actually seem related to the main story-line at all, and the climax of the game seems to have little to no build up.  It just suddenly happens after you've complete the requisite amount of missions.  Every aspect of the game I can think to name lacks depth:  the interactive elements, the characters, the story, the visuals (there are only a few images used the entire game).  Further, despite the attempt to make a story that is adaptive to the player's choices, the lack of content makes the replay value extremely low, so expect to only get a couple hours out of this game.  It only says I have 10 hours because I accidentally left it on over night.

TL;DR:
Highly lacking in content, with a surprisingly bland story.  Mediocre at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032828119', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1443839168}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071359032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1415558210}
review: A fun quick game! If you like monsters and multiple endings, play this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036338106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1480282607}
review:
I really love this game.  In fact, I can't really think of a single bad thing to say about it.

- The premise is cute and funny.
- The cartoony artwork perfectly matches the tone of the game, and the randomly generated character designs help keep each playthrough fresh.
- The music is relaxing, yet upbeat.
- The gameplay is simple, revolving entirely around text trees, but it effectively facilitates a successful choose-your-own adventure.  
- There are a huge array of quests programmed into the game, and you will get a slightly different mix of options each time you play.  I have run through the game 15 times, and have yet to explore every scenario, let alone every dialogue option of every scenario.
- The humour is great.  It can be a bit crass or gross at times, but you *are* playing as a monster.
- I like that you can mold your character's personality as you go, so if you don't want to be a mean monster you don't have to be.
- Each game takes just 15-60 minutes (depending on how fast you are clicking through the text), so it doesn't feel like a slog to keep trying for new endings.  Also, it is great to play as a virtual palate cleanser in between other games.
- CAAAAAAAAAaaaaaAAAaaAAAAAAAaAaAaAAAAaAaAAaaAaaaaTS!!!!!

A solid 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000692879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1420696490}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063085949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1537136414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120528226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1650998951}
review:
Maybe my expectations were to high, but I was kind of disappointed. It is really just clicking on textboxes to gain "personality points" (like ferocity, cleverness, kindness) and in the later rounds "respect" and in the third round you can determine by your actions wether humans and monsters like each other. Sadly it´s pretty easy to see through and after a while one can just quit reading the question-box and just click on answers. 
It´s cute in the beginning but I was bored after about 20 minutes. You just click on "adventures" (which you do not have to search for, it´s always on the same position and visible by a big sign) and you can not move or interact with objects. 
I mean, yeah I wanted a "brain-off"-game to relax no action and not too much of thinking or complex riddles, but this is just too low and it does not give you (or at least me) any satisfaction.
All in all it´s plain clicking on textboxes. Nothing else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055239225', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1450348277}
review: Very cute visual novel/choose your own adventure game with lots of different endings with a good load of replay value. I think that grinding the game for all the endings would be tedious but if you spread it out and aimed for two or three endings per session then you'd probably be alright.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084710504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1402145576}
review: I'm not exactly sure why I got this game, to be honest. It was ridiculously cheap, but that doesn't excuse it for being pretty flat and kinda boring. author: {'steamid': '76561198030733646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1419974294}
review:
As the write up states - it's a choose your own adventure.  

The game have basically five phases (birth, child, adolescent, adult, elder).   Each phase has "mini adventures" from which to choose and then options within the adventures.  The choices drive your "personality"  

Good - the little adventures are amusing and there's a semi randomness to what gets offered as a selection in each phase that lends to some replayability.  There are 14 possible outcomes for the end game.  It takes about 10-15 hours of game play to achieve all 14 outcomes. 

My criticism is with the choices lacking materiality on the final outcome.  The choices cause the trait percentages to vary. Basically you get about 30 or so choices and find they lead to one final choice yielding your outcome - you could choose the same 30 adventures/same choices every play through, get to 80% in every trait and about 70% in respect.  (not that you'd do that, but you could and it would not restrict final outcome overly much at all other than neurosurgeon and modest legacy).  

Basically the choices at birth/child/teen just arent material enough.  They should cause the final outcomes to be far more restrictve and potentially open up new content.  Instead  all forks in the path lead to what is effectively a common point.  

My second criticism would be the elder phase -  the choices are mundane - one choice will pretty much cause How monsters/humans view one another to go up and the other cause it to go down.  The phase is akin to clicking "help" or "sabotage" buttons 15 times in a row.  The adventures themselves were creative but the choice selections and how they cause ""your own adventure" to evolve in my view lacked creativity.  

Summary - The mini adventures are quite amusing but other aspects of the game are lacking.   

For 2-3$ and the replayability of seeing how each choice affects your traits it gets a borderline thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043730957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1414410614}
review: Monsters love you is a little casual indie game. The game is simple with a little luck factor and a lot of decision based quests. The whole game is based on going through quests in which you make choices and watch your monster develop. There are about 10 different endings. You can run through the whole game in around 30 to 60 minutes depending on your choices in quests. This game is great for a chill while you’re waiting for something and I think it would be really popular if it was for mobile or tablets but since we are reviewing PC version it can’t get more than 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052612326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1472221465}
review: I really enjoyed Monster Loves You!, even though it's rather short. The plot is a great idea and rather different from conventional tales about monsters, the artwork ist great, most of the events are very amusing and the fact that you get a lot of different endings makes for at least some replay value. If you like text-based find-your-own-ending games, try this out!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989581647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1425761875}
review:
An amusing little choose-your-own-adventure-style game. I'd only buy it if it's on sale for 75% off ($2.50), but for that price  it's a neat little time-sink. Replayability is fairly high, but that is because you can play an entire game in about half an hour if you take your time and read through all the mini-plots.
Monster Loves You! seems more like a mobile app than a full-fledged PC game, and I'm sure it could easily be ported to mobile devices if it hasn't already been. Once you've played through the game, most of the surprise is gone - none of the achievements are horribly difficult to get (well, maybe the Advanced Neurosurgeon one), and after you've gone through those, you'll move on to something else, but look back on Monster Loves You! with a heart-felt "Heh".

review: A fun 'Choose Your Own Adventure' type game.  The art style is adorable, the story has a sense of humor, and you're rewarded for taking different paths in your journey through monster-hood.  Low time/brainpower investment, suitable for the chil'n, but still entertaining enough for adults.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045384155', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1419380290}
review:
It's more a textual game than anything- so yeah if you love reading you'll find this alright.

- there isn't much going on in terms of a visual aspect, you just get similar reactions/images through the game over and over again. 

music can become highly repetitive but it doesn't mean it's bad. Its mostly ambience.

You'll be trying to achieve all the endings - which is about 10 or so... So you're going to basically go through the same basic process over and over again- like for about- 10 times or even more times assuming you might get one repeated ending on acicdent. So after the second trial i was basically breezing through without even reading a good portion of the time excluding the answers I'd assume would give me a specific benefit i was looking for.

The games story is a bit childish- yeah. But it's pretty charming and a decent time-passer.

Pretty sure if you let a kid play this they'd enjoy it unless they have dyslexia or some sh!t like that.

I wouldn't get it on full price- though. Kind of not worth it if that's the case.

Overall- it's fokin lil cute baby game, perfect for a man-baby like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151906410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1445923182}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141572680', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1428462218}
review: Fun little reading game, no real game play and fairly straight forward but an interesting way of building your own story via decisions and good looking graphics. It's a bit pricey for what it is, but absolutely worth getting on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067263809', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1420151664}
review:
If you like Choose Your Own Adventures or dark children's stories and especially if you like both, then this game comes highly recommended. I'm just barely halfway discovering the possible end scenarios, and I want to explore them all.

After multiple playthroughs, the number of adventure situations begins to feel repetetive, but certainly not the ways of dealing with them. (It's definitely less tedious than grinding in another style of game.)

The storybook art is charming enough. The flavor of the story makes it accessible even for relatively younger players, in spite of the considerable descriptive violence. 

TL;DR - I love Monster Loves You!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000604423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1418471370}
review: Es freut mich, dass immer öfter auch ältere Spielkonzepte aufgegriffen werden. Was mir nicht gefällt, ist wenn diese Konzepte mies umgesetzt werden. Die Story ist langweilig und eintönig. Die Piktogramme, die auf die jeweiligen Abenteuer referieren sollen, die zur Auswahl stehen, scheinen mir komplett arbiträr gewählt zu sein. Zu guter Letzt: Ich hatte einen Tapferkeitswert von 100 und bin einer schwarzen Katze begegnet. Ich bin ihr aus dem Weg gegangen. Mein Wert wurde auf 1 hinabgesetzt - totale Willkür. "Monster Loves You!" ist einfach ein schlechtes Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130321496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1417846935}
review:
与其说这游戏是养成，更不如说是文字冒险更合适一些。主角是一只小怪物，游戏的过程就是小怪物一生的不同阶段，每个阶段通过冒险提高属性，最后达成不同的结局。

和所有的模拟养成一样，这游戏也是以多分支和多结局为卖点。主角的外表会随着属性和年龄变化，每周目所经历的冒险也不一样。游戏一共有14个结局（对应14个成就），不过因为每周目时间都很短（30~50min）所以相当好刷，除掉一个靠人品刷事件的结局之外其它结局照着攻略打也能很轻松的打出来。但是相比之下每周目的冒险重复率很高，而且过于简单导致没什么挑战性，里面的故事也有些老套，导致刷的过程稍微有点无聊。

其它方面的话……画面是儿童画风格，还算整齐干净；音乐感觉和游戏稍微有点不搭，但是还算好听，至少能记住一些旋律；里面的表情超级好，推荐收一套自己用，其它就没了。

总体来说是个还可以的休闲小品，闲着没事干的时候打一打也不错，不过就不要有太高期待了……当然，依然不建议原价买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198061283583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1412253930}
review:
Monster Loves You! is definitely fun in its own way, especially if you're used to games like dating sims or visual novels (despite this containing no dating at all and a very loose, not-100%-linear plot), but it's pretty lightweight. 

Basically: good way to kill a few hours here and there, extremely good game to give to kids (especially if you want to induct them into visual novels/text adventures later), cute artwork, cute writing, but can get a bit repetitive after multiple playthroughs. (Again, though, if you give this to a kid then they probably won't care.) Buy it, have fun with it, get vaguely annoyed at the fact that you can't customise your monster, but don't expect too much. 

6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044606103', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1415809740}
review:
Je suis déçue, déçue, déçue.

Avez-vous lu ma review pour The Yawhg (http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ny-Nady/recommended/269030/) ? Non ? Dommage car ici ce sera quasiment la même chose.

Monster Loves You! est un jeu mignon, sympathique, enfantin et hyper accessible (qu'en anglais par contre). Le menu est choupinou comme tout et on se fait très vite une idée du plot : on va élever un petit monstre tout mignon et décider de sa vie jusqu'à ce qu'il devienne vieux. Super c'est Princess Maker mais on remplace les petites filles par des pitits monstres ! (et on enlève l'inceste) Bref, ça promet. J'adore vraiment les jeux au gameplay "minimaliste" (que ce soit sous forme de visual novel ou de livre dont vous êtes le héros que je bouffe à n'en plus finir et que je peux recommencer 30 fois), autant dire que je suis pile le public visé. Mais au final, je me demande vraiment QUI peut vraiment être emballé par ce jeu.

Expliquons rapidement. Votre petit monstre est né, bravo ! (NDLR : vous êtes le monstre) Maintenant, c'est parti faut vivre et s'adapter à la société des monstres. Allez-vous tout bouffer ? Faire des câlins ? Pleurer ? Voler les autres ? Plein de choix sous forme de texte vont se présenter à vous pendant quelques minutes. Des stats vont augmenter/baisser (ça augmente beaucoup plus que ça baisse honnêtement). Bref, vous connaissez le truc. Pour l'instant, les stats n'ont AUCUNE incidence sur ce qu'il se passe. En gros, vous augmentez/baissez des stats un peu random (gentillesse, intelligence, férocité...) sans trop savoir à quoi ça sert ?? Niveau graphisme, vous avez juste un fond statique. Et y a une musique en boucle aussi. Voilà voilà.

SOUDAIN le narrateur te dit que ton monstre a grandi et qu'on passe à une prochaine phase ! Grosse hype. Sauf qu'on va faire la même chose qu'avant. Seule différence : on a le choix parmi des "aventures" (sous formes de petites images rondes sans intitulé) qui sont des petits événements très courts avec des choix bla bla bla. Pour faire simple, ces petites aventures se sélectionnent un peu au hasard et on ne peut pas toutes les faire en une seule partie (mais bon, aucune aventure n'a d'influence sur l'autre donc quel intérêt à part vouloir tout lire ??). Au niveau du scénario ça n'a pas changé hein, vous êtes toujours un petit monstre qui évolue en société et il doit soit tabasser les autres soit les aider à chasser les loups. M'okay. Dans tous les cas vous allez devenir plus fort et ça ne va rien changer. Vous allez aussi commencer à gagner du "respect" en fonction de ce que vous faites. On sait pas à quoi ça sert non plus.

Votre monstre grandit encore. Il est ado. Ok. On recommence. Aventures random. Les stats n'ont toujours aucune influence.

Il grandit. Il est adulte. Pas d'influence des stats. Zut. Mince.

PETIT MOMENT DE TENSION on nous apprend que notre monstre va partir à la retraite. On a donc une petite phase sympatoche où notre monstre est très stressé : comment les monstres vieillissent ?? Soit il devient vieux, soit il retourne dans le lac moisi dans lequel des nouveaux petits monstres vont naître. Et si on veut devenir un vieux monstre et toucher une bonne retraite, il faut passer (ENFIN OUI OUI) un test pour voir si on a bien augmenté nos stats (j'avais quasi tout à 100% kek). Je passe le test haut la main et je deviens vieux. Ok.

NOUVELLE MISSION RETOURNEMENT DE SITUATION. Le jeu te dit "wow t'as eu une influence de ouf en tant que monstre adulte déjà (ah bon) mais là en tant que vieux monstre tu vas carrément influencer les monstres ET LES HUMAINS INCROYABLE PLOT TWIST". Donc l'histoire se déroule ainsi : comme vous êtes vieux, vous voulez emmerder le monde et vous occuper de la relation entre les monstres et les humains. En fonction de vos choix (lol) vous allez dégrader la relation humain-monstre ou l'améliorer. Hum ok. Ai-je besoin de préciser à quel point il est facile d'atteindre les 100% (c'est limite si les humains veulent pas copuler avec les monstres dans ma partie tellement ils se kiffent) ? Y a vraiment aucun, aucun challenge. Alors, ouais, ça y est, on a des petits "tests" pour nos stats. Mais on est tellement fort de partout déjà qu'on les réussit sans problème. En plus, ils nous DISENT quand les tests vont arriver. Genre les choix se présentent ainsi : "Manger un poulet (ATTENTION CA DEMANDE BEAUCOUP BEAUCOUP DE BRAVOURE)". Subtil.

Et puis voilà y a une fin "bravo les humains et les monstres se kiffent et waouh t'as un peu de respect bravo". Et c'est fini.

Et si on recommence une partie tout ce qu'on a fait avant ne sert à rien et on aura exactement les mêmes choix qui vont se présenter. Vous verrez littéralement la même chose. Ok, vous choisirez des petites aventures différentes (et encore, y en a pas énormément) mais au final vos stats vont bouger de la même façon, ça n'aura aucune sorte d'influence.

Votre monstre pourra avoir une personnalité différente... Ouais... et alors ? À aucun moment celle-ci se montre vraiment. Les graphismes sont presque inexistants, les musiques aussi... Il n'y a pas de scénario, seule une succession PREDEFINIE d'événements. C'est donc très, très répétitif.

J'ai voulu lancer une 2e partie, je me suis ennuyée très rapidement car j'avais déjà tout lu quasiment. Il n'y a clairement pas assez d'engagement, pas assez d'ambition même pour un petit jeu de ce style. La force devait être dans le texte. Et même si celui-ci est très rigolo, il n'est pas à la hauteur d'un jeu véritablement prenant et charmant. C'est dommage car pour moi ce jeu aurait pu être super marrant, si seulement il avait été fait de telle sorte que des événements différents/aléatoires arrivent en fonction de ce que l'on fait.

À la prochaine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103094794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1416110552}
review: Very fun and easy game. There are a lot of different scenario's and it's really easy to get the hang of once you play through it a few times and experiment which each path.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008693173', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1418122078}
review:
This game is a choose your own adventure style game. The mechanics are simplistic and the story is cute. 

However, the story presuming you progress to the elder stage will take you about 40 minutes. While a nice idea and enjoyable for the short time frame I can not recommend as the game simply asks you to replay it to get all the endings... Not worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071441898', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1415596732}
review:
It was fun! ...For the first run or two.


Well that was upsetting. Monster Loves You! is a text, choose-your-own-adventure game where you start your life out as a newborn baby monster and you live your life up until your return to the slime vat pool or until you finish the game as an elder who transcended above death to decide what ulitimately happens between the humans and monsters when the inevitable conflict happens.

You have 5 personality traits, Bravery, Cleverness, Ferocity, Honesty, and Kindness. You gain and use your traits to your advantage in situations that require them. This would be awesome if there was actually more situations that required that. Because more or less everything you do it a sure thing. It's pretty obvious if you're going to lose something or gain something from most interactions. I'll continue that shortly.

You use these personality traits to your advantage to gain respect from other elders and monsters so you may be respected enough as an individual to transcend into becoming an elder on the day you are supposed to die. Then once you are an Elder, you must work to either build or sabotage human and monster relations in the coming days before the conflict of humans and monsters. It is this point I believe the story ends with the effort you put into this before the conflict.

Everything about this game was really cool except that this game doesn't vary or switch up the story at all. By my second playthrough I already knew pathes and things I needed to say to reap the most (xyz) out of that "adventure" So I could get my stats high or close to maxed out as possible while getting tons of respect from the elders. I was hoping that after each death it'd be like a new life with new characters and new adventures. But I kept seeing the same thing over and over again already and it got really tedious and simply not fun. It immediately became apparent that i'd just start grinding to get medals for achievements. I don't care so much about the medals. It's nice to see new endings. But that's not the point of a game like Monster Love You! or at least shouldn't be circled around what the ending is going to be. The meat and soul of the game which is the time spent in each life stage is where you're spending most and pretty much all of your time as opposed to the scripted age-transistion stages. It was like I had a really amazing, fan-friggin-tastic sandwich, and in two playthroughs I felt like I was eating the same sandwich for months. I was so sick of it.

Contining on that point is that you get really familiar with each adventure pretty easily, they're very distinct and memorable most of them. And the options listed make it very obvious which choice is going to get you the most points and the good stuff.
I was investing in honesty and kindness to achieve renown for honesty and kindness in the game, but I knew the choices in the game so well and understood where I could get off chalk-free in two playthroughs I already knew where I could build ferocity without consequence. I had kindness and cleverness maxed, I had honesty about 86% up there and I had roughly 69% ferocity. I shouldn't be able to get my ferocity stat so high while striving to get honesty and kindness. Cleverness was just so easy to pick up. It made it super-easy to bend the end game to my will because I had such high stats overall I could make the story anything I wanted it to be. Therefore there was really no reason to keep playing the game. Because in two playthroughs I could understand the routes I need to take to get the most (xyz) and how to get the medals and other things.

It as a really fun game my first two runs. After that, it just simply wasn't fun. Definitely wasn't worth the money I paid for it, I expected much more out of it after reading such nice reviews.

Also continuing, from what i've heard in the game, sounds like the game has only 3 soundtracks in it. And that's just a big no-no. The art directive is okay. They could've worked harder in a lot of areas, but whatever. The humor in this game is great. But it's not funny after you read it the first time.


Regardless, Monster Loves You! is a nice and funny and enjoyable game. But after the second playthrough or third, you realize you're just doing the same thing again and it's not fun. I was really hoping that my deaths in the game would have an influence on my next life (which I read this in a review, this was a lie or a fabrication of their beliefs of what's going on in the game) But it doesn't and that's when I realized I was going to just be doing the same thing over and over again.

Overall, this game wasn't worth the money I paid for it, I bought it for about 4 dollars and I personally just wouldn't really recommend it at all to be honest. As I said, it's fun and it's nice. But I personally think you should keep that money for something nicer that pops up on the steam store or in a steam sale that you'd rather grab.


Anyway, thank you for reading my review. I hope it helped you in your decision to purchase this game or not, have a good day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126964551', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1513882010}
review:
To tell the truth, I was a little bias about this game at first. But then I played it for the first time and it left me happy for the end of the day. It's simple, it's cute, it will surely grab your attention. Monster Loves You reminded me a little of visual novels, but with a twist. Unlike in, say, TWAU or TWD, every choice you make affects the outcome.
I can honestly say that this game is one of the few in my library that I don't regret buying.
