author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1414185640}
review:
Monster Loves you is a choose your own adventure style story.

The main backbone of the story follows your life, as a monster, from the moment you are born in the "spawning vat".  As you progress through the story, at certain points in your life you are given adventures to go on. The choices you make in these adventures determine the course of your life, and the overall outcome of the story. There are a wide array of adventures available at each section.

You might think that this is simply a game for kids, but while kids will enjoy this, it does have some aspects where an adult might understand the more mature themes. It is worth noting however, that the overall playtime for the game is quite low, but trying to get the possible endings & exploring all of the available adventures will bump that time up somewhat.

The graphics in this game are very nice. Although they are not the most important part. That falls to the text. The story is written in a very nice way, that makes it easy to enage in.

The game is controlled via a mouse although if you can stream to or play the game on a tablet, it will work much better.

The music in this game is very nice. It's not too obtrusive and compliments the storylike nature of the game.

Something I do feel that this game would really benefit from is if there were some way of making user-generated adventures. After several play throughs, you will come accross all of the adventures and end up repeating yourself.

All in all, ths is a very nice choose your own adventure game which is definitely worth buying. Although, If you don't like reading, then don't buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030042641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1414817863}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058219119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1414783427}
review: Monster Loves You is an adorable little experience where you play as a growing monster, making decisions and developing your personality. If you buy into the Story vs. Game debate it definantly lands more on the interactive story end. The choices you make give you points in certain attributes that are then tested at a handful of landmarks. While not necessarily a very flashy or unique game, I found myself repeatedly going back to discover new endings and storylets. Overall, if you aren't a fan of games like The Walking Dead or No One Has To Die you probably won't find too much enjoyment here, but if you're looking for whimsically cute interactive story, I'd definantly give this one a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010931201', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1580791151}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000963278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1528846204}
review:
An interesting text-based choose your own story. Only, the outcome isn't always obvious and sometimes the result of your choices leave you a little confused. But every run through the game takes only about 20 minutes so it's pretty easy to just try again and see what you get. 
It's humorous with a good mix of cute and creepy, interesting enough to keep you entertained, and innocent enough to let your kids give it a shot. Over all worth the buy if you're grabbing it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009316076', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1414785657}
review:
So, I found this game today on the store because I received a coupon for it. With 75% off, I figured why not? I didn't pay much attention to the reviews and just gave it a go.

What you have here is a cute and charming choose your own adventure game, with pretty backgrounds and nice ambient music. However the entire gameplay consists of essentially multiple choice answers to various situations. You go through each stage of a monster's life, from being born, an adolesencent, an adult, and then you either dissolve and die or become an elder. When you're an elder you decide the fate of the monsters versus humans. 

Depending on your choices you gain points in personality traits, which you need for other decisions later in the game. Based on your personality and your choices you can get one of 14 endings. An average play should take about 40 minutes, as it did with me. 

It's a very charming little title, and if you know what you're getting, go ahead and buy it. But if you're looking for something beyond "click click click" for forty minutes, your attention is best placed elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023927912', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1415059456}
review: I would say that this game is good for children in the 6 - 10 years age group.  Younger kids could easily play game, since there is no skill involved other than some pretty heavy reading, and older kids would appreciate the humor.  There are several different endings to get if you can stand navigating multiple choice menu after multiple choice menu.  Sure are there a few different "adventures" in each level, but there's no interactivity with the environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092291422', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1410676562}
review:
An overall good quality Choose Your Own Adventure-esque game. The game does require reading, so an adequate level of English and patience is required. It will require multiple playthroughs if you want to get all the achievements, which may become tedious if you do not have the patience to go through the same game multiple times. There are many choices which you can make within the game, which all eventually affects the type of ending you will get. If you enjoyed reading Choose Your Own Adventure books in your childhood, then you will certainly enjoy this game. If you didn't enjoy those books or you don't even know what I'm talking about, still buy this game because I guarantee you will enjoy it! 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045805927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1446435301}
review:
This is a ridicoulouse amount for the asking price, i got it for roughly $3.50 with a coupon and i still feel like it wasn't worth it. Not a bad game just way to short, takes 2 hours to beat it and the achievments broke for me as well so there's no reason for me to ever play it again. Unless achievments get fixed. I had to force myself to keep playing on my 2nd try and there's no way im going to be playing for a third. It doesn't have much depth either. The only way chosing different choices effects you is by percentages of respect and other stats you acquired which in the end just basically decide what choices you CAN make (Without high chance of fail).
Overall 2/10 fun the first time but way to expensive considering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004781216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1418465933}
review:
This game does provide to me an admiration. First, this game is a simple and cute.  Colorful backgrounds and harmonious soundtrack made a relaxed atmosphere.  Definitely, I am starting become to insane after hundreds repeating the same melody (more than twenty hours had played).
Second, game contains a several idioms and many kinds of synonyms, what was helpful to improve my English vocabulary. I have been started learning English only last few months, but this game was a comfortable ground to do it. 
And last, I recommended this game for all who had same aims as me (expanding vocabulary). Other way, this game might be more interesting for kids instead of adults. 
Anyway, my greetings to developers for their work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032273330', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1411864780}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a decision based adventure game which is best described if you remember those old Choose Your Own Adventure Books from around the 80's, where you had a story written down in this book and once in a while you have a choice to make that leads you to different pages and different continuation of the storyline. But Back to the Here and Now.

Gameplay

The Gameplay is more like a classic text adventure. Much to read and at the end you get a collection of things your character can do. For better visualisation you have beautiful handdrawn background, depending on your current location. To make every choice in this game more worthwhile (and to compansate the missing feature of running around in the world and exchanging things for something you could actually use on your adventure) there is a little stats-based system build into it. Nothing much, it keeps track of various characteristica that change depending on the decisions you make. And it actually doesn't do anything else in the game, it's only needed at the end to calculate which ending you will receive, which can range from tragic to hilarious, if you play your cards right. But more of that later.

Story

You start your adventure in a giant green pool of goo. Soon you will grow arms, and legs, and wings? Maybe. You can help those little things around you, or just eat them. And when you have grown strong enough you will embark from the slimy goo, seeing the light of the sun for the first time, and begin your new life as a little Monsterling.
The Story follows you through your life from a little monsterling to your adulthood and eventually your death (and even beyond if you meet certain criteria). In every life stage you receive a collection of adventures you can go on, each one takes a day from your clock until it's time to grow up. But careful here. You have more adventures than days, so you can't take on all of them, the adventures are only presented as icons, and many adventures share the same icon. So you can only guess what you will encounter there. This system will go through all 3 life stages. As little monsterling you learn the ropes of being a monster and rarely leave you broodchamber. During your childhood / Teenager times you learn something about the outside world and how dangerous and fascinating humans can be. Those humans should be on a modern day level. Your adulthood begins with an initiation rite to determine what kind of task you will do in the monsterworld. It's calculated from the stats you build up in your life, but doesn't add anything to your further adventure. You just live your life and do tasks inside and outside of the monster settlement. At the End it's time for you to return to the pool of goo you came from and pass on your memories to the monsters of the next generation. Or, if you did something right with your life, you may receive an oppurtunity to become an elder and just maybe doing some great deeds out there.

Conclusion

What you can expect from Monster Loves You! is a fairytale like adventure game which let you see such stories from quite a different perspective. And maybe you encounter characters like Puss in Boots, or Hänsel and Gretel. The Art is exceptionally well made and the fact that each playthrough will have different adventures and outcomes you gain a certain replaybility. So give it a try and choose your own little twisted fairytale.


If you want to get a better look at a playthrough of this game just click the link below:
http://youtu.be/pX7Gbe8U7gI?list=UUMxIS2guRxfCuJ1gllMecuA

For more Reviews visit my Blog at:
http://achievementunlockblog.wordpress.com/home/

author: {'steamid': '76561198101802351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1410473306}
review:
Любят ли нас монстры?
Monster Loves You! - замечательный текстовый квест. Здесь нет геймплея как такового - нам нужно только читать и выбирать варианты того, что мы скажем или сделаем. А выбирать здесь стоит внимательно - каждый поступок, совершенный нами, начиная с нашего рождения и заканчивая старостью, влияет на основные показатели нашего монстра (храбрость, свирепость, доброта, интеллект, честность), его репутацию в сообществе монстров, а также на отношение людей к монстрам и монстров к людям. От каждого из этих показателей зависит то, как закончится повествование (а концовок здесь, кстати, 14).
Но очень важно отметить, что игра - не для всех, я бы даже сказал, что для узкого круга людей. Первая проблема игры - английский язык в игре, где весь геймплей состоит в чтении. Если вы не знаете этот язык нас среднем/высоком уровне, то можете смело пропускать эту игру. Вторая проблема близка к первой - геймплейная составляющая. Если вам не нравится читать/не нравились текстовые квесты в, например, Космических Рейнджерах, то, опять же, проходите мимо этой игры.
К счастью, для меня два вышеназванных пункта не стали проблемой, поэтому игру я распробовал и она мне очень понравилась, поэтому от меня ей 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116079207', 'num_games_owned': 1418, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1409955164}
review:
Z cyklu "łowcy osiągnięć":
Monotonna w przechodzeniu po kilka razy, tylko po to by zdobyć wymarzoną odznakę. 
Ogólnie:
Jesteś potworem. Małym. Średnim. Dużym. Zostaniesz kimś wielkim. Albo nie. Zostaniesz glutem. Wybór należy do Ciebie!
Opis powyżej byłby idealny do reklamy dla polskiej wersji językowej, której niestety nie ma. Mimo to historyjka naszego galaretowatego potworka, którą tworzymy sami jest dość miła w przechodzeniu przez pierwsze kilka razy. Nie mamy tu jakichś kosmicznych animacji, porywającej muzyki czy scen walk, a mimo to ma w sobie coś przyciągającego. 
+ tworzenie historii "swojego" życia
+ jest to jakiś sposób na podszkolenie swojego angielskiego
+ latające achivy na ekranie startowym, możliwość zresetowania wszystkiego (czyli doskonała opcja dla osób kręcących gameplay'e)
- po paru razach robi się monotonna
- muzyka off po 10 minutach

6/10, mogło być lepiej.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097587635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1411344239}
review: A game that draws you in with its cute visuals and promise of story, Monster Loves You! was an overall disappointing experience. I have played games that are so repetitive and it can be done well ,ex: Binding Of Isaac, but I have never played a game that got so boring so fast. This game only use is for let's players on youtube who only have to play the game once and never touch it again. Despite being a game you are supposed to run through multiple times, I got bored of it before I even finished my first playthrough. All the options that determine your traits are exactly the same and lack any variety. Your efforts to actually "beat" the game comes down to chance and is independant of anything you actually do in the entire game. Perhaps this game would be more enjoyable to a younger audience but the lack of changing gameplay, borderline soporific storyline, and limited replayablility makes Monster Loves You! a game I wouldn't play even once if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131676122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1517367703}
review: This game is totally perfect if you just want to kick back and relax! No need to think too hard for this one. And it helps that its really cute!The game itself is short but it offers enough options that make it replayable. I wouldn't recomment this to someone who gets bored of reading lots of text, though I think the text is what makes it fun to play through. Plus, at the price that I got it for (1.99), the purchase certainly was worth it! Yup, no regrets over here!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077778667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1482657078}
review:
Wichtig ist bei dem Spiel, dass man gut Englisch lesen kann, da alle Texte auf Englisch sind!

+ Grafik
Liebevoll gezeichnete Grafiken, welche die Story unterstreichen.
+ Story
Man spielt das leben eines Monsters durch, welches dabei allerhand erlebt.

- Sound
Die Musik passt zwar gut, wiederhohlt sich aber zu oft
-Länge
Das Spiel ist recht schnell durchgespielt und wiederholt sich danach immer öfter. Der Wiederspielwert ist zwar da, aber die Szenarien hat man recht schnell durch.

Noch etwas zum Gameplay 
Es ist ein simples durchklicken von Textboxen, da das Spiel nur auf die Story ausgelegt ist.

Fazit: Ein Spiel mit einem lustigen Humor, dass aber leider viel zu kurz ist. Es ist wohl eher für Kinder gedacht.  
7.8 / 10 Punkten

author: {'steamid': '76561198051289813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1410896296}
review:
Have you ever considered a Monster's life? Have you wondered perhaps, just what are Humans to Monsters, and why are Monsters so monstrous to us?
Well, I haven't, therefore the subject piqued my interest.

"Monster loves you" turns out to be a funny and enjoyable game, with simple and easy on the eye graphics, but it's rather short. You won't play long, unless curiosity about all possible endings (not all of them easy to get, mind you - the game might be simple, but one has to think a bit to get all the achievements ;)) will get the better of you. Gameplay offers you quite many possible adventures, choices and routes in which to steer the fate of Monsters and Humans.

It might not be a revolutionary title, but if cartoon-ish graphics, bit creepy and silly sense of humour, or choosing your own adventure appeals to you, consider playing "Monster loves you".

author: {'steamid': '76561197962971695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1414106728}
review: Whilst good storyline and well presented. You don't really do anything apart from pick boxes, and the "moral" choices are just obvious +3 something / +5 something else / -2 something else. Repeat over and over and finish. No replayability, cannot recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021960977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1465850187}
review:
Bought on a whim during a sale, this is a lovely, charming casual game that I recommend, perhaps not at full price but definitely on sale.

It is quick to play from start to end, with less than an hour for a completion from monsterling to elder, however due to the nature of the game it has a lot of replay value. The format is all choices based on presented situations, which the result will increase or decrease various stats. I found it easy and intuitive to guide the play towards the monster I wanted to be without too much thought.

This isn't a title to sink your teeth into, but for short sessions in a beautifully created world, it is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994979446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1410684894}
review: Not at all what i was expecting. I wouldnt recomend it. Its short unless you go for achivements. Its only text and not really any graphic except stills, and even then you dont get to look at them all properly due to the deisgn of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970674841', 'num_games_owned': 2091, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1409731341}
review:
(8/10)

Cute little game in the sit back and poke at things idly type of vein.  The execution is very tight and it has quite a good bit of polish and good writing.  The main thing holding it back for me was the relatively short duration combined with a fair bit of diminishing returns when it comes to replay value.  There are a number of endings you can get but the overall play throughs didn't vary enough to really keep me going on it. Still, it is worth a go if you like cute little interactive fiction type deals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013842167', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1477716023}
review:
United humanity and monster kind by licking candy wrappers, scribbling on devious human plans, making super strong coffee, and performing neurosurgery 


good game/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025423933', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1410565285}
review:
So this is a cute - albeit slightly shallow game - that is fun for the first...three or four playthroughs, though the shine tends to wear off after a little while. If you're a fan of choose-your-own-adventure games it's in line with the genre, though I've seen others with a bit more depth. 

I'd recommend this one to kids (since it's basically rated PG) and adults who aren't looking to put a lot of brainpower into the endeavour...and anyone who'd like to knock out 14 achievements in a weekend, since that's not too much of a stretch (especially with the awesome guides floating around out there). 

Pros
- Cute graphics
- Intuitive menus
- Achievements are slightly addictive

Cons
- Fairly basic storylines
- Play gets repetitive quickly
- Not much diversity in monster forms

author: {'steamid': '76561198030062387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1458507021}
review: Knuffige Illustrationen, witzige Abenteuer, ein unterhaltsames, kurzweiliges Spiel. Nur nicht so leicht, alle möglichen Enden zu erringen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996470909', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1410205452}
review: This was surprisingly fun to play, especially when trying to get all the endings. Nice, relaxed game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128788858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1582493514}
review: This is a 'choose-your-adventure'-style monster-raising game... but I found it as useful and entertaining as a virgin at an orgy. This is worse than SNES-era games that came out when movies did. Wouldn't recommend buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048867832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1415392720}
review:
The game promises you can make "decisions that affect the world of Monsters and Humans." but none of your monster's decisions in life carry over once they finally reach the end of it.  This game could have been promising if, Crusader Kings style, when playing as a monster born after the previous one the impact of the previous monster could be felt, but every time you start as a new monster, it is as though you had never played the game before.  The game teases social changes in monster society, but since the game never advances forward in time, it's all just window dressing, as no matter what everything will be reset once your current monster dies.  Given that each playthrough is extremely brief, the result is a shallow experience.  Most of the endings are basically stamps for finishing a brief runthrough with a monster who had a certain combination of stats.

Your choices in the game affect your monster's personality, but your monster's personality stats do not have much effect overall.  As far as I can tell, when you begin a new game you get a randomly selected monster image to act as your monster's avatar.  Unfortunately, unlike other monster raising games (like the genre-creating Tamagotchi, cutting age software from the year of our lord 1998) your monster's personality and disposition do not affect its appearance.  Your monster's personality stats affect skill checks in the "Elder" segment of the game, and in a few places before, but once you get to the Elder segment the game allows you to choose your best stat for use in skill checks, meaning you will pass every one that you attempt.

Another complaint is that the game features a few recurring characters, but events show an image of a generic monster whose emotion is meant to represent the emotional energy of the scene.  It would have been nice for these images to show the recurring character that is involved in the scene instead.  

This game has a lot going for it - the art is fun and the interface is fine.  The monster society has some fun ideas behind it.  But unless the game can get more interactive, I cannot recommend it to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046609405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1440746581}
review:
I love this game, and I like how there are lots of random adventures your lil' monster can go on. I have only gotten 3 endings so far and can't wait to find the rest.

Also, This game has some really deep moments I was not expecting.
"You body Dissolves. You are now a dream of Kindness."
Fucking D'aww.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999390811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1409815785}
review:
There's about 4 hours of gameplay here, and that's with playing the same 40 minutes 10 times to gether different endings.

Definitely not worth more than 99 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104919944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1410126971}
review: Erwartet hab ich mir ein nettes, kleines Adventure für zwischendurch. Bekommen hab ich in etwa ein interaktiv gemeintes Bilderbuch (anders kann ichs nicht zuordnen). Man kann sich nicht umsehen, man interagiert nicht, muss nicht strategisch denken. Dazu kommt, dass es auch keine tolle Grafik, oder gute Story hat. Eigentlich ist das "Spiel" eine Abfolge von Fragen mit jeweils 1-3 Antwortmöglichkeiten vor sich wechselnden, aber an sich statischen Hintergründen. Unglaublich langweilig und nicht mal 1 Euro wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148913444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1409704309}
review: Got this game figuring it was going to be a charming break from more up beat games. Unfortunately this game is quite the snoozer. The whole game is text based adventure (read&click), no interaction otherwise between characters or environment.  Could not keep myself entertained with this game. You'd be more content reading old goosebumps books.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108223735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1410072798}
review:
A very well done "Build your adventure by making choices" game.

The game in summary is you as the player controlling the monsterling from birth to its adulthood.The game requires you to stop, read and think to let you achieve what you want to be as a monster. To be feared, to be respected, to be looked down and much more.  The choices are very obvious like to either help out someone, to mess it up for that someone or to EAT that someone. I know, sounds exciting isnt it? XD

The achievements are pretty good too, require you to play the game multiple times to get different endings and can take quite a few hours to complete it.

The game is still pretty short, but im not complaning. I still enjoy it very much.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034315837', 'num_games_owned': 7685, 'num_reviews': 758, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1409951574}
review:
It's a nice charming game you can play with your kid or your niece or nephew... that's kind of cool. If you like cute choose your own adventure storybooks with some sim aspects you might enjoy this sans the kids as well.

Game grows on you before it wears out its welcome and it's cheap. Get if it you like it's type.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032049873', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1549010772}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010047857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1390576048}
review: Monster Loves You ist weniger ein Spiel, mehr eine interaktive Geschichte. Beschränkt auf kurze Situationen in Form einer Erzählung und darauf basierenden Entscheidungen, wie mit der Situation umzugehen ist, entwickelt sich Monster zu einem Menschenfreund oder nicht. Was nettes für zwischendurch :) Bestimmt was schönes für Kinder :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198018589819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1422561931}
review: Really fun, different every time you play. I feel constantly encouraged and inspired to gain all of the unique achivements and make every ending occur. I'm reminded of how my money was well spent every time I play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043132404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1409771874}
review: Honestly, i got this in a sale for £1, i have played it for an hour so far and i have to say its definitely worth it, i will be replaying it and try to go down a new path of evil! Very replayable, i recommend this to someone who's just looking for a quick new game to take their minds off of something! 7/10 (just because i wish the story was a little bit longer)

author: {'steamid': '76561197966533518', 'num_games_owned': 1247, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1409972539}
review: A quiant little text based choose-your-adventure game. Zero gameplay. Just dialog/action choices. I didn't find the artwork interesting at all. The soundtrack is cute. It's a short game, something like 45 minutes, and they expect you to replay it multiple times to try and cover multiple personalities over the course of multiple monster lives, just to see what happens. It's a silly game, and frankly wasn't worth $2.50. If it was ever like a buck, perhaps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023380471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1411154548}
review: Oui mais... c'est un jeu sous forme d'histoire, dans une logique éducative, je dis oui à 100%, c'est un bon moyen de travaillier son anglais en s'amusant. Pour le coté ludique, je suis plus réservé. C'est sympa mais... sans plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031493561', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1409790250}
review: Very cute little game with tons of charm. It has loads of replay value thanks to the multiple outcomes of your choices which help shape your monster and the world around you. While I don't believe it's worth the $10 price tag, do pick it up if it goes on sale. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038481417', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1410377947}
review:
Avventura testuale (no, non ci si picchia o si salta, ragazzi) da un'oretta e qualcosa a partita, adorabile, con un sacco di finali alternativi da ottenere. Ogni decisione da o toglie punti al personaggio e porta verso i diversi "endings".
Decisamente piacevole, ma consiglio comunque di provarlo durante i saldi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097627226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1527336170}
review:
A cute, relaxing little game. There's not much to the storyline: This is a simple text-based Choose Your Own Adventure that allows you to roleplay through a limited number of story endings. The actions are light-hearted, and each choice can be easily "fixed" or negated if you're unhappy with its result. It's good for a laugh. 

The calming music is honestly the best part. This may be a good game for people with anxiety who need a quick distraction at night. It doesn't take much attention of commitment to play, so it's easy to spend a few minutes clicking through the story and letting the music do its work.

$9.99 is a rather steep price tag for such a simple game, though. I'm glad that I bought this on sale and only shelled out $2.50. It wouldn't have been worthwhile to spend any more money than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013999769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1410061453}
review:
In a word Monster Loves You is delightful.

It's an old school "choose your own adventure story" with an interactive twist.  Your monster earns trait points and respect for the things they do and how they choose to approach them--and sometimes you choose poorly.

A monster lifetime will take you about 30-60 minutes to play through.  Different scenarios will present themselves--some of which are referred to later on.  The stories are delightful.  They fit in to fairy tales and it's suitable for children--though there is a death component to the game.

The music is breezy and sets the mood.  The graphics are adequate for the kind of game it is.

I give it a strong 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977921372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1409849004}
review: its like The Walking Dead except with Cthullu?

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1411906939}
review: A pretty simple choose-your-own adventure/Visual Novel type of game with stat-tracking (and decisions/events that are sometimes affected by those stats. Nice for short playthroughs, multiple endings are nice to aim for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992830662', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1409882393}
review: Really simple and really fun text-based game. I Loved the style and the replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119743123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1409894644}
review:
這是一款像是看圖說故事的遊戲，每個問答都會決定你會成為怎麼樣的怪物。
他的畫風很有趣，相當有情境，除了文字敘述外，搭配整個故事的背景，真的會猶如在故事裡面般
算是蠻有趣的遊戲，可能比較適合玩靜態遊戲的人玩

總結：這就是本故事書，屬於你自己創造出來的故事，說明著怪物的精彩生活。

（裏面還蠻多單字的，可以充分在這款遊戲裡補充到）

author: {'steamid': '76561198002638206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1619133901}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a charming text based, choose your own adventure game. You live the life of a monster, from conception to old age (if you make it that far!).  The game has 14 possible endings, all with their own achievements. Each stage of life offers you different, randomized scenarios. These plot points can add or subtract points to your personality traits and overall village respect rating. 

Two hours in, and five monster lives lived, I find myself impressed with the number of scenarios that exist in the game. I keep coming upon ones I haven't seen before in all of the different stages of life. I feel as if I'm truly a different monster each time, which leads me to be pleasantly surprised by the replay value. 

$10 may be a little much for a game that requires nothing more than some clicking, but I would encourage anyone to pick it up during a sale. What kind of monster will you be? Will you dissolve into a vat of slime? Or will you lead a revolution? Either way, you'll have a fun time doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141783604', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1444664752}
review:
Monster? Das sind doch immer diese bösen Viecher, die uns Menschen Angst und Schrecken einjagen sollen, oder? Nun, wer weiß das schon so genau, aber das Spiel Monster Loves You!, das bei Steam erhältlich ist, lässt uns tiefer in die Welt eines Monsters blicken als uns vielleicht lieb ist - denn in Monster Loves You! schlüpft man tatsächlich selbst in die Haut eines Monsters. Und wie sich dieses seltsame Spiel spielt, verraten wir euch in einem kurzen Test.

Das Schwimmen in der Ursuppe

Monster Loves You! beginnt jedes Mal ganz am Anfang. Das bedeutet, dass ihr jedes Mal als kleines Monsterschleimchen mitten in der Ursuppe beginnt und euch dort bereits behaupten müsst. Hier genügt es, wenn ihr einfach den Antworten folgt und euren Charakter formt. Anschließend könnt ihr wachsen und in den Kindergarten gehen. Das Spiel selbst ist übrigens in Tagen unterteilt, im Kindergarten verbringt man acht Tage, diese verstreichen allerdings, wenn ihr Aktionen ausführt.

Im Kindergarten geht es dann los, dass ihr auf verschiedene Abenteuer geschickt werdet. Diese sind dahingehend wichtig, damit ihr eure Charaktereigenschaften Ehrlichkeit, Mut, Freundlichkeit, Cleverness und Grausamkeit steigern könnt. Habt ihr diese auf einem hohen Level, fallen euch spätere Entscheidungen wesentlich leichter und ihr könnt euch besser durchsetzen. Im späteren Spielverlauf müsst ihr euch dann auch noch Respekt erarbeiten, sodass ihr die Möglichkeit habt, ein Ältester zu werden. 

In Monster Loves You! durchlebt ihr so die verschiedenen Lebensabschnitte eines Monsters und könnt am Ende auch noch dafür sorgen, wie sich das Verhältnis zwischen den Monstern und den Menschen entwickelt. 14 unterschiedliche Enden stehen euch dabei zur Wahl, die ihr ganz allein durch eure unterschiedlichen Antworten bestimmt.

Gib mir mehr Gameplay

So interessant wie das Spiel nun vielleicht klingen mal, so abwechslungsarm gestaltet sich das Spielkonzept. Es gibt genau ein einziges Spielelement im gesamten Spiel, das durch unglaublich viele Alternativen abgewandelt wird. Jedes Mal, wenn ihr zum Beispiel auf Abenteuer geht, wird euch eine Situation geschildert und ihr müsst eure Antwort aus vorgegeben Antworten wählen. Dies hat dann Auswirkungen auf euren Respekt, eure Charaktereigenschaften oder die Beziehungen zwischen Menschen und Monstern. 

An einigen Stellen im Spiel wäre es sogar angebracht gewesen, kleinere Minispiele einzubauen. Zum Beispiel werdet ihr zu einem Brettspiel herausgefordert, könnt aber auch nur entscheiden, ob ihr beispielsweise das Brett abfackeln oder euch abwenden wollt. Das ist sehr schade und nimmt dem ganzen Konzept ein wenig den Reiz. Dennoch ist selbstverständlich der Reiz vorhanden.

Ein Monsterleben dauert in etwa eine Stunde, wenn man sich Zeit lässt für die Entscheidungen. Das bedeutet, dass ihr auch mit deutlich weniger Zeit durchs Ziel gelangen könnt. Schon allein deswegen verfügt Monster Loves You! über einen ganz besonderen Reiz, der einen immer dazu veranlasst, schnell noch eine Runde zu spielen und zu schauen, wie sich das Ganze denn nun am Ende auswirkt. Ärgerlich wird es dann erst, wenn man nur noch ein Ziel zur Komplettierung benötigt. 

Bugfrei!

Wer hätte das gedacht, aber durch das wirklich einfach Grafiksystem ist Monster Loves You! absolut fehlerfrei, zwar auch animationslos, aber immerhin. Im Grunde habt ihr es mit einem sehr simplen Zeichentrickstil zu tun, der allerdings wirklich sehr einfach ist, da nur ein paar Hintergründe erstellt wurden. Auch hier wäre ein wenig mehr Abwechslung und Bewegung wünschenswert, denn alle Hintergründe sind statisch und bewegen sich nicht. Es gibt ähnliche Spiele, da huscht dann wenigstens mal ein Hase übers Bild oder dergleichen mehr, damit es nicht ganz so langweilig wirkt. Auch hier wäre Abwechslung wünschenswert gewesen. 

Auch im Sound kann sich Monster Loves You! nicht wirklich behaupten, denn dieser wiederholt sich ständig und wird nur mit plumpen Geräuschen, die Monster wohl so von sich geben, untermalt. Das wirkt am Anfang passend, nutzt sich jedoch sehr schnell ab und wandelt sich zum Einheitsbrei. Sehr Schade. Es wäre wirklich besser gewesen, wenn sich die Entwickler ein ganz kleines bisschen mehr Mühe gegeben hätten.

Und, sind die Monster einen Blick wert?

Monster Loves You! ist ein niedliches kleines Spiel, über das sich nicht allzu viel sagen lässt, aber das dennoch seinen Reiz hat. Im Grunde schlüpft ihr in die Haut eines Monsters und folgt seinem Leben, dabei liegen alle Entscheidungen, die nicht das Wachstum betreffen, bei euch. Ihr könnt beispielsweise dazu beitragen, ob die Menschen noch mehr Angst vor Monstern haben oder ob eine Freundschaft möglich ist. Die Entscheidungen selbst trefft ihr dabei, in dem euch eine Situation geschildert wird und ihr zwischen vorgegeben Antworten wählen könnt, wie ihr reagieren würdet. Dank 14 unterschiedlichen Enden sind die Entscheidungen recht komplex, sind jedoch nicht immer gleich offensichtlich.

Monster Loves You! ist auf jeden Fall einen Blick wert, wenn man ein Spiel für zwischendurch sucht, da die einzelnen Runden nie wirklich lange dauern. Eine Runde dauert etwa zwischen 30 und 60 Minuten und ist somit schnell zu absolvieren. Falls ihr dennoch mal nicht viel Zeit habt, könnt ihr einfach zwischendrin aufhören, es speichert automatisch euren Fortschritt. Neben der interessanten Art des Spiels ist es ansonsten allerdings sehr abwechslungsarm, da man keinerlei Minispiele oder etwas in der Art eingebaut hat und sich sogar so der Sound sehr schnell abnutzt. Sehr schade, denn hier wurde definitiv jede Menge Potential verschenkt, was leider auch Abzüge in der Wertung kostet. Dennoch ist Monster Loves You! ein sehr interessantes Spiel, das sich lohnt, vielleicht nicht zum Vollpreis von 10€, aber mal als Schnäppchen ist es ganz gut geeignet.

Gesamtwertung: 78 Punkte
Mehr auf www.gamers-palace.de

author: {'steamid': '76561198123301750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1410719597}
review:
This is a great interactive choose your own adventure kind of game, you start out in a vat of ooze and work your way up through life, pretty fun and you can choose who you want your monster to be. You could be the tough nasty monster that does whatever he wants, or you could be a kind and gentle monster that helps other monsters out.

I would also like to say that well it is a great game, I don't think it is worth 10$, maybe more around 5$

Pros
-Fast download
-Stories are well written
-Cheap(If you got it on sale)

Cons
-Little Pricey(If you got it for the normal price)
-The Icons are sometimes a little irelivant
-Limited Replay value
Over all I would give it a 7/10. I would love to see DLC for this game ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198040528105', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1409827784}
review: Monster Loves You is such a charming little game, a text-based Choose Your Adventure game with hundreds of choices and multiple endings depending on the choices you make. It's short and sweet with a ton of replay value. Maybe I'm just a cheapskate, but I don't think it's worth 10 euros. I bought it for 2.50 and enjoyed it. It's charming, it's funny, it's silly, a great pickup if you like Text Adventures (I personally don't, but this is an exception).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008592378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1666432261}
review:
It's a cute game. I would play this with a child. We would learn a lot in how to get along with others and for that I have a positive view of Monster Loves You! For a parent, this is probably a good game to play with their children.

But it is far too short to justify a $10 pricetag. There is simply not enough content to justify it. 

Another thing worth considering is that your actions, generally, provide few negative consequences. You would have to actively seek out the worst possible answer to even reach the worst endings within this game. There is simply no challenge, though in retrospect, that may have been the point. 

However, given the lack of content, this only serves to hurt the game instead of actually reinforcing the gaming experience, gaming being used very liberally in this situation.

I really do like this game. I appreciated the variety in the scenarios and the writing was very cute. However, there is simply not enough to do in this game and the things to do don't provide any measure of challenge. I found myself with most of stats being maxed out without any active consideration towards any stat but one. 

It was honestly harder for me to not get both Human and Monster relationships up to 100%. It just seemed like this was too easy and even though I'm not expecting something difficult on the level of some other Steam games, it just felt like this game was handing everything to me. 

So, sure, buy this game and play it with your kids. But, honestly, there could have been so much more and for that, I cannot recommend buying this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1439932914}
review:
The most recent choose-your-own-adventure, (primarily) text-based game I have played is Dark Scavenger. I was interested in this game after discussing it with my brother, who had seen a playthrough by YouTube personalities Game Grumps. A few days later, this game was the Steam Daily Deal.

If you like super casual gameplay, choose-your-own-adventures, and text-based games, then you will enjoy Monsters Loves You!

The game is extremely short - I completed one playthrough in less than 45 minutes. Keep in mind, however, that I read A LOT and can read considerably quickly. 

The aesthetics (like most other elements of this game) are fairly casual with a small pool of recycled pictures and text. The detail in the scenery is good, and your monster's appearance varies greatly and seems to be determined by the initial options you select. The music is suprisingly good, and the ending background music in particular adds a majestic, urgent feel to the gameplay. 

The controls just involve you to click, and the learning curve is minimal. There is no apprent tutorial, however, many of the options have a "help" button that you can click, allowing things to be explained without progressing the story - in dialogue options, this is usually presented as the top/first option (clicking it will provide you with additional situational information without continuing the story).

I have to stress that gameplay is extremely casual, and since this is a text-based game, you will have to really rely on your imagination to fill in the details. Readers interested in the theme will probably like this game, however, if you do not read regularly (especially for recreational purposes) you may find this game to be very boring. 

Almost every decision you make in the game will result in you obtaining (or even losing) different stat points like bravery, respect, ferocity, honesty, etc. For example, fighting a bear and winning may give you points in bravery, ferocity, and respect. Besides respect, every monster stat is represented on the bottom of the screen in the form of different icons, and you can click each one to give you additional information. You can level all stats to a maximum of 100.

The stats are important for the end-game, where many of your actions are dependent on your stat scores (ex: to successfully fught off an opponent you need a high bravery/ferocity rating). Furthermore, respect is extremely important for getting other monsters on your side, especially in political situations. While the "politics" element really interested me, remember that this is an extremely casual game, and the politicial intrigue is reflectively minimal. Most of the politics involves your interactions with both the human and monster communities, and the end-game (if you get that far) will add two new gauges - the "how humans view monsters" and "how monster view humans" meters (maximum value of 100). 

Respect is critical for the end-game, where your decisions will determine which particular ending you receive.

Each "phase" of the monster's life cycle is broken up, and you have a fixed amount of turns before you advance to the next stage of life. The last stage requires you to have a high respect rating and/or high character stats. 

During each "phase," you can go adventuring. I really liked this part, because you only have enough "turns" (represented by days) in each "phase" to go on adventures. When selecting an adventure, you must click on different icons to activate a mission - you are not given any information besides the pictures on each adventure icon. I loved this mechanic because it made things less predictable and also more exciting. I am not sure if the available adventures are randomized for each playthrough, but I have noticed that they can be different each time (it may depend on the initial options you pick right when you start playing).

For achievement hunters, you will have to do A LOT of playthroughs, since you need to unlock every possible ending. After doing enough playthroughs, you should be able to progress through the game fairly quickly, especially once each adventure icon becomes more and more familiar to you. 

That being said, it is very, very easy for you to become bored of this game if you try to get all the achievements in one (or few) sittings, since all of the decision tree consequences will be known to you. Instead, I strongly suggest you only do one playthrough per sitting, and try to spread the playtime for this game around to keep things fresh. Remember, there is A LOT of text in this game, so avoid it if you do not like reading.

For choose-your-own-adventure buffs and text-based game lovers, this casual game will fit very well in your libraries. For anyone not interested in those things, you might want to avoid playing this.

Recommend!

Cheers,
DJSF [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/djsfsroguereviews]@DJSF's Rogue Reviews[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198091814837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1671631428}
review:
相当有趣的养成游戏。
怪物一共有五项基本属性：勇敢，聪明，凶残，诚实，友好。不同的选项会让你走上不同的成长道路。
游戏一共分为四个阶段：幼儿，少年，成年，长者。前两个阶段基本是你的个人属性堆积时间，成年后可以积攒声望，如果成为了长者，则可以决定怪物族群和人类之间的关系和命运。
14个结局目前我打出了四个，可以说还是很愉悦的。价格也不贵，因此推荐一下。

author: {'steamid': '76561198024096210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1409783011}
review: Das Spiel ist kurz, aber entzückend. Man wird als kleiner Morsel geboren und das ganze Leben muss man Entscheidungen treffen. Ist man ein echtes Monster und verbreitet Angst und Schrecken unter den Menschen, oder sucht man Wege um mit den Menschen Freundschaft zu schließen, läuft aber Gefahr von den anderen Monstern verabscheut zu werden? Oder schafft man das Kunststück und versöhnt Monster und Menschen? Von mir gibt es eine glatte Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027316840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1409763903}
review:
So this is a stat based adventure game. There are different endings you achieve by boosting the right stats and making decisions. The art is lively but the majority of the game is text-based. The events that take place are randomized with each playthrough making it practically impossible to see every outcome. I feel that is a good thing.

The choices you make often give surprising results making it easy to construct your own highly personal narrative.

I particularly like the deceptively dense lore of the world. Different paths give you amazing insights into the nature of the monster species.

Compared to other games of its kind, it is very easy. There are no failstates nor do you have to keep track of laberynthine event trees. It is suitable for younger and/or inexperienced players. That said there is a fair amount of violence so discretion is advised.

Overall it is enjoyable, surprising and often touching with at least 5 hours of play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062997990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1409776147}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066154957', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1409948468}
review:
I had to pay DOUBLE for it as the copy I had in my steam inventory magically vanished. 
(Checked my trade history, nobody had used my account).

That aside, per playthough, it's usually an hour. First playthrough I managed to get humans and monsters to co-operate. 

You're given various options which fill meters of sorts that change the outcomes in the later games. 
It's got great replayability, as you can choose to be a good monster (helping people) or a bad one (snacking on little fat kids who are lost) and these options open up greater choices. 

It's a charming little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037271551', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1532200200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966185700', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1408841689}
review: A cute choose-your-own-adventure game. You play as a monster throughout its lifetime making decisions shaping how the monster's story goes. Nice relaxing music and atmosphere. It has a fun sense of humor about it as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012221863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1411547091}
review:
Okay, ever since this game was released I've been quite curious about it. In a nutshell, this short game (with good replay value) has you incarnate as a newly born monster. Through the choices you make you'll either grow up to be a respected elder leading both monsters and the scary humans to peace and prosperety or unleash armageddon on the puny fleshlings. You might dissolve before your time and thus contribute to the next generation of monsterlings.

Monster Loves You is definitely quirky, but also very enjoyable and without doubt unique. The artstyle is somewhere between cartoony and otherworldly while the music is catchy. Whatever choices you make, whatever sights you see, this game still has plenty more to show you thereafter. Get it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056558081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1409757857}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022576254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1626639704}
review:
Jogo fofinho, porém bobo.

Basta fazer diversas escolhas e ver como fica seu status de monstro no final, várias opções de finais para se chegar.

Parece ser mais para crianças do que adultos. A musiquinha é divertida. Vale como passa tempo. Se você não entende bem inglês provavelmente não vai curtir tanto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034261746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1554546461}
review:
This game is actually something absolutely different! I have never played something like that and I have to say:
It's totally awesome!
You're being a monster and you have to make decisions. And through these you'll become the monster you want... or don't want to be! Sometimes you die... :D But somehow it's okay. Not even a bit frustrating!
And I'm improving my English through gaming - that's great!
Who ever texted this game ... I HOPE YOU'RE PROUD OF YOU!
...because you really should be! You, Sir or Madam, are EPIC!
The humor is incredibly entertaining and extraordinarily outstanding.
Besides: the musical background is unobtrusive and enjoyable at once.
The graphics is cute and adorable, but not childish. Yet the monster's appearance is rich in variety.
With different decisions your monster looks different during it's lifetime.

Conclusion: LOVE IT!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198151429105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1410318233}
review: This is such an adorable little game! Every decision you make influences how your monster grows & develops. I really enjoyed the fact that I could change monster/human relationships, and the fourteen different endings will have me playing this over and over again. If you enjoy visual novels with lots of endings & cute graphics, you'll love this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058644382', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1434220632}
review:
Petit jeu narratif bien sympatique, dans lequel on fait évoluer un monstre de sa naissance a sa mort.

Votre monstre se construit en fonction de vos choix et le destin des monstres et humains en dépendront. Ainsi vous pouvez devenir super feroce et agressif pour aller fracasser tout se qui vous croiser, ou bien essayer d'être un "gentil' monstre loyal et serviable... 

Au final, il y'a plus d'une dizaine de fin différente, et les évenement sont généré aléatoiremenent a chaques partie. Donc vous aurez besoin de le refaire nombre de fois afin de voir les centaines de choix du jeu.

Seul mauvais point, c'est que le jeu est en anglais...
Même si l'histoire n'est pas très complexe, l'humour et certains passage demandent un assez bon niveau.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995239792', 'num_games_owned': 1521, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1409757561}
review:
A simple read and react adventure game with a cute style.

Very short but very enjoyable with a wide range of choices that can be made by the player as their character grows and matures amidst its fellow monsters.

For a warm and fuzzy monster loving adventure, go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022326399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1414960153}
review: Docela krátká ale roztomilá hra. Jestli znáte takové ty knihy, kde se podle vašeho rozhodnutí přemístíte na konkrétní stranu, tohle je přesně ono - něco jako legrační psychotest. Grafika je krásná. Získat všechny achievementy přecijen pár hodin zabere - při prvním dohrání jsem získala 1 (jeden ze 14 objevených konců).

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 1027, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1409734291}
review:
몬스터 인생극장. -그래! 결심했어!-

각 상황에서 선택하는 그 선택 하나하나가 이후 선택지에 영향을 미치고, 각 능력치의 상승/하강을 유발하고, 결국 이런 과정이 쌓이고 쌓여 스토리의 흐름을 좌우하게 된다. 유년기에는 다섯가지의 기본 능력치 관리가, 청소년기에는 주로 '신뢰도' 관리가, 성년기에는 인간과 몬스터간의 관계도 관리가 중요한 게임. 이것들에 의해 게임의 흐름이 변하게 되며, 청소년기까지 기본 능력치 관리를 제대로 하지 못하여 성년기로 넘어가는 테스트를 통과하지 못 할 경우 몬스터 풀의 양분 신세가 되어버리기도 한다. (일부러 성년기로 가지 않고 몬스터풀에 용해되는 것도 가능하긴 하다.)

성년기의 경우 몬스터와 인간의 관계도를 통해 엔딩이 결정되는데, 이 때 서로의 호감도를 상승시키기 위해 이전에 쌓아두었던 다섯 능력치가 중요하게 작용한다. ......만, 성년기가 되기 위해선 보통 능력치가 좋아야 테스트 통과하기 수월하기 때문에 여기까지 왔으면 보통 분쟁유발보단 평화주의 엔딩을 보는 게 훨씬 쉬워진다. 호감도 상승폭이 감소폭보다 훨씬 크고. 역시 러브 앤 피스, 평화가 최고시다.

한 번 플레이하는 데 시간이 15~20분 정도로 많이 짧으나, 여러 번 플레이를 통해 각종 상황을 이리저리 구경할 수 있다는 점 때문에 플레이 타임이 짧은 것이 도리어 장점이 된다. 더불어 각 플레이 때마다 선택할 수 있는 상황도 조금씩 바뀌므로 플레이마다 나름 이것저것 선택해보는 재미도 있다. 각 상황별로 확률이 존재하기 때문에 가끔 테스트 불합격해서 내 몬스터가 녹아내릴 땐 조금 씁쓸하긴 하지만, 보통은 능력치가 높으면 대개 성공하기 때문에 크게 걱정하지 않아도 되는 부분.

이 짧은 게임 안에 나름 몬스터로써의 희노애락을 전부 넣어놨다. 나름 훌륭한 영어교재이며, 잔잔한 유쾌함을 보여주는 썩 괜찮은 게임.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/220112333359

author: {'steamid': '76561198030926737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1409709304}
review: This is a cute game, not high action (the entire game is reading text and clicking options), but cute and relaxing. It is however fairly short; if you go for all of the endings/achievements, it will only take about 5 or 6 hours. After the first couple of times through it if you are just aiming for all of the endings you can basically speed click through all of the text as you won't be seeing anything new. I'd still recommend it, but not at the full price. I bought it on sale and it was worth the $2.50 I spent, and if it was say $5 I'd say it's also worth that much, but I personally do not think it's $10 worth of entertainment. Nab it on sale and have a few hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067571463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1409868623}
review:
This is certainly quite an adorable game! The artwork brings together a fantastic mood of cheery yet still ferocious monsters. I have had a lot of fun playing up through interesting decisions that don't always end up the way you expect, but still give a result that is readily believable. Monster Loves You! offers a good time of easy and fun gameplay that is suitable for most ages. 

If you're looking for a calmer game to unwind with, this is what you're looking for!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064156757', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 42554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28876, 'last_played': 1670847092}
review:
Live the life of a Monster, from birth to elderhood and beyond, making decisions that affect the world of Monsters and Humans. 

You live in the village of Omen, and your favorite snack is the fingers of small children. As a Monster, you pop up in the most interesting places — what do you do when three angry bears discover a young child in their cabin? Or when you spy a wolf hunting down that woman with the red cloak? 

As a Monsterling, your choices are simple ones. Do you chase those poor little mice (+1 Ferocity) or protect them from the dogs (+1 Kindness)? Do you come clean about that fungus your friends ate (+1 Honesty) or cover for them (+1 Bravery)? As a youth, your choices determine your personality. 

But all youngins must grow up. Monsters and Humans have been at odds for centuries, and there are Human villages on the other side of the enchanted woods. When Human children get lost in those dark and winding thickets, do you terrorize them for fun (+1 Ferocity)? Do you help return them to Human civilization to prove that not all Monsters are to be feared and hated (+1 Kindness)? Or do you fatten them up for Human foie gras — a Monster delicacy? All this, to the backdrop of increasing tensions between Monster- and Humankind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045526298', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1482856655}
review:
This is a cute text-based game, and I typically enjoy this genre (Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is my all-time fave). Unfortunately, this game is short, and there are choices, but the choices are fairly leading. I played through twice and the game doesn't change at all; with the only difference being if you are able to acend to the final stage or if you dissolve after adulthood. When you finish and receive an "outcome" the game slots the outcome into a wheel (you can see these empty spaces on the beginning screen). Perhaps something interesting happens once you've earned every outcome, but I won't spend the time it would take to figure that out. After the second playthrough I find this game to be exceptionally tedious. 

I recommend this game for achievement enthusiasts and people who enjoy short, mindless games (don't get me wrong, I like mindless games too when I'm feeling lethargic and want to relax). The length of this game makes it a pretty big no for me though. ~30 mins per playthrough, at most. Once you get into the game and play it through a seventh time, you'll probably go much, much faster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048733149', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1421697461}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031791338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1448550474}
review:
Breve análisis: Para entender este juego hay que saber ingles, para disfrutarlo hay que saber disfrutar de un buen cuento, que trata sobre un mónstruo al que tu vas dando personalidad y forma a traves de decisiones, y que de vez en cuando te plantea situaciones de cuentos clasicos (Hansel y Gretel, los 3 cerditos, etc), decidas lo que decidas el juego siempre tiene un final (bueno o malo para ti, para los otros monstruos, para los humanos, etc); hay catorces finales diferentes, para que os hagais una  buena idea de la de veces que podeis llegar a jugar para verlos todos.

La unica cosa que podria destacar de negativo en este juego es que simplemente se base en tomar decisiones, alguna tirada de dados, y que no halla sido traducido a ningún otro idioma; esto último, seguramente, hubiera hecho del juego algo más conocido y popular, o eso pienso yo.

Con todo, si sabeis inglés, quereis probar a jugar a un juego que os recuerde a aquellas novelas de elige tu propia aventura, pero con la temática de "yo soy el mónstruo", pero con un enfoque de cuento para niños,  este es vuestro juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044053079', 'num_games_owned': 1186, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1409795829}
review: This game is just adorable. I love the writing and how perfectly it builds an atmosphere of wonder, and I love all the personality options you can mess with. This is way better than Vlad the Impaler, a similar choose your own adventure game. You actually can make your own story here, instead of just gaining stats randomly and hoping you can beat the final boss, which just leads to a slight variation of the same ending. It's worth the ten bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971011821', 'num_games_owned': 19174, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1397215607}
review:
I think i should write at least a short thing about this game, because it truly deserves it =)

Its a kind of "Build your Adventure" story game in which you raise your own monsterling from birth to adulthood. It involves quite some good reading and humor. The game gives you lots of choices, like "save the monsterling - or eat it", which in progress develop your character and the storyline.

Besides the many small story bits, its not overly complex, but its very entertaining.

The Achievements are fun to hunt down and you will need to play through the game several times to get them all. Generally the game has plenty of replayability with its varied small stories, so that is not too much of an issue. I played it several times over and still find new ones. A playthrough shouldn't take more than an hour i guess, maybe less.

If i had to criticize something, then its probably that its not very long, but i guess that's the way the game was designed, its not meant to be a complex long thing, more something easy to play in between.

And i would have loved to be able to design the looks my own monsterling, sadly the game doesn't give that option, i think its random how your monster will look like.

Technically the game is solid, no bugs or anything that i would have to mention.
Also i totally dig the artstyle, but thats personal preference =)

It also has the best emoticons, so thanks for that. 
( :hee::ooh::hmm::blech::grr: - they dont work in this Review post )

Conclusion: This is a very fun small charming game worth to be played =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997889189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1398942477}
review: Skvělá, vtipná a na některé achievementy složitá adventura. Hráč je vtažen do role příšerky, před kterou osud staví neustále různá rozhodnutí, aby nakonec zpečetila svůj osud v jednom z mnoha konců. To si pak řeknete: "Sakra, proč jsem se nerozhodnul jinak"? A pustíte hru znova. Nepřeberné konce (a některé hodně rychlé) Vás udrží neustále ve hře. Až nakonec zjistíte, že jí máte úplně dohranou. Je to prostě taková velmi příjemná oddychovka, kterou Vám doporučuji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029928832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1543368163}
review: Cute little text based choose your own adventure. Very short playthrough, replay value is okay, about as much as you'd expect a text adventure to be. Graphics are funny and well done, music is nice if a bit repetative. I wouldn't say it's worth $10, but I paid a tf2 key for it and definitely got my money's worth there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996786363', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1411916644}
review:
A very cute game! I really should play more on this to get all the various endings...

You play a monster that is born in a monster colony, and not only your own fate, but the fate of all monsters (and humans) depend on your choices. Will you be good? Bad? Strong? Smart? It's all up to you.

If you like choose your own adventure type of games, this is a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042652933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1590169223}
review: Insgesammt ein interessantes Spiel, besonders wenn man es zum ersten mal bis zum Schluss spielt. Interesannte Story und schön gezeichnet. Aber blöd, dass es komplett auf englisch ist. Ne Version auf deutsch wäre gut. Nach einigen Malen wird zudem etwas eintönig. Weegen dem Englischen lese ich mir das meiste auch gar nicht mehr urch. Jedenfalls mal einen Kauf wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080789587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1375720720}
review: Sødt lille tekstbaseret spil uden den store aktion eller grafiske fyrværkeri. Mange forskellige "endings" alt afhængigt af hvilke valg, der træffes i løbet af spillet. Ikke noget, som jeg decideret vil give et thumbs down til men jeg er heller ikke udpræget begejstret.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035600743', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1407505985}
review:
Wirklich nettes Spiel.

Pro: klasse Story, nett erzählt mit charmanten Grafiken
Kontra: Wiederholt sich relativ schnell, keine Sprachausgabe (wer nicht gerne ließt wird dieses Spiel hassen), Preis

9,99€ ist meiner Ansicht deutlich zu teuer, man sollte auf jeden Fall auf einen Sale warten.
Trozdem empfehlenswert, weil man merkt, dass es mit viel Liebe designed wurde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037686796', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1599192333}
review: Monster Loves You! is okay, but [i]just[/i] okay. After two runs you start to notice how repetitive it, if the game were longer it could be forgivable, but, if I can beat the game in about an hour and a half, so unless you have some money to burn, I can't in good consciousness recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087979217', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1501223428}
review:
Monster Loves You is a game that kids and adults can both enjoy! With an interesting variety of choices, the game allows players to choose a path for their monster. Some of the stats include: cleverness, ferocity, bravery, etc. Although game play may be limited to about less than a dozen hours, the amount of time spent to be reached the multiple endings is a reward enough. Every choice matters and this game teach this value toward its players. Bonus points goes to cute art and creativity!

Rating: 7.5/10 (75%)
Achievements: 9/14 (64%)
Game Done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001839688', 'num_games_owned': 2570, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1418407290}
review: This is a very interesting game indeed. Might seem a bit shallow at first and bland considering there's nearly no gameplay apart from picking answers to random questions but I still found myself emotionally invested in the game. It's just cute. The narration is for my taste very entertaining and funny. Like a choose your own adventure kind of thing. Not everything has to be about killing shit. Or is it... ? You decide. I just followed the goody two shoes path on my first run and I think it was fun without a doubt. Now for the evil that lurks in the monster vat...

author: {'steamid': '76561198039459251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1407284756}
review:
Monster Loves You...
Ich finde das Spiel großartig aber mehr dazu unten. JEtzt kommt erstmal eine Kleine zusammenfassung:
Monster Loves You ist ein ''neuartiges'' Text Adventure wo mann die Geschichte hauptsächlich mit dem Entscheiden per Text voranführt.
Pros:
+Hat an manchen Stellen einen Sehr Guten Soundtrack
+Hat eine Kleine aber Feine Story sie es Erzählt
+Sehr viele Enden (Hoher Wiederspielwert)

Contras
-Nur auf Englisch verfügbar
-Sehr viel Text (Wenn mann es am Stück dürchspielt)
-Eine ''Story/Spiel'' dauert nur ca 60 min

Fazit:
Ich habe mit Monster Loves You! bis jetzt nur ein Spiel verbracht werde aber auchnoch weiterspielen.
Wer also English relativ gut ist und auch noch am Lesen Spaß hat sollte sich Monster Loves You! auf jedenfall für 10€ Kaufen

author: {'steamid': '76561198054407476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1406677197}
review:
Not at all what I expected from the trailer but that's perfectly fine. I wasn't entirely sure my expectations were normal.

Gameplay is simple but charming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003576753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1405963240}
review:
I'm not sure if I recommend or not this game, but it has a big disadvantage so I press NO.
Here are my reasons:

+ Advantages
The game is cute, I really love the illustrations for the screens. It also reminds me the old rpg games where reading and choose your option and that leads you to a result or another, but much more visual. Maybe for children is ok, around 10-12 years old, or if you simply love the artwork. I simply bought it because I liked the visual aspect. It's also quite funny thanks to the the stories and situations.

- Disadvantages
Expensive for what it offers. It's completely static, you can't do anything to interact, just click the options, not even objects, and til now I only found one end, the rest of the time I just don't grow up and that's all. The price is that big disadvantage for which I pressed NO. I sincerely won't pay for it more than 3€.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023335443', 'num_games_owned': 7856, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1381417131}
review:
这是一个养成游戏，从一个怪物的出生是否要去咬靠近的小伙伴开始，由你决定怪物的成长方向，游戏没有什么可操作的空间，所有的游戏过程都是在文字选择中完成的，从一开始幼儿阶段，小怪物就开始发展勇气、聪慧、诚实等能力，这些能力逐渐会改变游戏进程，比如足够的聪慧能让怪兽在二难的选择中发现更好地，不够凶猛则使怪兽即使明白该怎么做也没法当上领导者来做出决定等等。待到怪兽长成，和人类社会接触，相互的关系又很微妙，不是靠属性就能决定的了，此时更需要玩家去谨慎分析，最终有十二种结局。

   这个游戏适合喜欢慢慢看文字进行脑力活动的玩家，可重复性非常高，其中的一些逻辑性和需要思考的东西真的很有意思，算是从怪兽的角度去理解事物吧。

   此外，还有一点对重复玩的奖励是，在成年之前，玩家可以选择不继续游戏，让怪兽融入先祖池中，这样他的属性会让下一代怪兽的初始属性有所提高，这就让玩家在重新开始游戏时获得了优势。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996935401', 'num_games_owned': 3485, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1404735489}
