author: {'steamid': '76561198057801593', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1404488531}
review:
A very simplistic text-based adventure game where you choose your reaction towards different scenarios to gain different properties like kindness, cleverness, ferocity, truthfulness etc. These determine the ending you will get and the choices you can make during the end of the game. 

Each monster "life" in Monster Loves You can be finished in less than 30 minutes. You can tackle different scenarios (which are various but do become repetitive) to get different results but in the end there is not much to this game. The art style is nice although it doesn't animate much at all and everything is pretty static. But the visual style and fonts are at least easy to look at. 

I can't say if this is suitable material for younger kids because it does have some rather violent imagery brought forth in some of the written scenarios but they never get too serious or morbid. 

I really don't see any more charm to it.

Cute? yes. 
Mildly interesting? yes. 
Passable? YES!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044566372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1642960923}
review:
It's a really nice litte game to pass your time and do things, you can't do on a normal day (like eating everything that doesn't run fast enough...) As for me, I'm having a hard time to be the bad guy... So the farious endings became a bit limited. Usally I start out fine, being angry, beating other monsterlings... but then... I end up helping the others *sigh* but it's still a lot of fun! I'm planing to play it with a friend, who can stop me from beeing nice. The grafic ist cute and colourfull, it runs very smooth, even on my old machine and in windowed mode. It really makes me smile to meet the well known personas from the fairytales... although eating little red riding hood ist like killing the last bit of childhood. But she was tasty!
Long story short: buy it, play it, have fun! If you aren't a bitter, angry, progress-orientated, goal-reaching-by-any-means-person, there is a high chance you will like this game. Who wouldn't be a Monster??

author: {'steamid': '76561198090880501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1375654066}
review: A fun little game that is great for killing an hour or two on, Monster Loves You! is also very child friendly and a great way to introduce the little ones to PC gaming. I totally recommend for anyone who has kids, or is young at heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974939698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1404270655}
review: A fun, humorous, and charming "choose-your-own-adventure" type graphic novel. The music and graphical style both fall under charming, while the story and your choices tend to be humorous, which both helped to make my playthroughs so far a fun experience. There are also stats that you can build up, which affect what appear to be rolls for the outcome of certain choices, and achievements to mark each ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060681083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1403291079}
review:
Wiederspielwert Nahe 0
Viel zu wenig Content

author: {'steamid': '76561198120633654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1420383754}
review:
It's an easy and colorful decisionbased short game. You start as a Morsel and evolve into a Monster and maybe - if you want - an Elder. For gamers who seek action and warfare, this game is not for you. If you enjoy a nice story with some twists, you'll like this one.

I liked the game, but I'd love to have more decisions to make. There are parts where you can not chose an answer and just have to click on and on and on ...
At first I thought I could create some kind of monster. You actually can't, because if you want to earn all achievements, you have to follow a certain path. As I said, a nice and easy game, but nothing extraordinary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044612861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1528749712}
review:
One of the cutest games I have played in a while. You really learn to love your little monster and empathise with their conflict with the humans. Not too long to complete and replayable due to the number of scenarios available. 
This is the game I turn to when I've had a bad day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067467873', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1390346330}
review: This game, as others have said, is adorable. I love the art and the "choose your own adventure" aspect of the game. However, if you want to reach each of the unique outcomes, be prepared for some serious repetition. This is a great game to play every few weeks or so, which kind of helps counteract that repetition that occurs if you play through it multiple times in rapid succession, like I did. (I really wanted to get the different endings!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974103321', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1371873981}
review: Not much of a point to it, and the endings and how I got there felt a disappointing. No challenge and not a good story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046052299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1420221968}
review: A very engaging, thought-provoking, and adorable text based game. It's fun through a whole bunch of playthroughs (I would know). It doesn't have a huge amount of content, but it's still a decent amount of fun for the price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045736635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1403346771}
review:
還好是半價買的...
雖然即使是半價也不值得
-
整個遊戲的概念是有趣的
你是一隻怪獸
從一鍋湯裡出生開始
你做出的所有決定都會影響你長成怎麼樣的怪獸
以及你會怎麼結束你的一生
-
遊戲內容實在太貧乏了
雖說有12個結局
但過程重複性太高
我只過了兩次就沒興趣再玩下一輪了
因為只要玩到第二次
你就會發現一堆重複的內容
基本上就是前期升數值
後期用你有升的數值的選項來做選擇
舉例來說
前期你很誠實 於是誠實數值很高
那麼後期就可以選以口頭說服人的方式
前期你就很暴力 於是暴力數值很高
那麼後期就直接用暴力讓其他怪獸聽你的
而兩者在最後並沒有差別...
你的怪獸本身並沒有個性
除了會看數值的少數特定選項之外
平時就算暴力數值低也不會讓你選擇殺死的選項失敗
至於怪物長甚麼樣子 就更一點關係都沒有了
-
說真的
就算1USD
這遊戲還是很雷

author: {'steamid': '76561198048949302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1403898014}
review:
Das Spiel ist ganz nett, aber ich hätte mir deutlich mehr davon erwartet. Zunächst einmal, es ist ein reines Textadventure mit hübschen Hintergründen in ausschließlich englischer Sprache und idealerweise sollte man native speaker sein, da die Vokabeln und der Satzbau nicht unbedingt umgangssprachlich verwendet werden.
Eine Runde dauert nicht lang und man schafft es locker in weniger als 1h. Wenn man alle Varianten und Spielenden durchhaben möchte (immerhin 14 Stück), dann braucht es halt schon deutlich länger, allerdings ist die Motivation schon nach dem 2. Durchlauf nicht mehr gegeben. Immerhin ist die Story halbwegs witzig (wenn man sie denn versteht), wenn es auch keinen durchgehenden roten Faden gibt, sondern immer nur Mini-Geschichten.
Fazit: Man muss das Genre mögen, dann hat man daran Gefallen, für alle anderen (insbesondere die, welche nicht so gerne viel lesen) nicht empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027450891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1387661335}
review: Monster Loves You! I recommend it if you like a “chose your own adventure” game. Learning about the monster world your character grows up in is interesting, the Monsters’ notions of humans are sometimes of course odd and funny. The only think that would have made it even a better game if it was just a little longer. But then again you can always go back and play it a different way and see what happens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016019211', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1375053144}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037485381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1368687600}
review: Very cute game, fun and entertaining with replay value. It is a decision based game, and there isn't much action. However, the story does play out with significant changes based upon the decisions you make.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032800685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1403294910}
review: Davvero adorabile questa avventura grafica il cui scopo è di impersonare un mostro dalla nascita fino alla fine, dal brodo primordiale alla vecchiaia, decidendone il carattere, la popolarità fra i suoi simili e anche come e quando morirà. Il tutto si svolge con divertenti vignette e basterà un click per scegliere tra le varie direzioni in cui guidare il vostro sgorbio: sarà una belva feroce che guiderà i suoi simili verso la guerra contro gli umani? o un pacifista diplomatico? o un pensatore? o un mediocre che non arriverà mai alla vecchiaia ma si scioglierà nello stesso brodo primordiale da cui è nato e nell'anonimato? A seconda delle vostre decisioni potrete ottenere finali diversi. Attenzione: gioco in Inglese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115271040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1433286288}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003956141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1403378096}
review: This is a very entertaining game. The artwork is well done and I enjoy playing out the multiple storylines by making various decisions. If you are a fan of making choices that affect your progress you will enjoy this; if you don't like reading then you will not enjoy this game as there are no voice overs and you have to read through everything. Overall it is a good game that is worth taking a look at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055021270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1403278171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062704489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1382159669}
review: This game is absolutely adorable. The story is fun and you have lots of different options to create any little monster you want. 3 thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991288710', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1460292480}
review:
A visual-novel-orientated, adventure game experience, whereby the actions and lifestyle of your monster are the results of the decisions you make for them.

- Think of it as...a bag coloured stones, and each stone gives you a different situation depending on which colour you pick. 

That's very similar to how you progress through your story, to result in many different endings.

Re-playability - great, definitely possible without getting bored.


- I completely adore the soundtracks in Monster Loves You. Definitely in my short-list of favourites.


- Goofy yet comically loveable art. 

Definitely worth a play if you enjoy visual-novels and have no problems with a high amount of reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140863863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1448229275}
review: Monster Loves You was absolutely not what I had expected. I wanted a cute little who went on aventures. I also wanted these adventures to be animated. I detested the fact that the entire game is text. There was very little to no animation. The ten dollars was absolutely not worth it.  I do think that this game can improve and be worth the price. It just needs graphics. Personally, I enjoyed the game but it lacks both graphics and hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071042609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1403066527}
review: Loved this game! I just got it and I laughed throughout it. It was awesome, and I can't wait to get all of the endings!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012124111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1404752786}
review: Though the game is cute and addorable, I wouldn't recomend buying it. The game itself is too short; As well, it's overpriced for what it truely is; a choose your own adventure story. Save $5 and go down to your local bookstore instead. If you really want to play it though, wait till it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022514956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1391133154}
review:
At first I thought that the game offered pretty much exactly what it advertised, but once I started my second playthrough I realized that the game plays out more or less the exact same way each time, and the story absolutely can't stand on its own. 

Long Live The Queen tries for about the same thing, but the difference is that that game manages to pull it of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089917790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1401239205}
review: Plays like a children's choose your own adventure book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002069654', 'num_games_owned': 1129, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1411061422}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a cute, whimsical and basically well done Choose Your Own Adventure kind of game, but it is entirely too short.

In each phase of the monster's evolution, the player faces a number of "challenges" where multiple choice answers slowly form the characteristics of the monster. If it helps others, the kindness stat goes up, if finds good solutions to problems, the cleverness attribute increases. if it flies right into battles with claws extended and teeth exposed, it becomes more ferocious, and so on.

In essence, this is the entire game. The graphics are well done and atmospheric, the dialogue is shallow but funny, with plenty of references, but there isn't much actual gameplay here and you'll be through in under two hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062321001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1399371778}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046781319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1400184212}
review:
I thought this game looked like a bit of fun and I was expecting some sort of gameplay other than just clicking on text to make a decision in what seems to be a game made to teach morals to young kids, if that is what it's intentions are i'd say it's good and kids would enjoy it but for anyone older not so much.

I just find myself completeing it over and over again bored of clicking on text just to get some easy acheivements, glad I didn't pay the full amount for it.

Wouldn't recommend for anyone say over 12 years of age, maybe younger.

If there was a neutral option rather than do you recommend? Yes or No then I would have placed this review as neutral as i misjudged the game and for young kids it probably is a bit of fun and gets their brains engaged a bit,

author: {'steamid': '76561198112112392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1501341319}
review: i like this game as a quick little thing to play when i get in from work whilst i'm making dinner. it's pretty and entertaining and strangely relaxing. i did a few different combinations but i find it very difficult to go against my instincts when choosing some answers so i don't get the same results every time. the art and music are great. I do like the style of this game. The only bad thing I have to say about it is that I wish there were far more ‘missions’ to pick from to make replay ever more varied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066636598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1543595433}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026775981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1389221713}
review:
While this game has some potential, it's really nothing more than an aggrandized choose your own adventure book. There's not even, as far as I can tell, any randomization to the game. As soon as you know your way through, you can get whatever you want, and there's not much to do but to get all the endings.

Might be worth getting if on a very good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004779678', 'num_games_owned': 1398, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1434743933}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a unique text-based game where you take control of a monster in the forest of Waelmist. The actions you take will affect your monster in many ways (Cleverness, Ferocity, Kindness, Bravery, Respect, etc.). After your adulthood, you can either choose to dissolve in the "Spawning Vat" and allow your greatest trait to carry on in the next generation of monster or ascend to the status of Elder monster. When you play as an Elder, you get to decide the fate of humans and monsters by taking more actions (talking with your fellow monsters or traveling to the human city), which I enjoyed. There are 14 endings to discover so you'll be playing this for hours.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007823333', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1383194361}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010404906', 'num_games_owned': 1246, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1386049926}
review:
The first video game I played was GTA3, all the way back in 2001, on the PS2. I didn't enjoy it very much (and still don't enjoy GTA-style games in general). The second game I ever played was much better - Age of Empires 2, on the PC. Why do I bring this up? Because it's important to note that I started playing video games well beyond the era of the text-based adventures and RPG's of the 80's. Which is important to note because Monster Loves You! is essentially a text-based adventure game, albiet one that doesn't require typing and has a graphical interface.

It's definitely a solid game, with a clearly defined goal that you're working towards, and it's probably the right length for a modern text-based adventure. The graphical interface is cutesy enough, and is very effective in capturing the player's interest. The game also successfully incorporates some clever RPG-like stat-building, with a series of stats that can be raised or lowered depending on the conversation options the player chooses. All these elements combine into a lighter game that will be enjoyed more by casual gamers than those that play more seriously.

Which is why I can't recommend this game; most people on Steam simply won't enjoy it for long enough to get their money's worth. While I enjoyed it, that was only for 51 minutes; I have no desire to play through the game again. That's not the fault of the game, moreso the fault of the genre. Gamers have simply moved on from the days of the text-based adventure, and now prefer their RPG stats to be accomponied by a 3-dimensional world that they experience through the eyes of a character they make. If you enjoy text-based adventures or more casual games, than this is a game that you'll get multiple hours of enjoyment from. Otherwise, the stat-building and graphical depiction of the story simply won't be enough to keep you captivated beyond the first playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069613176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1651217186}
review: 一款 美式的养成类游戏？画风个人觉得比较舒服，故事也不算很长，根据不同选择可以有多种结局，休闲的时候可以用来打发下时间非常不错的选择

author: {'steamid': '76561198010104535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1380064041}
review:
Had alot of suprises with this game for my first playthrough of it. This point and click title has alot of depth that I missed on my playthrough however, the depth that I did see with the decisions that you made within the game is clearly visible.

Alof of games give you that illusion of choice, however when you make decisions in this game they realy matter and you will see the effects of them. I would only say that the downside of this is the lack of supporting NPC dialogue mostly because I couldn't get attached to....anyone in this game.

I got to a part where I had to make a crucial decision (not spoiling the game) and I didn't care about the person I was saving, I was moreso concerned with my status in the game of being the ultimate peace-making monster.


Regardless, this game does its job and thats give an emotional but uplifting story in a short amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050370092', 'num_games_owned': 2700, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1380185479}
review:
Astazi vom vorbi despre Monster Loves You! un joc produs de catre Radial Games in colaborare cu Dejobaan Games, creatorii mai cunoscutului: AaAaAA!! – A Reckless Disregard for Gravity. Monster Loves You! Este un joc potrivit in special pentru copii, dar poate pune ceva probleme adultilor in explorarea tuturor posibilitatilor oferite de acest titlu.

Povestea

In Monster Loves You, vei controla viata unui monstru de la nastere si pana la moarte, iar actiunile si deciziile pe care le iei in joc vor afecta viitorul si existenta monstrilor in lume si convietuirea lor langa oameni.

Orasul in care se desfasoara actiunea la inceputuri se numeste Omen („semn” in engleza). Ca orice monstru, esti o fire independenta si rebela si vei fi obligat sa iei decizii din clipa care te nasti. Deciziile tale te pot duce la un sfarsit prematur sau te vor ajuta sa intri in „sfatul batranilor” si sa traiesti fericit pana la adanci batraneti. Actiunile tale vor afecta viitorul relatiei monstrii-oameni si, implicit viitorul tau. La fiecare inceput al jocului vei lua niste decizii care vor schimba soarta monstrului tau de la o incercare a jocului la alta, iar finalul este de fiecare data diferit.

Gameplay

Monster Loves You are un stil de joc unic, similar unei povesti interactive. Jocul se controleaza doar cu mouse-ul si tot ce trebuie sa faci esti sa-ti alegi o anumita misiune sau scenariu si sa iei deciziile pe care le doresti. Fiecare decizie contribuie la creionarea profilului tau. Ai 5 calitati de baza: Curaj, Istetime, Ferocitate, Onestitate si Bunatate. Fiecare decizie a ta va contribui pentru una din cele 5 calitati, iar echilibrul dintre ele iti va influenta relatia cu ceilalti monstri si durata de viata. Odata ajuns la maturitate va trebui sa aduni Respect din partea celorlalti monstri pentru a-ti asigura prelungirea duratei de viata si intrarea in randul inteleptilor.
Lipsa respectului si decizile pripite iti vor aduce moartea, insa nu e neaparat un lucru rau. Cand un monstru moare, se intoarce la locul nasterii si lasa o mostenire genetica neamului sau.

Daca reusesti sa treci in randul batranilor, vei avea o problema mare pe cap: relatia monstrilor cu oamenii. Deciziile luate de tine in aceasta perioada vor determina ceea ce se va intampla cu monstrii pe viitor: vor intra in razboi cu oamenii, ii vor invinge sau vor fi invinsi, vor face pace intre ei si vor invata sa convietuiasca, vor deveni animale de circ sau pur si simplu vor fugi. La fiecare incercare a jocului vei obtine rezultate diferite, iar cele 14 realizari STEAM disponibile pot fi atinse doar cu 14 finalizari diferite ale jocului, deci pentru a le obtine va trebui sa rejoci toata actiunea din nou, lucru care poate deveni plictisitor si intra in rutina. Aveti mai jos un video cu un gameplay complet pentru o realizare STEAM:


Jocul vine si cu carduri STEAM care pot fi adunate sau vandute pe STEAM market, un trend modern prezent pe toate jocurile noi.

Grafica si sunet

Monster Loves You are o grafica placuta, dar simpluta. Cum controlezi jocul doar cu mouse-ul poti sa nu observi anumite aspecte, dar mediul inconjurator este si el interactiv in unele locuri.

Sunetul este simplu, exista o singura coloana sonora, iar daca joci mult devine repetitiva si plictisitoare de multe ori.

Concluzie

Monster Loves You a reusit sa ma tina conectat 4 ore pana acum si imi va mai rapi cateva ore bune, pentru a atinge toate Achivementurile, in pofida asteptarilor mele cand am inceput sa ma joc. Odata inteleasa ideea, jocul te va prinde si vei avea o experienta placuta, asadar investitia de 7 euro se merita pentru Monster Loves You.

Sursa: [url=http://steamgames.ro/game-review/monster-loves-you-review-concurs/]www.steamgames.ro[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970128191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1392553705}
review:
A grudging recommendation...

Are you old enough to remember Alter Ego? The mid-eighties life-sim is a major influence over this quirky title.

Essentially entirely text-based, you click your way through multiple-choice scenarios, which determine the personality of your monster, as you guide it through the life-cycle. It's certainly charming, but quickly became dull, and didn't (to my mind) hold much replay value. There are some stats being tracked 'under the hood' and achievement chasers might care to spend time there, but for me a couple of playthroughs was more than enough. Younger players will probably revel in the fantasy, but it might be more wordy then their patience will stand?

The major CON compared to Alter Ego is that the events (or specifically, their outcomes) are even more random: the authors have tried to give 'Monster World' a consistent logic, but it can be pretty hard to second-guess. Perhaps life is like that?

author: {'steamid': '76561198025454883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1406704523}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a text-based choose your own adventure game. You guide your monster through stages of its life, your actions determining your monster's attributes, such as ferocity, cleverness, and bravery.

While each stage of life has multiple short adventures to take your monster on, they rarely influence each other, beyond some of them becoming easier depending on which 'stats' you've leveled up beforehand. It isn't until the latter of the game, which you may or may not reach due to your decisions in game, where you begin having an influence on anything beyond your monster village and the woods around it.

Monster society is darkly humour- black comedy abounds. You meet many different fairytale creatures and have an opportunity to try and befriend or viciously murder and eat all of them. The soundtrack and visuals are bright and cartoonish, and fit perfectly.

Each play-through will take you about twenty to thirty minutes, depending on how fast of a reader you are, and getting most of the endings is pretty intuitive. It's a good game to pass the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969417973', 'num_games_owned': 3033, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1391115499}
review:
This game is a bit different. Its a "Choose Your Own Adventure" kind of game were you play a monster that is growing up and evolving. Your choices effect what stats and such you gain, and they effect your dialogs and actions. It has an surprisingly large amount of dialog and details and I was overall impressed by the quality of the game.

There are 14 achievements in the game were each is awarded for one of the 14 outcomes of the game. This sadly makes the early parts of the games very repetitive since you need to do them 14 times at a minimum but probably many times more unless you do everything right every single time. Most outcomes are easy to achieve, and only one of them is really tricky but can be gotten with some patience and experimentation.

[b]Time to 100%:[/b] 6 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198048694896', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1453609883}
review: I usually don't like Point and Clicks or Text Based games, but this is an exception. During my first playthrough, I thought that this was going to be boring, but interesting, but after I finished the playthrough, I came to respect the game. I ended up thinking it wa fun and interesting, so I continued with my second playthrough, as this game has extremely extensive replayability. After I finished that playthrough, I began to see that this game can be really dark and violent. Really, you can't rate this game because it is so extensive that it is like playing a lot of different games. Its all about possibilities. Will you come to create everlasting peace between humans and monsters, or will you come to make endless war? This is not a game, it is a story book mixed with a piece of art.

review: Cute game! The mini stories are very charming, and I like the variety of choices and personalities you can have. The game is very short, though, and although it looks like there are a lot of endings, most of them are just different ways to fail the game. It's fun for a few hours, though. I'd recommend buying it, but probably not at full price considering the short play time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055083985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1388731769}
review:
Surprisingly difficult to rate this one: it's a standard point-and-click game, fairly short, with your actions throughout the game determining the result you get at the end. 
If you're using this for say, the 7-11 year old range, it might be workable; however, the various different endings (all of which unlock rewards on Steam) have maybe 2 "good" endings, and tons of other "horrible to varying degrees" endings, with no clear weight to them other than "I just got a different ending and a new Steam achievement. Hooray!" And by "horrible", I do mean "you have to choose the very meanest, most hurtful combination of options presented as actions you are personally deciding to do", which is why I feel it didn't really suit for a younger audience.
I feel it doesn't suit for an older audience, as it wasn't clearly defined just what the Monster race believed in and strove for as a whole: if I am just one of the race, what exactly have my elders and society set out as the norm for behavior? 
Like I said at the top: suprisingly difficult to rate this super-cartoony, goofy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044721479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1389552415}
review: This game is colorful in its own way. Its much like a virtual novel or a interactive story. You pick your daily actitives and gain points in various skills along the time. Those skills that you gain depend on how you do in various situtations throughout the entire game and determine if you die an old spinster monster, or a great warlord, or a human lover.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971430039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1383512236}
review:
Overall, Monster Loves You! was never going to capture the gaming audience that chews through shooters, but that wasn’t the target audience here. Whilst it’s easy to discount it as a child’s game, given it is based around a colourfully-lit interactive story, the truth is that the complexity of the narrative is as apparent or discreet as you allow it to be. You can take the time to think out your responses with an end goal in sight, or just haphazardly click on whatever sounds good at the time and get a result. With roots in storytelling and even text-based adventure games, Monster Loves You! is a charming and unique title that will take most gamers 30-45 minutes to play through, but getting all the endings will take more than a little thought and time.

Check out my [url=http://shoddypixels.com/2014/01/05/monster-loves-review/]full review[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198040905290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1388783476}
review: I've played Monster Loves You! a couple of times now.  It is a cute, bright, interactive story game where your actions from birth and actions/decisions you make while doing tasks determines the kind of monster you are going to be and your influence on other monsters and humanity.  Like others, the game is short, but it is a game I've enjoyed enough to play again.  It's something a bit different and easy going if you fancy a lazy gaming day ;) Will undoubtedly have another play through of it at some point :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973234029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1388792109}
review:
One thing you should know before picking this up, is that it's not a game in the traditional sense of the word. It's more of a choose-your-own-adventure kind of thing. There is no platforming, no questing, no inventory, no racing. And that's completely fine.

That said, if you've ever enjoyed books that allowed you to choose your own adventure, you're bound to love this. There are a lot of options and outcomes, all done in a cartoonish and clever style. Don't be fooled by the presentation though, this is not quite what you'd call a "kid's game".

While there is no voice acting, the options you're presented with all have distinct feeling to them, which plays great with idea of shaping your monster from a morsel to an Elder. The various personality traits - such as bravery, ferocity, kindness - increase or decrease depending on your choices. Your options for the final outcome are determined by how high or how low these traits actually are. This also gives MLY plenty fo replaybility, as there are plenty of different outcomes each granting an in-game emblem as well as an achievement. Great for trophy hunters.

I definitely recommend getting this if you're looking for something mellow and relaxing to pass time with. Each "run" is about 30-60 minutes long, depending on what scenarios you receive and how fast you read.

However, [b]know what you're getting into[/b]. I cannot stress this enough. Do not get this if you're looking to jump on platforms, or shoot things, or race vehicles - or do anything other than read and choose reactions to the situations presented. It does just this one thing, but it does it really well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994706233', 'num_games_owned': 1402, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1370979204}
review:
Garbage!

The whole thing feels about as boring as a tutorial to a character creation wizard. 
Its charming for about 5 minutes, until you realize that the entire "game" plays like the first 5 minutes.
I'm glad I made back the cost of the game by selling the Steam Trading Cards...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994239917', 'num_games_owned': 3172, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1410280547}
review: I'll be keeping this installed and visiting it often. I used to love the choose your own adventure books as a child, and that's what this game feels like. I have unlocked 5 of the 14 unique endings in this time. Each game takes around 30-40 minutes. I'll be revisiting to get the rest of the unique endings, but I think it will be much more enjoyable to do it over time rather then banging them all out and it feeling like a grind. I recommend this game, it's humerous and fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087167890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1388688005}
review:
Um jogo muito fofo, você escolhe suas próprias escolhas e são vários finais.
Muito bom pra passar o tempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066006250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1387956158}
review: A fun adventure, the entire game is text based, so know what you are getting ahead of time. As long as you have the patience to play, the story is quite incredible actually. However, if you are an achievement oriented person, you'll miss most of the game breezing through the story for the different endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081812560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1557103474}
review: Choose your own adventure game, how can you go wrong with that? Doesn't seem overly childish to me, I actually enjoyed this game quite a lot. If you enjoyed reading choose your own adventure books, then this game is right up your alley!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046629853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1698994735}
review: Il est trop chou ce jeu, de quoi vous entrainer à l'anglais et parcourir votre part de monstre en vous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050504334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1375753474}
review: This was my first decision game and i'm not sure if i liked it or not. I played for a while, but clearly got the same few results, shy of looking up how to unlock the last acheavements and pushing through clicking everything in the correct order to win acheavements it wasn't all that exciting. I wouldn't reccomend this to someone who has any other game in their library they want to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985209709', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1416205520}
review: Interesting idea, and the choices are definitely there. The time management vs. stat upgrade mechanic is much more flexible than, say, Long Live The Queen. The world is 100% fleshed out... which is why it is so disappointing that this game is so short. So much potential is wasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070405415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1417061125}
review: This is a cute little game with lots of different outcomes of the storyline according to your decisions throughout your monsters life!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986442930', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1423775417}
review:
A fun time waster with little space to take up on your hard drive, as simple as it looks you can easily decipher the icons that lay ahead of your path in the game, and with quite a few achievements gets you striving to figure out another ending or way to deal with things as a monster.
A great way to spend a few hours on while waiting or just wanting something to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980224884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1366182000}
review: This game was not even worth the time I spent wasting the money when I clicked the buy button. Maybe for others who enjoy such things. But the playstyle was far below what I expected from the description. Do not get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039593806', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1404762065}
review: If you love story driven games, then it's awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089530436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1419783010}
review: such a cute game :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198062344972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1511252621}
review: Not a game for everyone, but it does have a flavor of the old text game "Alter Ego", only with monsters, so you sometimes can only GUESS what the outcome is going to be with one of your choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052381502', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1421107583}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][b]TITOLO[/b][/th]
        [th][h1]Monster Loves You![/h1][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]RECENSIONE[/b][/td]
        [td]
Ringrazio Miky che mi ha regalato questo gioco tempo fa e questo mi permette ora di fare questa piccola recensione.

Diciamo che non sono esattamente un amante del genere indie, per quanto sporadicamente escano piccoli gioiellini da quel mondo di sviluppatori.

Sinceramente da un gioco con un titolo del genere non sapevo cosa aspettarmi, ma lo stile graphic novel mi ha attirato abbastanza.
Fortunatamente mi attendeva una bella sorpresa: questo gioco è una specie di GDR dove l'obiettivo principale sarà quello di cercare di dare una personalità al nostro personaggio, accompagnandolo fin dai primi passi che muoverete da mostriciattoli alla tragica quanto filosofica morte in pieno stile platonico (o alla possibile ascesa a "elder", un manipolo di mostri prescelti o per il rispetto ricevuto o per particolari abilità).

Ha una giocabilità abbastanza limitata in ogni caso e svariati finali.
Decisamente un gioco ben realizzato e molto divertente.

Consiglierei di prenderselo se mai entrasse in qualche bundle conveniente.

[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]VOTO[/b][/td]
        [td][h1]7/10[/h1][/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]
[table]

[i][h1]Nota:[/h1]Il voto finale di un titolo nelle mie recensioni tiene conto di vari fattori tra cui vengono considerati sopratutto: longevità, facilità nel reperimento del prodotto a un prezzo accessibile e in generale il rapporto qualità/prezzo secondo i miei standard[/i]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006478062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1510873007}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044652189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1515156150}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115517093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1389040819}
review: A cute and fun choose-your-own-adventure game. More replayability than I expected for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005475958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1373969852}
review:
I once though that any game that follows the suit of princess maker (in other words stats+event based games) is worth it's time. This game (along with another one which name I can't recall) have proven to me that I was wrong.

To make it short...

The game felt RAILED.
The events were boring.
The humor was terrible.
And the style is revolting.

No matter how bored you get this game is not worth the time, let alone the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116204694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1387656924}
review:
Eres un mounstrito que nace de una baba verde junto con otros mounstritos. Desde ese momento, tienes que hacer decisiones  que van definiendo tu alineamiento y tu personalidad. Primero eres un bebé, luego un preadolescente, luego adolescente, adulto y así sucesivamente hasta que mueres. Lo que hagas durante tu vida determinará cómo te recordará la gente.

¿Suena entretenido?

No lo es.

Es un juego aburrido y monótono ¡ni siquiera podría decir que es un juego!
Texto texto texto texto. Incluso si fuera sólo texto y buena historia, entonces sería interesante, pero a poco andar te darás cuenta que no importa lo que elijas, eso no cambiará en nada las condiciones para tus siguientes estadíos.
El juego suena "bonito", pero ni siquiera tiene muchos escenarios. 

"Monster loves you" te engaña dándote la falsa impresión que es un juego en la cual vas construyendo tu propia existencia, que tus actos determinarán un vuelco impredecible en la historia, que ocurrirán sucesos sorprendentes e interesantes. La verdad es que no. 

I didn't love this monster!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078270939', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1590688841}
review: WEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!! This game is ridiculous, silly, childish, and a whole lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071287681', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1370678373}
review: You would appreciate this game if you were a little kid. It's basically story time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045807099', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1535884660}
review: Very lovely outlook, nice mini game to play when travelling or just killing time. Not much different from dozens of others story-telling games, but when you're looking for something not too childish and still funny, this may worth to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025182617', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1487270764}
review: Pra que gosta de jogoas com uma boa historia Monster Loves You! pode ser uma boa opção para você. Você deve escolher entre multiplas ações que seu monstrinho vai tomar e dependendo da ação diferentes consequencias acontecerão, algumas lhe concedem pontos de personalidade que dão forma ao temperamento do seu monstro e julgam que caminho ele trilhara no futuro. A musica tambem muito boa e relaxante e com multiplos finais tem bastante conteúdo para você descobrir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086774333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1371746530}
review: monste arrr!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014677818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1373526000}
review: This game seems to have a fair number of positive reviews.I am unclear how it earned them. It is a text based game, in it's entirety. Which is not a problem for me, except that the text interactions FEEL random and undirected. You don't feel like you are making choices, which is in my opinion most of what this genre has to offer. Also the writing is... bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011820722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1387513572}
review: Nice art in this choose your own adventure, where choices are not always obvious and have significant impact on your progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067065075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1376787829}
review: If you like a game where every decision you make will have a repercussion on you than this game is for you. Do not expect state of the art graphics here. Artwork is pretty not fantastic. There's replayability factor. But you tend to get bored after the 3rd playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113405852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1387378986}
review: Really cute and fun. Awesome art and cool to just look at even. If you take the kind and righteous path, it reminded me a lot of Where The Wild Things Are. You'll like it if you're a kid at heart and enjoy stories and fairytales and nothing too challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045686602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1482962634}
review: Made me chuckle several times through the options in the story. Text driven voilence occurs but visually it's really kid friendly. And for the grownups it has the same underplayed humour as a pixar animated movie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081051064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1395856536}
review: Enjoyed it. Fun & entertaining for a quick game. Replayed it quite a few times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085407626', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1388031982}
review:
Monster Loves You is a game much like an interactive storybook where you get to choose the decision of things that happen! To kill or not to kill , to steal or not to steal. Your actions decide whether humans hate/change their opinions of your race, The monsters. Your actions could spark a war, could create world peace or send you running forever from the humans! If you liked reading, this game is for you! I personally enjoyed it of course!

6/10
-WinterApple

author: {'steamid': '76561197994233104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1386791152}
review: Gioco molto divertente e originale, che riporta un pò alla mente le care vecchie avventure testuali. Fondalmentalmente si tratta di delineare la crescita del proprio mostro attraverso scelte riguardanti mini avventure, dialoghi...(tutto rigorosamente testuale). Non è un gioco per tutti, ma lo consiglio

author: {'steamid': '76561198058974141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1386241205}
review:
This game is perfect for kids.
Although I'm an adult (with undoubtedly childish soul) I find the game very fun.
This is like an interactive story book.
You can be good, you can be bad.
The art is beautiful, and it's rather colorful & very nice for a game with monster theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027112798', 'num_games_owned': 2426, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1386569614}
review: "Monster loves you" is a text based game, an interactive story both for adults who enjoy reading children's books and kids. It's a wonderful storyline with nice music and great humor (btw English here is quite difficult for those who have it as a second language). Monsters are odd and incredibly cute, they will melt your heart and make you smile during the whole game. You can play as one and choose your character, behavior and destiny. Welcome to the cutest monster-world ever! And remember - monster loves you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979157765', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1372211583}
review: Ten bucks seems a bit high for what amounts to an electronic, illustrated Choose Your Own Adventure™ book. I'd definitely grab it on sale, though. I somehow managed to sink 10 hours into it without even realizing and plan to dive back in for the other achievements -- and I'm not usually motivated by achievements. I guess that says something?

author: {'steamid': '76561198036083292', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1377655294}
review: This amazing game may be only a text game, but is a game that you won't get bored of in 10 minutes! But still is a short game and can get through the game quickly. It reminds me of  choose your own path books because you can do just that, except with much more detail and choices to choose from. Maybe if they added some 2D graphics into the game to see what is actually happening, this game would be a whole lot better. There is alot of reading in this game, therefore if you or your child does not like to read, this game might not be the game for them.Very creative and highly recommended to children.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986853226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1373256509}
review: If you really like adventure games, you might like this. Wasn't wierd enough for me, and there isn't really enough content or options to justify multiple playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034468853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1385879911}
review: If you are looking for a "simple" game as in no crazy spells or combos and a few good laughs this is a good game.  Don't expect more than a few play through, personaly I've done about four, but you'll enjoy it, seriously you will.  Well that is as long as you enjoy reading; and questioning your morality from time to time. Best of luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026977566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1385868657}
review: My daughter says this is a good game.  I think it is amusing as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993860859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1364108400}
review: 100% disappointed. I thought it would be a game with actual game play, but it's just a tedious questionnaire. It should have been a free online Flash game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035652946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1382301780}
review: This is a really cute game for kids.  There is a bit of reading involved and some crude humor, but my kids loved it.  I played with them quite a bit.    The multiple outcomes makes it very replayable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005274935', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1363935600}
review:
Monster Loves You! Does what it does well, but it doesn’t do a whole lot. It is a charming, simple and cute game that won’t cost you a lot but also won’t last very long. If you’re looking for a decent visual novel, this is certainly an interesting one to try out, if just for the concept of playing as a little monster. The art style itself is great albeit lacking in animations, the dialogue is quite amusing at times and there are quite a few choices to make that lead to different endings. 
If that is what you’re looking for, then this is worth a shot. If you are looking for something with more sustenance or context, or simply more gametime, then this will definitely not do. 

Full review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7MI8aMAz0DI

author: {'steamid': '76561197979849365', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1485129324}
review: This is a GREAT game. It's a wonderful relaxed and casual game. There are no timers, no bells and whistles, no incoming hoardes of zombies or bullets to count. It's much more like a choose-your-own-adventure book, monster style! From the very beginning of your monster's existence you choose what actions to take in response to various situations, which shapes and forms who this monster is, who they will become, and even the very fate of the monster race! There are so many different combinations and possibilities this game has a lot of replay value. Plus, the music is great, and the pictures are fun. I can see this game being fun for younger audiences as well as long as they have a sense of humor and a parent guiding them along with wise explanations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971074683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1384751604}
review: This is a cute, but not an especially good game.  It plays like a choose your own adventure, so once you have seen a particular "story option" it will always play out the same and there is nothing like action in the game.  An interesting exercise and I don't regret getting it, but I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005569195', 'num_games_owned': 1887, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1599234037}
review:
Textová hra o malé příšerce, jak roste a dospěje … pokud tedy dospěje.
A jak se zachová? Ovlivní nějak nadcházející hrozící styk s lidskou civilizací?
To vše je na hráči co se stane. A jestli se vůbec něco stane.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993316069', 'num_games_owned': 4937, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1370992700}
review: I really enjoyed the concept, a choose your own adventure where not only do your choices determine your development, but your environment's too. However, the game is just way too short. I reached the "best" ending in under two hours with next to no effort. The $10 entry is much too expensive for this fairly shallow experience. I do appreciate the honesty by using the Casual label though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082543313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1527610356}
review:
I love this.Monster in this game really cute.
And many choices to lead your monster personality

author: {'steamid': '76561197997784543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1562367540}
review: For all your monster needs, It's funny and charming.  A great way to spend half an hour at a time.  And remember, you never saw me throw the kitten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036600335', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1383944402}
review: A cute, brilliant little gem of a game. The replayability of it does diminish after a couple times through... unless you were to only play it once a month or so (It's a pretty short game). I would say it's also a great game for kids. Easy to get 100% for achievement hunters. It's not for you if you don't like to read though (did you read this far? If not, don't get this game).

author: {'steamid': '76561197994574201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1433142420}
review:
If you recall the old "Choose Your Own Adventure" or perhaps the "Lone Wolf" game books from the '70's and '80's, then you're on the right track for this game.

After a few playthroughs, you'll probably start to recognize some of the options.  This is partially offset by the fact that there appear to be more options that will appear in a single playthrough, and that you won't be able to ever pick all of the options every time either.  The inclusion of Achievements and Cards give some added depth, but some of the Achievements appear to be based on failing in some scenarios so it's not always apparent what might need to be done for the Achievement Hunter.

The soundtrack is minimalist, but the solo accoustic guitar  is pleasant and quite nice, and matches the style of the artist very well.  A glaring omission, here, is the lack of a purchaseable soundtrack (at the time of this writing).  The artwork is quite lovely, and the whimsical nature of it nicely matches the intent of the game.  It is static, with only a few things that move -- mostly the clickable hotspots so that it's apparent what will actually give a response from the game -- but it feels like a callback to old adventure or even the old solely text-based games so I don't find that a bad thing.

The writing is excellent, though you'll most likely find yourself skipping some sectiions as the become more familiar.  It may be a good game to play with your developing reader, though I highly recommend you play it a few times, yourself, as some of the game can wander to the dark or violent (You ARE a monster, after all.) and your mileage may vary as to what's appropriate for your own child.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967992446', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 543, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1383712792}
review: Hey, did you like the part of Mass Effect where you choose responses to get Universe Savior or Bad Space Cop points? Because that's what this game feels like to me. Except there's five kinds of stats and a mid level boss dependent entirely on dice rolls. It is based around living the life of a monster from birth to death, but it doesn't go far enough with it. Because of that, all the conversation forks are based around me asking myself 'Do I want more Furious Fred or Smarty Sammy points?'. It's kinda fun to experience once, maybe twice if you choose to sacrifice your monster at the midpoint of the game, and after that it's just about rote achievement hunting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975702219', 'num_games_owned': 2030, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1384904302}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971109813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1383782835}
review:
Simples e muito repetitivo. Apesar de ter "14 finais diferentes", a diferenciação se resume em escolher os diálogos A-B-C, ao invés de B-A-C ou C-A-B.... As respostas não são muito dependentes das decisões que você tome no começo do jogo.
Pelo menos os diálogos são engraçados.

review:
Monster doesn't love you, 
Monster just wants to take your money, engage in a series of psychological games to destabilise your moral ground, force you to grow up, and develop your individual character before sending you to your death.

Might as well get married.

review: เกมแนว Text Adventure ที่ต้องตัดสินใจเลือกการกระทำเพื่อแสดงถึงตัวตนที่ตนเองต้องการ ไปจนเป็นสัตว์ประหลาดในแบบของตัวคุณเองและพบฉากจบได้แบบต่างๆ จะว่าไปการเล่นแนวนี้ผมเคยเล่นตั้งแต่สมัยที่ยังใช้เป็นหนังสือ เขียนเล่าเรื่อง เมื่อถึงจุดต้องตัดสินใจก็มีตัวเลือกถ้าเลือกข้อแรกเปิดไปหน้า 5 ถ้าเลือกตัวเลือก 2 เปิดไปหน้า 10 เป็นต้น ซึ่งเกมนี้ก็หยิบรูปแบบการเล่นนี้มาเล่าเรื่องการสร้างชีวิตสัตว์ประหลาดและเหตุการณ์ที่ต้องพบเจอมากมาย เพียงแต่ในเกมนำเสนอในรูปแบบที่มีสีสันสดใส ดูดีในแบบการ์ตูนฝรั่งๆ จะว่าไปเหมือนเกมให้เด็กฝึกอ่านนิทาน สำหรับคนชอบอ่านนิทานแนวแฟนตาซีแบบสัตว์ปรหลาดที่มีฉากจบหลายทางเลือกน่าจะชอบ คิดซะว่าซื้อ e-book แบบ Interactive ได้ก็คงคุ้มแล้วคับสำหรับราคาตอนนี้ ($5) สำหรับผมชิลมากๆ กับเกมแนวนี้ ยิ่งวาดการ์ตูนได้ดูดี สวยงามยิ่งชอบไปไหญ่ 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2586, 'playtime_forever': 2230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2029, 'last_played': 1422266477}
review: A real choose your own adventure style game, really short though and quite wordy, really its more of a visual novel than a game, but I like it, plus it has around 14 endings. Its somthing to do if your bored seeing as ive gotten one of the endings in less than 15 minutes you could quickly run through it while waiting for somthing else, just be prepared to read since thats mostly what you will be doing reading and clicking, but overall you dont see many of these style games released in this day and age so its somthing to check out at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034678941', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1412040755}
review:
It could be said that this is more like a "choose your path" adventure book than an actual VIDEO GAME... but I really like it for that reason. The music and art style are whimsical and the story is kid-friendly but it never felt too childish for me.

Monster Loves You! is a fantastic excuse to exercise your reading muscles and let your inner monster out to 'play.' This is a great reminder that games don't have to feature cutting edge graphics or wanton violence to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050403071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1428152491}
review:
I was disappointed from this game.
I thought it would be more of an RPG, but it isn't. You just read a lot of text and select the life path you want to take by clicking on more text. it's cute, but that's it.
I finished it after 30 minutes and don't feel like starting over. Should have read the gamers reviews first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043465750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1379949016}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a cute new look at the coming of age story
told from the perspective of a newly born monster and the many trials that face them as they come of age

Players are given the fluff of a situation and presented with a number of responses to choose from, these choices reflect certain traits that the players monster can grow stronger in and several choices require a certain amount of these stats to unlock as the monster develops and grows

However this stat system often rewards simply selecting actions based on what stat will be improved, rather than making each decision uniquely

Irregardless, Monster Loves You! is a simple, text based life sim with a unique perspective and style worth at least checking out and good for a few play throughs

author: {'steamid': '76561198022410857', 'num_games_owned': 2754, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1650454284}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053616460', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1412990284}
review:
Grade: 92/100
Difficulty: Very easy to play; moderately difficult to get the different end-game outcomes.
Pros: Silly humor; some geeky easter eggs to find if you pay attention; lots of combinations to make each playthrough different from the last.
Cons: Not as engaging as it could be story-wise; many choices are very non-intuitive if you are attempting to reach a particular end-game goal. 
Replayable: Only until you've attained all the possible end-game outcomes -- by that point, you probably know all the game dialogue by heart. But it's casual fun until then!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049441093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1376076857}
review: Neobvykle zpracovaná point'n'click adventura, kde si tvoříte příšerku, způsobem starých RPG textovek. Ve hře je malý náznak RPG, kde díky postupu tvořením příběhu vám naskakujou dlě vašeho výběru k určité vlastnosti příšerky body. Je potzřeba umět dobře anglicky, pokud si to chcete alespoň trošku užít. "Pařba" na přibližně 2 hodiny reálného času a je spíše na odreagování. Hra ale nic nového nepřináší a kromě milého audiovizuálního zpracování, a 1001 způsobů jak si uvařit příběh nic na ní zajímavého nehledejte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972784007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1382637209}
review: This game was fun.  It's basically a pick-a-path game where you try to pick choices to manipulate various stats (from monster traits to world relationships).  The long term goal is to play the game multiple times and get to all the different endings.  Takes around an hour to power through, and funny all the way. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197963688296', 'num_games_owned': 1534, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1375574718}
review: This game just melted my black heart and made me feel warm and squishy all over!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013486597', 'num_games_owned': 2222, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1384748399}
review:
You emerge from the womb presented with three dialog options. We’re not talking ‘red blue or green’ and we’re certainly not talking ‘attack defend or route.’ Your choices are some meandering fancy like “scoop up slime, hold your breath, or call for help.” Welcome to Monster Loves You, where dialog choices comprise the whole of the gameplay. Revel in stat bonuses for choosing the right option —it’s always the right option— and accrue new dialog choices based on your newfound stats. But watch out! Don’t get enough stats —it’s never enough— and you will unknowingly close yourself off from other dialog options.

If you think that choosing an option is actual gameplay, this is the game for you! It’s like Final Fantasy X’s combat with none of the consequences or combat. If you want to be mentally stimulated then this is not the Cart Life for you. I think this game is actually for kids. Like the literal kind of children, not the autismal man kind. Cute 4 girls but you know what? Girls want to play a video game. You know casual appeal of Bejewel and Peggel where you choose a touch and stuff goes? In Monster Loves You there is choose a touch but then you just choose more and more touch. Monster does not even love you until late-game. 

Has:
- Artistic Direction
- Be your own monster!
- Touch or mouse. It’s all good.

Lacks:
- Gameplay Element (really dropped the ball on this one)
- Animation
- Sokoban Block Puzzle

Winblows 8 Touch Screen Bonus - You are not an iPad!

2 / 10 Boring as a generous bag of wet nails.
What kind of monster will you roll? Care enough to continue playing to find out!

-- Cosmopolitan

0 / 0 "This game doesn’t have any GUTS!!!"  --Shounen Jump
“We give it a Three..... “  --X-Play Adam Sessler
3/10 “Scrub ass game for indie nooblords.” -- IGN
9/10 “Fun for ages 10 and down”  --Fisher-Price
2 inches  "Throw ‘er back in!”  --Bait & Tackle

author: {'steamid': '76561197961093505', 'num_games_owned': 4612, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1370996314}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998348465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1373440319}
review:
MLY isn't so much a game as it's an interactive story, like a Choose Your Own Adventure book. That doesn't mean it's bad, but if you're looking for frenetic gameplay, you won't find it here. Instead, everything in this game hinges on your decisions and how you live your life as a monster.

If I had to compare MLY to a video game, the closest thing would be a very, very old game called Alter Ego (from 1986, not the 2010 game of the same name). The similarities are striking, with the exception that in MLY you play a monster in a fictional world whereas in AE you were a male or female human in the real world.

 Although MLY's interface is better than AE's, it lacks the same depth. In AE, you didn't just make decisions and get older, but you could get an education, hold down a job, get married, get pregnant (if you were female), die prematurely, and so on.

I wish MLY had included something like those options as it would've increased the replay value a lot.  That said, it's still an entertaining and unusual experienceand, so if you get it on sale (which I did) then you'll get your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995630679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1374255960}
review:
A game that is purely text-based. It is very similar to the old game Alter ego (which you can play for free here: http://www.playalterego.com/alterego). I really love games in which you are responsible for the actions you make. There are every new quest new choices to make. If you decide to be brave you will receive +bravery points. This will have influence on option that are available later on in the game. For example if you want to impress certain Monsters or Humans you need to roll two dices (based on yoru bravery) to see if you are succesful.

It is very easy to build up your personality points, and some options are really obvious what the outcome will be. The quests results are a bit predictable at times. But nevertheless it is a cute game which i enjoyed very much. Although for a very short time. You can finish this game in under an hour. Of course there are many other paths to take and endings to see.

Pros:
- Decisions, decisions, everything comes down to decisions.
- Humorous and fun to read.
- Different endings.

Cons:
- Very short.
- Decisions have only influence on your personality not on the overal storyline.
- Text-based.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016124710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1669756707}
review: Play it, it'll be amusing. For those of us that need a break from FPS and all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972390763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1607793790}
review:
The whole game is a big dialog tree. You're presented with a situation and you choose one of the 2 or 3 responses to the situation until you evertually reach one of the 12 endings.

Unfortunately, there's very little random variation between games and choices early in the game affect your stats but not the scenarios you encounter later. After two playthroughs, you'll have encountered most of the scenarios even if you make very different choices on your next playthrough... so there's little incentive to try for the other 11 endings after you've seen your first.

The hour or so of content here makes it hard to justify the purchase price.
