author: {'steamid': '76561198010236168', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1372378499}
review:
7.5/10
A nice multiple choice game with a high replay value due to its actual shortness (5 to 15 minutes per playthrough, depending on certain choices and the amount of text you get to read)

But that's okay, because then you can start all over, make different choices and get completely different results:
• Lecture fellow monsters about the dangers of human tools OR convince them that not everything human-made is THAT bad.
• Comfort a grieving woman OR just eat her.
• Scare away birds from some bread crumbs and eat those OR follow the crumbs to a strange little house made of gingerbread. *hint hint*
• End the feud between monsters and humans OR go to war and either get killed, enslaved or succeed and become the new ruler of the world.

All of this is just "shown" in textual form (nope, no animated cutscenes and no running around, just reading, choosing, clicking, reading, choosing and clicking), but it's still a lot of fun when you get to read the results of your doings:
________________________

[Eat some monkey poop.]

WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT!?
________________________

Sadly, the best choices will get stuck in your head and you'll just click through everything in less than 5 minutes before you start a new game again, but that's only the case if you don't care about the different endings, because getting those is the actual challenge (which adds even more replay value).

author: {'steamid': '76561198048927816', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1621236006}
review: Cute little choose your own adventure style game that feels like a nicely written children's story. It's mainly text based with cute artwork and funny scenarios. It even has some touching moments in it. There are 14 different outcomes to your overall choices in the game and while a little repetitive after a while, it's still a fun playthrough at least a few times as you only get to select a handful of situations to act out per level and there will be some you didn't get to try out at each time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011488876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1371964050}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972086395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1440722457}
review: There's no explosions, no ultra-violence, no flimsy excuse for a sci-fi back-drop. Just a good ol' choose-your-own-path text adventure. You play as a monster and you have to live your life one goofy day at a time. Humorous and light-hearted, this is a good change of pace from all the shooting and fighting games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023199807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1364281200}
review: Fun game to kill time. Basically you get to choose your own fait and that of the monsters and humans, by making choices. WIll it end in war or peace? The choice is yours. Every different outcome also comes with a Steam achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049584723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1371674989}
review: I enjoyed playing through this neat little text adventure. Although each replay presents you with the same exact quesions and scenarios, there is enough variety in them to keep it interesting for a few replays, especially if you shoot for different outcomes and act differently each time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054387451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1603307605}
review:
A Choose-Your-Own-Adventure type game, where you travers through the whole circle of a monsters life.
Every choice and action changes your personality and your skills. As you raise to adulthood, you get the choice to either ascend and become an elder, to continue our adventures (you get tested each time!) 
or you can simply become the ooze of the spawn vat, so your legacy lifes on in
the new-born monsterlings.

It's an interesting game, with more responsibility in your actions and reasoning + cute and charming visuals and multible endings. One of my favorites!
You should give it a try, so Monsters CAN Love you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971084309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1371287189}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001490367', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1372244862}
review: Monster Loves You presented you with great storyline and fun adventures. It's full of sense of unique humors. Each choice youi chooses will effect to overall status and how your monster look like. It's small visual novel, but it's pretty fun to try on different path and track on their destiny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078125291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1387566696}
review:
Monsters loves you is like those books you where forced to read when you where in elementary school.  Where you could make an decision of what you wanted to do. For example: If you want to fight the enemy then go to page 34 if you want to run away go to page 75. 

In other words, if you like to read then this game is probably something for you. For me who hates and always have hated to read then this aren't in my alley. BUT (theres actually a but), at the end of the story you recieve an "award" or a "stample" of what people will remember you for when you decent. I actually, to my suprise, found this kinda exciting, I therefore decided to give this game a new change and play through it again to see what stample I would get then. 

To my disapointment the stories was way to similar, on my third go I mostly just needed to read the action buttons to now what stood in the main text.  I think they could have made this game a whole lot bether if they made different stories and gave us more action buttons to chose from. I also miss some few film clips or some sort of movement, there is an fancy color background with some monsters on it, but thats it. 

This game is basically as reading a book. Thats why I will only recomend this game to those of you who enjoy reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961275725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1371413969}
review: Though more of an interactive novel than a 'real' game, Monster Loves You is still a fun few minutes' diversion. Its setting is well realized, by turns funny, touching and even upsetting, its story told as a collection of tiny scenarios whose decision points shape your monster's strengths and weaknesses, and might eventually even determine the fate of Monsterkind and their Human neighbors. It's structured so that you can't experience every smaller story in a single play-through, but multiple play-throughs are rewarded with a number of different endings. And achievements. Can't forget those.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993615138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1619192542}
review: Its a funny choice based time waster. It can be as quick as 20 minutes or as long as an hour if you're really in a moral pickle. Most of it will make you laugh. Some of it will make you sit there and think about it for a minute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026480591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1505270664}
review: I found Monster Loves You to be a fun game that is rather silly as well. The choices you make do matter and effect your endings and you can get multiple endings out of the game. Your monster that you play as can look completely rediculous (in a good way) but does not always match the storyline. "You shred Nash Nash with your claws." But a decent number of monsters that you end up with actually have no claws, sometimes not even arms at all! This can be frusturating but it in no ways makes the game unplayable, at least for me. Having a blob for a monster that is supposed to be able to climb, claw, bite and run around is a bit disapointing. I did enjoy the game very much so and will play it again every once in a while just for the memories and fun even though I would know EVERYTHING about the game and have unlocked every ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020516970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1371008273}
review: This game isn't really much of a game. The gameplay, so to speak, is reading text and selecting amongst a number of choices. These choice can affect your stats, making them go higher or lower. The goal is to get your stats high so you can pass a number of rng checks to advance in the later parts of the game. Unfortunately, I didn't find any of the events particularly interesting, nor was the progression of the game. I would recommend this as perhaps a kid's game, but nothing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970420322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1532026676}
review: I was pretty underwhelmed with this game. I wouldn't really classify it as Adventure, RPG, or Simulation (as Steam does) but Indie and Casual sure fit. author: {'steamid': '76561198055630802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1371166661}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970803173', 'num_games_owned': 2852, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1371235240}
review:
Monster Loves You is a surprisingly cute "Choose Your Own Adventure"  type of game, kind of like the old books you could get.
You start off being born, and then go through the life cycle of your monster, with each decision changing the stats of your monster.
Approx a dozen endings, depending upon your actions and choices throughout the game.
A fun little distraction, I was happy to pay the half price sale price, but I don't think I'd pay full price for this game, even though it was quite fun.

(Incidentally, the full price is £6.99 whereas the sale price is £3.49. )

author: {'steamid': '76561198044241335', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1636914529}
review:
Pretty fun little illustrated text-based adventure game.
A full playthrough takes around 30 minutes, but there's 14 different endings to be seen and each new playthrough is different (mostly).
The game has a good chunk of monster-flavoured humour thrown into it and most of the characters found in childhood stories can be encountered (and eaten!).
If you're still doubting wether you'd enjoy this sort of game, buy it when it goes on sale.
Otherwise, go for it! It's only 10 bucks anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981052853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1371053687}
review:
これは森に住む１匹のモンスターの人生（？）に干渉し、健やかな成長を見守るアドベンチャーゲームです。
あなたの選択次第で、モンスターは性格も見た目も様々に変化していきます。

モンスターが訪れる街や村には冒険が満ち溢れています。一つ一つの冒険があなたのモンスターを成長させていくでしょう。

１プレイはそこまで長くはないので、サクッと終わることができますが、１０を超えるマルチエンディングで色んな結末を楽しむことが出来ると思います。



たぶんね。
英語分からないんでストーリーが良く分からんとです。

でもモンスターへの愛があれば問題なし。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992567771', 'num_games_owned': 2159, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1372708673}
review:
Monster Loves You ist eine Art interaktives Gamebook. Man ist ein Monster und begleitet seinen Charakter von der Geburts bis zum Tod. Dazwischen gibt es jede Menge Geschichten und Abenteuer zu erleben. In diesen Geschichten und Abenteuern kann man selbst entscheiden was man macht oder wie man sich verhält. Je nach dem gibt es dann Punkte für verschiedene Charakterattribute wie Mut, Intelligenz, Ehrlichkeit usw. Dazu sollte man auch noch Respekt sammeln. Beim Tod wird dann alles ausgerechnet und je nach dem was man erlebt hat und was man getan hat bekommt man ein anderes Ende und eine andere Medaille. Das Ziel des Spiels ist es alle Medaillen zu sammeln. Für jede Medaille bekommt man ein Achievment. 
Die gezeichneten Hintergründe sind schön und die Musik ist je nach der Situation langsam und entspannend oder schnell und hektisch. Es bewegt sich aber nichts, alle Grafiken sind starr.

Monster Loves You ist ein tolles Spiel für alle die auch Gamebooks interessant finden, alle anderen werden es nur langweilig finden. 

Man sollte gut Englisch können um alles zu verstehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982964370', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1371255470}
review:
A cute little choose your own adventure game.  It's strange in a way as it kind of deals with certain adult concepts like death.  It's more than a mere kid's game, I'll give it that.  It's got a lot of different endings, and there's probably a lot of content to it, but I found myself having enough after a few runthroughs.

The game's concept is solid, I just wish there was a little more to it.  That said, it's still fun for a good bit, and there are some genuinely emotional moments, which is impressive for this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995467803', 'num_games_owned': 1278, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1371120232}
review:
Monster loves you eh?
   Yet another odd game but that doesn't make it a bad game. You start of in a cauldron of goo and work your way up to adulthood. The game itself is as short as that description. The first time I finished it it took me just under an hour. That's the main drawback of the game, short as hell.
   Monster loves you is a Visual Novel. The art although I regret not getting to see much of it during the story, mainly because the dialog boxes covered the images is what you would find in a children's book but not to childish to stop anyone else from playing it in that regard. 
   What do you get to do? All you do is click dialog boxes. What do these boxes contain? Text of course. Just joking. This is the core of the game. You grow up based on the choices you made starting from day 1. The shortness of the game is countered by a decent ammount of choices that you get.
   Verdict time. I for one got this on a -50% sale and got exactly what I signed up for. An amusing story that did not drag on to the point clicking a dialog box becomes a chore. I couldn't wait to click and read what my choice did and let me tell you, some of the choices you get to make are either hillarious on their own or the result is.
   If I were to give it a score I would go for around 8 / 10, and as always that's the grade according to how much they achieved and how much more they could have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091091729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1378619441}
review: It's impossible to not smile while playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060323564', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1373210398}
review:
Monster Loves You! - необычная текстовая адвенчура с красивым оформлением! Проживите жизнь монстра, от рождения до старости, и принимайте решения, которые будут влиять на мир Монстров и Людей.

Так как это текстовая адвенчура, то для понимания и прохождения игры нужно хорошо владеть английским языком...

author: {'steamid': '76561197992202335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1501116333}
review: This game is Amazingly cute. I have to say I dont think I have played anything like this before. It was more like an interactive story and reminded me almost of pick a path books I read as a kid. I think there more commonly referred to as Choose Your Own Adventure books. It was short and sweet only took about an hour to go from start to finish. But I am already ready to do it again. I got it on sale for 5 bucks and have to say has put at least five dollars worth of a smile on my face. So if you like cute stories that really give you the option of how you want them to go and who you want to be. Your gonna wanna pick this up and check it out.  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006917383', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1370979063}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969752619', 'num_games_owned': 5406, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1370656000}
review:
A cute and enjoyable Choose-Your-On-Advneture style game with stats.

In the different stages of you life as a monster, you are presented with short missions/stories where you choice of action will determine which stat, if any, gets a boost. Later in "life", the stat will determine if you will continue to live or die, how well Elders are listening to your advice and what the outcome of the inevitable meeting between Humans and Monsters is going to be (also if you get a career as a disguised neuro surgeon among the humans or not!)

Each lifecycle takes between 20-40 minutes to complete. Later ones take a bit longer if you are going for specific outcomes, as you suddenly need to plan ahead.

After playing a lifecycle 3 times, I started noticing a lot of repeated missions/stories, and while the writing is pretty good and quite funny, the repeats are my only real gripe about this game, as it turns an otherwise very nice casual title into a grind for the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962402602', 'num_games_owned': 2595, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1370577290}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989851516', 'num_games_owned': 2785, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1688597050}
review: This game is a waste of time and money. Don't buy it, under any circumstances! It has no animations whatsoever. This is a game of decisions, all you have to do is to make decisions that will affect your growth as a monster. You will do this by pressing dialog buttons, and that's all. I love the graphics though ... anyhow this is my worst acquisition on steam. (3 for the graphic style) 3/10

review: Short game, but fun to play. You are a monster born from the slime, and you grow... and make decisions. That's it, all the gameplay is just clicking on the decisions and getting different outcomes. Boring? Not for a second! It's great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021303734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1365490800}
review: This game is really cute, and the first playthrough is delightful. However, it would have benefited from allowing save games so you could save-scum your way into many of the endings (without having to start over each time). The transition animation between menus really got to me after a while too. So, I don't think it's worth $10, but if it's on sale it might be worth it.

review: It is not exactly what i thought it was going to be. is nice for a point and click i guess. i am not a big fan of them. will leave it installed for my wife to play seeing she is a huge point and click fan. if you like point and clicks and games you can decide how it ends then you will like this. if you do not enjoy point and clicks or soft music for sleeping then this sint the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1370377637}
review:
Monster Loves You! is a graphical text adventure where you raise a little monster. You can 'level up' your monster in several categories by going on 'adventures' (little stories, in terms of gameplay). As you get older you start thinking about your relationship with humans. Are they evil or good ? It's up to you to decide how you want to play. 

The developers found a nice, clever way to tell a story where you decide the outcome. There are multiple endings (14 if the achievements aren't lying) so there's more than enough replay value here. One playthrough should take you about an hour.
A cute little game !

[Rating: 72/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027547845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1499576825}
review: A run of this game takes very little time to take, usually around three quarters of an hour, but it has a lot of replayability. Recommended for those who like visual novels and Choose-Your-Own-Adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004358564', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1370388065}
review: Imagine someone made a Tamagotchi style adventure game where you had to choose the path of Macbeth or Elizabeth Bennet but from the perspective of a monster.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994570583', 'num_games_owned': 3045, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1404688336}
review: This is a little gem of a game, and I don't say that lightly. It's like baby's first RPG/sim hybrid, a way to whet your appetite before tackling denser games like anything by Black Chicken Studios or heavier visual novels like Analog. But it also has its own merits. The writing is smart and lends itself equally to humor and insight, and occasionally flashes of existential horror, because why not. Do keep in mind that the game IS short and my main criticism is that replayability is hampered by how few scenelets really show up in the storyline. But I'm keeping an eye on this title. Fixes seem to be made pretty frequently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019644439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1415414735}
review:
This game is fun, funny, and ridiculous in all the best ways.  The art is fabulous and the writing full of wit.  Do you save your fellow monster baby from drowning, watch him die slowly with untempered fascination, or consume his delicious soon-to-be corpse?  Do you defend the human child from those dastardly bullies, chortle at his delightful tears, or treat them all as a walking feast?  

Be kind, be clever, be brave, be fierce.  Protect your loved ones or push them in the mud to watch them cry.  Break things, fix things, figure out how this quirky world works.  EAT EVERYTHING.  

This game goes fast, but its replay value is great enough to get hours of entertainment out of it.  My only caveat is that there are currently a number of bugs, but the developers are aware and quickly churning out fixes.  If you wait, they'll probably be all better, but if you wait, you may miss the release sale.  Then again, I'd say its worth the price either way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024253308', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 574, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1370471982}
review:
Αν ψάχνεστε για βαθύ gameplay, το Monster Loves You! δεν είναι σε καμία περίπτωση για εσάς. Είναι ένα πολύ καλογραμμένο, σπαρταριστό παραμύθι, που θα μπορούσε κάλλιστα να λειτουργήσει και ως εκπαιδευτικό software για μικρά παιδιά. Η "εξομοίωση τέρατος" υλοποιείται απλοϊκά αλλά με τρόπο απόλυτα διασκεδαστικό. Στην ουσία, εδώ υπάρχουν τα θεμέλια για ένα βαθύτατο management παιχνίδι, αλλά η εταιρεία σκόπιμα διάλεξε να σκαρώσει κάτι εύκολο, γρήγορο και εξαιρετικά προσβάσιμο.

Μπορεί η τιμή του να είναι ελαφρώς τσιμπημένη (ειδικά αν σκοπεύετε να ζήσετε μονάχα μια ζωή σαν τέρας) αλλά το τελικό αποτέλεσμα είναι γοητευτικότατο. Αν έχετε έστω και υποψία αδυναμίας στο προαναφερθέν choose your own adventure φορμάτ, θα απολαύσετε κάθε λεπτό που θα περάσετε μαζί με τους χνουδερούς, κερασφόρους φίλους σας στο δάσος. Σε έναν ιδανικό κόσμο, θα είχαμε τριάντα παιχνίδια σαν κι αυτό κάθε χρόνο. Και αφήστε την EA και τα microtransactions της να φωνάζουν.

Διαβάστε περισσότερα στο www.ragequit.gr

author: {'steamid': '76561198020275445', 'num_games_owned': 3628, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1370664465}
review:
I was a kind monster which doesn't eat children. Humans liked us, we pretty much liked humans too. Well, it doesn't always bring good results if other monsters don't respect you so much. I guess war never changes. Or does it? (Umm, it's Duty Calls again.)

Awesome game. Or a visual novel. Name it how you want, but all you need to know is that guys at Dejobaan were working on it. A+.

review: Ehh. Here are some spoilers about the gameplay. It is mainly a visual novel. If you were expecting 3D graphics. Well sorry maybe perhaps in a remake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975051410', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1685872666}
review: What a game! So simple and yet so great.  Take all the glamor and game play away from the walking dead, and you're left with decisions, consequence and a long term outcome.  Throw a little child like humor in along with some classic movie quotes, and you have a game that will leave you smiling time and time again.  It doesn't take long to finish, but you should get many play throughs out of it.  If you really like this kind of game, its worth 10, otherwise you can get it on sale for 5 soon enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025012741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1363676400}
review:
This is an adorable choose your own adventure game in which you can twist the heads of squirrels or save little children from being lost in alleys. Or both.

I am apparently incapable of being an unkind Monster. I think it is strange I am much nicer as a Monster than as a People.
